 </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 24 Sep 2021 00:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/21/What-Should-You-Do-if-Your-Parents-Disapprove-of-Your-Relationship-Step-4.jpg/aid12609679-v4-728px-What-Should-You-Do-if-Your-Parents-Disapprove-of-Your-Relationship-Step-4.jpg","linkMd5":"85ddf33c9240e24a8531f5ec1a2006fb","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn63@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-27-202_05ee30d07fea3320.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":93662,"destBytes":63076,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/21/What-Should-You-Do-if-Your-Parents-Disapprove-of-Your-Relationship-Step-4.jpg/aid12609679-v4-728px-What-Should-You-Do-if-Your-Parents-Disapprove-of-Your-Relationship-Step-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn63@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-27-202_05ee30d07fea3320.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/93/What-Are-Some-Topics-to-Talk-About-when-Meeting-His-Parents-Step-1.jpg/aid12609679-v4-728px-What-Are-Some-Topics-to-Talk-About-when-Meeting-His-Parents-Step-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn59@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-40-165_1bb73672ee24216d.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/ce/What-Are-Some-Topics-to-Talk-About-when-Meeting-His-Parents-Step-2.jpg/aid12609679-v4-728px-What-Are-Some-Topics-to-Talk-About-when-Meeting-His-Parents-Step-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn80@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-41-466_d6238a84675110ad.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d4/What-Are-Some-Topics-to-Talk-About-when-Meeting-His-Parents-Step-3.jpg/aid12609679-v4-728px-What-Are-Some-Topics-to-Talk-About-when-Meeting-His-Parents-Step-3.jpg":null,"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0f/What-Are-Some-Topics-to-Talk-About-when-Meeting-His-Parents-Step-4.jpg/aid12609679-v4-728px-What-Are-Some-Topics-to-Talk-About-when-Meeting-His-Parents-Step-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn45@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-41-345_7181c60119178b35.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/92/What-Are-Some-Topics-to-Talk-About-when-Meeting-His-Parents-Step-5.jpg/aid12609679-v4-728px-What-Are-Some-Topics-to-Talk-About-when-Meeting-His-Parents-Step-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn10@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-42-604_f15e1bdd4de69317.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/69/What-Are-Some-Topics-to-Talk-About-when-Meeting-His-Parents-Step-6.jpg/aid12609679-v4-728px-What-Are-Some-Topics-to-Talk-About-when-Meeting-His-Parents-Step-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn11@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-40-431_01596bb61b3e09b7.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a4/What-Are-Some-Topics-to-Talk-About-when-Meeting-His-Parents-Step-7.jpg/aid12609679-v4-728px-What-Are-Some-Topics-to-Talk-About-when-Meeting-His-Parents-Step-7.jpg":null,"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/ff/What-Are-Some-Topics-to-Talk-About-when-Meeting-His-Parents-Step-8.jpg/aid12609679-v4-728px-What-Are-Some-Topics-to-Talk-About-when-Meeting-His-Parents-Step-8.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn17@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-41-288_8d71954b58e922ba.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/91/What-Are-Some-Topics-to-Talk-About-when-Meeting-His-Parents-Step-9.jpg/aid12609679-v4-728px-What-Are-Some-Topics-to-Talk-About-when-Meeting-His-Parents-Step-9.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn30@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-42-662_0d71e5836f98bad5.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/02/What-Are-Some-Topics-to-Talk-About-when-Meeting-His-Parents-Step-10.jpg/aid12609679-v4-728px-What-Are-Some-Topics-to-Talk-About-when-Meeting-His-Parents-Step-10.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn25@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-42-631_f65c4bd606e9c3cb.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761719652},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","title":"How to Make Friends in a New Country","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Moving to a new country—or even spending a year abroad—is a thrilling experience, but it has its challenges too. Once you're past the whirlwind phase of seeing new sights and exploring your new life, it's time to put down some solid roots. To keep your calendar filled with social engagements, make plans that get you out of the house and doing something you enjoy. Even the smallest, simplest connection can plant the seed for a lasting friendship. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Network through social media and personal connections.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Network-through-social-media-and-personal-connections.\">Network through social media and personal connections.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Ask friends back home if they know anyone in your area. Most people don't jump at the chance to show a stranger around town, but that changes as soon as you make a personal connection—even a tiny one. Ask around for anyone who might know someone in your new home, and make a public post on social media too. Until you do, you'll never know if your old classmate's brother's best friend lives around the corner.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-1.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Friends in a New Country Step 1.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/71/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-1.jpg/aid12684672-v4-728px-Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-1.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Spend time with fellow foreigners.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Spend-time-with-fellow-foreigners.\">Spend time with fellow foreigners.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Search online for expat events and immigrant communities. Look for expat groups on Facebook or Meetup, or search online for local cultural centers for immigrant communities. Even if they're not from the same culture as you, other foreigners are more likely to be looking for friends and ready to bond over your experiences in the new country. It's not surprising that most people living abroad have at least some immigrant friends.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Friends in a New Country Step 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/10/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-2.jpg/aid12684672-v4-728px-Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Leaving your comfort zone and getting to know locals is a great goal, but it's okay to make that a long-term plan. You still deserve friends while you're getting settled.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Invite coworkers, fellow students, or neighbors to events.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Invite-coworkers,-fellow-students,-or-neighbors-to-events.\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Invite-coworkers.2C-fellow-students.2C-or-neighbors-to-events.\">Invite coworkers, fellow students, or neighbors to events.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Propose a group lunch or ask about weekend events. If you're studying abroad or if you work with other people, you have a big advantage: people who can't say no to polite conversation! But seriously, work (or school) is the most common way to find new friends after a move. All it takes is the courage to step up and make the initial offer. Similarly, you can <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Introduce-Yourself-to-Your-New-Neighbors\" title=\"Introduce Yourself to Your New Neighbors\">connect with your neighbors</a> by hosting a get-together or knocking on their door with baked treats.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Friends in a New Country Step 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/88/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-3.jpg/aid12684672-v4-728px-Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Start with something small. Try \"I'm thinking of trying the restaurant around the corner for lunch, anyone want to join me?\"</li> \n    <li>Local coworkers can help you out even if you don't hit it off as friends. Don't be afraid to ask \"What do people do for fun in the summer around here?\" or \"Do you know if there's a volleyball court nearby? I haven't found one since I moved here.\"</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Meet people through language exchanges.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Meet-people-through-language-exchanges.\">Meet people through language exchanges.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>You can attend group events or connect one-on-one via an app. Extroverts might enjoy the language exchange events posted on sites like Meetup (which are often relaxed hangouts in a café). If you don't like groups, use apps like Tandem, Italki, or Conversation Exchange to meet locals who want to trade an hour of speaking your native tongue in exchange for an hour speaking theirs.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Friends in a New Country Step 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bc/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-4.jpg/aid12684672-v4-728px-Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Arrange to meet in person instead of just using text chat. It's much better for both language learning and forming a real connection with the other person.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Sign up for a language class.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Sign-up-for-a-language-class.\">Sign up for a language class.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Look for small classes that meet regularly. Most language classes aimed at immigrants meet often and involve lots of conversation practice. It's almost like putting \"make small talk with potential friends\" on your calendar. Ask around for freelance teachers on local social network groups to find affordable, small classes. If you're a resident in your new country, check with local immigration or residency offices. Many countries will pay for part or all of your language classes, at least at the beginner level.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Friends in a New Country Step 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fc/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-5.jpg/aid12684672-v4-728px-Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Show up to events you'd never go to back home.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Show-up-to-events-you'd-never-go-to-back-home.\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Show-up-to-events-you.27d-never-go-to-back-home.\">Show up to events you'd never go to back home.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Every trip out of the house is a chance to meet the right person. Will your future best friend sit next to you at the combination pie-eating &amp; DJ contest? Who knows, but they won't appear on your living room couch. Between Facebook groups for your city, Meetup, and fliers at your local bar, it's usually not hard to find something to do. The key is to <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Motivate-Yourself\" title=\"Motivate Yourself\">motivate yourself</a> to keep getting out there and trying new things.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Friends in a New Country Step 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7a/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-6.jpg/aid12684672-v4-728px-Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Search online or ask locals to find out about music festivals, fairs, and other cultural events in advance. These are great places to meet outgoing strangers, and you might even find people looking for a carpool buddy.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Download friendship apps.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Download-friendship-apps.\">Download friendship apps.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>This introvert-friendly option is more and more popular. Bumble BFF (a friend search mode inside the Bumble app) has exploded in the last couple years.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup> You can also check out other general-purpose friend apps like Patook and Friender, or search your phone store for more specific apps like Hey! Vina for women or BarkHappy for dog owners.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-7.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Friends in a New Country Step 7.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/98/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-7.jpg/aid12684672-v4-728px-Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-7.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: Talk to strangers.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Talk-to-strangers.\">Talk to strangers.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Small-Talk\" title=\"Make Small Talk\">Practice your small talk and use it often</a>. When you're the stranger in town, it's easy to feel awkward and out-of-place. The more you push past that, the more you'll find that almost everyone enjoys meeting new people. As mundane as it sounds, chatting about where you came from and what the weather is like is the first step to getting to know someone.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-8.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Friends in a New Country Step 8.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5a/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-8.jpg/aid12684672-v4-728px-Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-8.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If small talk doesn't come natural to you, prep in advance by finding something to say about local news or sports results. It doesn't have to be clever or even interesting—it's just a simple conversational opening. When in doubt, tell a local something you love about their country (\"The food here is so good!\").</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10\" title=\"Edit section: Join a hobby club or sports team.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Join-a-hobby-club-or-sports-team.\">Join a hobby club or sports team.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Pursue an old interest or explore a popular local pastime. Committing to a weekly hobby meetup is a great way to force yourself to socialize. There are always sports clubs looking for teammates, and you don't have to master the local language to find comrades on the sports field. If that doesn't appeal to you, there are a thousand other options: knitting clubs, book clubs, amateur theater, hiking groups, and maybe even a local activity you'd never be able to try back home. Joining a gym is another way to meet people with similar interests, as long as you make an effort to start conversations or sign up for exercise classes.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-9.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Friends in a New Country Step 9.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/08/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-9.jpg/aid12684672-v4-728px-Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-9.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you want to try out a craft but aren't sure where to start, look for nearby \"makerspaces\" (often connected to libraries), which provide shared equipment for anything from kid's craft projects to serious scientific collaboration.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11\" title=\"Edit section: Meet other people doing leisure activities.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Meet-other-people-doing-leisure-activities.\">Meet other people doing leisure activities.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Socialize at beaches, zoos, parks, and museums. Work up your courage and ask if you can join that volleyball game, introduce your kid to theirs, or just say \"I'm from ___ and looking to meet people here, do you mind if I sit here?\" If that's a little too extroverted for you, sign up for a group excursion like a museum tour, so there's a shared activity for you to talk about. You might not consider this approach at home, but this is a pretty common way to start friendships abroad.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-10.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Friends in a New Country Step 10.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4d/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-10.jpg/aid12684672-v4-728px-Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-10.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country&amp;action=edit&amp;section=12\" title=\"Edit section: Volunteer for a good cause.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Volunteer-for-a-good-cause.\">Volunteer for a good cause.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Volunteering is an excellent way to feel connected to people. Feeling lonely isn't just about not having weekend plans; it can make us feel like we don't matter to the people around us. Volunteering lets you proves that feeling wrong by contributing to a community and getting immediate positive feedback. Join an organization that helps homeless people, visits retirement homes, or helps out animal shelters. You'll feel good about yourself, meet like-minded people, and find an immediate sense of connection.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-11.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Friends in a New Country Step 11.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3b/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-11.jpg/aid12684672-v4-728px-Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-11.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country&amp;action=edit&amp;section=13\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns\">\n  <ol </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 25 Sep 2021 00:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/71/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-1.jpg/aid12684672-v4-728px-Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-1.jpg","linkMd5":"cf8adfaadc893954535663f30299464d","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn77@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-34-378_090ed2fae86ee708.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":74628,"destBytes":50094,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/71/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-1.jpg/aid12684672-v4-728px-Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn77@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-34-378_090ed2fae86ee708.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/10/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-2.jpg/aid12684672-v4-728px-Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn46@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-41-027_0971b389dac7a991.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/88/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-3.jpg/aid12684672-v4-728px-Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn6@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-40-853_f210ca813e7d8b8a.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bc/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-4.jpg/aid12684672-v4-728px-Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn62@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-42-759_65bcc6daf9b7fc8a.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fc/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-5.jpg/aid12684672-v4-728px-Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn56@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-40-114_41f7482f59bfffdc.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7a/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-6.jpg/aid12684672-v4-728px-Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn36@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-42-997_899b7a9a72b4c464.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/98/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-7.jpg/aid12684672-v4-728px-Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-7.jpg":null,"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5a/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-8.jpg/aid12684672-v4-728px-Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-8.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn4@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-39-947_3641e0ec20534869.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/08/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-9.jpg/aid12684672-v4-728px-Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-9.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn64@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-40-239_7b520da2bd28f849.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4d/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-10.jpg/aid12684672-v4-728px-Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-10.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn36@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-39-749_5fd7569196bd62a2.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3b/Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-11.jpg/aid12684672-v4-728px-Make-Friends-in-a-New-Country-Step-11.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn28@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-39-627_2790c5543462ecc4.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761719656},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","title":"How to Delete Your Name from Search Engines","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>If you've typed your name into a popular search engine, you may have been surprised to find more information than you expected—especially if your name is unique! Maybe you own a business and were disappointed to find negative reviews, or discovered that your full name and address are available for anyone to see. While it's almost impossible to immediately wipe your name from internet search results, there are a few things you can do to make it harder for people to find your information. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Securing Social Networks\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Securing-Social-Networks\">Securing Social Networks</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Hide your Facebook profile from search engines. When someone searches for your name in Google or Bing, your Facebook profile is typically one of the first results. Fortunately, Facebook has a built-in feature that can hide your profile from search engines. It may take a few days for this change to take effect, but it's one way to better protect your privacy.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-1-Version-7.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Delete Your Name from Search Engines Step 1 Version 7.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a4/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-1-Version-7.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-1-Version-7.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li><b>On a computer:</b> \n     <ul>\n      <li>Log into Facebook and click the downward triangle ▼ at the upper-right corner of the page.</li> \n      <li>Go to <b>Settings &amp; Privacy</b> &gt; <b>Settings</b> &gt; <b>Privacy</b>.</li> \n      <li>Scroll down to the \"Do you want search engines outside of Facebook to link to your profile?\"</li> \n      <li>Click <b>Edit</b> and select <b>No</b>.</li>\n     </ul></li> \n    <li><b>Phone or tablet:</b> \n     <ul>\n      <li>Open the Facebook app and tap the three-line menu ☰ at the top-right or bottom-right.</li> \n      <li>Tap <b>How People Find and Contact You</b>.</li> \n      <li>Tap <b>Do you want search engines outside of Facebook to link to your profile?</b> and select <b>No</b>.</li>\n     </ul></li> \n    <li>This will only prevent your personal Facebook profile from appearing in Google, Bing, and other search engine results. If you've made posts or comments on public Facebook Pages or groups, they could still appear on Google. If this happens, follow the link and edit or delete your comment/post as needed.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Make your tweets private. Does a search for your name bring up your tweets or Twitter profile? You can set your tweets to private so they stop appearing in search engine results. People who are already following you (and anyone new you approve) will still be able to read your tweets, but they'll no longer show up in search engines. It could become harder to gain new followers this way, but it'll keep your content private.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-2-Version-7.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Delete Your Name from Search Engines Step 2 Version 7.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f5/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-2-Version-7.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-2-Version-7.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Log into your Twitter account on your computer, phone, or tablet.</li> \n    <li>If you're using a phone or tablet, tap the three-line menu at the top-left. On a computer, click <b>More</b> in the left column.</li> \n    <li>Click or tap <b>Settings and privacy</b>.</li> \n    <li>Click or tap <b>Privacy and safety</b>.</li> \n    <li>On a phone or tablet, toggle \"Protect your Tweets\" to the On position. On a computer, click <b>Audience and tagging</b> and check the box next to \"Protect your Tweets.\"</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Change your name on social networks. There's a good chance that the people you care about on your social networks know who you are, so changing your name will help hide your profiles from search engines. This is a bit harder on Facebook, as their <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external text\" href=\"https://www.facebook.com/help/112146705538576\">real name policy</a> requires you to use the name on your government ID. However, you can make your name anything you want on Twitter or Instagram.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-3-Version-7.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Delete Your Name from Search Engines Step 3 Version 7.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3a/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-3-Version-7.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-3-Version-7.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li><b>Twitter:</b> Go to your profile, select <b>Edit profile</b>, and change what appears in the \"Name\" field.</li> \n    <li><b>Facebook:</b> Click the down-arrow at the top of the page (or tap the three-line menu on a phone or tablet), go to <b>Settings &amp; Privacy</b> &gt; <b>Settings</b>, tap <b>Personal and Account Information</b> (mobile only), and then change the \"Name\" field.</li> \n    <li><b>Instagram:</b> Go to your profile, tap <b>Edit Profile</b>, and adjust what appears next to \"Name.\"</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Delete unused accounts. Sometimes signing up for a website will create an online profile that can turn up in search engines. For example, if you have an Amazon.com account, people may be able to search for your name and find your wish list, reviews, and other details. The best way to tackle this issue is to delete any online accounts you no longer use, and lock down the ones you <i>do</i> use.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-4-Version-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Delete Your Name from Search Engines Step 4 Version 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c5/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-4-Version-6.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-4-Version-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Try to remember the places you've shopped online (or search your email for receipts). Log in to any site you don't plan to use again and either change your name or delete your profile.</li> \n    <li>If you've signed up for online forums, such as help forums for services or discussion boards, your posts and profiles could appear in searches for your name. If you can't remember which forums or groups you've signed up for, try searching your email for \"Welcome to\" or similar.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Removing Personal Identity Information\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Removing-Personal-Identity-Information\">Removing Personal Identity Information</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Know what you can remove from Google. Google doesn't remove much from their search results, but you can file for removing special case information. This includes social security numbers, bank account or credit card numbers, an image of your signature, personal pictures uploaded without your consent, or the name of your business if it was associated with adult spam.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Delete Your Name from Search Engines Step 5 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4f/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Remember, this will not remove the content from the web, and it can still be easily accessed by visiting the site. If you want this content removed, you'll need to contact the site owners.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Visit Google's information removal tool. If you feel that you fall into one of the above categories, you can fill out a form to request that the offending URL be removed from Google's search results. Go to <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external text\" href=\"https://support.google.com/websearch/troubleshooter/3111061?vid=1-635804539427659158-1022770388\">this Google support page</a> to get started.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-6-Version-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Delete Your Name from Search Engines Step 6 Version 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b1/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-6-Version-5.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-6-Version-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Select \"Remove information you see in Google Search\". You'll be prompted to select whether the page containing the content is still online or not.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-7-Version-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Delete Your Name from Search Engines Step 7 Version 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f6/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-7-Version-5.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-7-Version-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Select the type of content you want removed. You'll be shown a list of all of the types of content that Google will remove from the search results. Once you select the type of information, a detailed form will appear.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Delete Your Name from Search Engines Step 8 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bb/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Fill out the form. You'll be asked to provide the site URL, as well as your contact information. You'll also need the URL of the search results page that it appears on. Once you have filled out the form, it will be submitted for review.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Delete Your Name from Search Engines Step 9 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f1/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If Google verifies that the site is displaying your personal information without your consent, it will remove that URL from its search results. Note that this will not remove the content from the internet, and it can be easily linked and shared through social networks. If you want the content off the internet, you'll need to go through the site owner, the host, or the legal system.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Contacting Site Owners\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Contacting-Site-Owners\">Contacting Site Owners</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Perform searches on yourself. Another thing to check is whether your name appears on various websites. Perform web searches on your name using a variety of different search engines. <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Search-Google\" title=\"Search Google\">Add search modifiers</a> like your location to help narrow down the results. Note the top results for each one.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Delete Your Name from Search Engines Step 10 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/96/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Instead of just using Google, make sure to search for yourself on other search engines, such as Bing and DuckDuckGo.</li> \n    <li>Remember, it's not the search engine that is causing your name to appear, it is content on the web.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Find the site's contact information. Many websites will have contact information in the \"Contact\" section, or in the footer of the page. Use this contact information to send a request to the site owner to remove the content with your information.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-11-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Delete Your Name from Search Engines Step 11 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/25/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-11-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If the site your name appears on is run by some sort of name indexing company, you may also find a form you can fill out which will request your removal from the site.</li> \n    <li>You can use <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Find-Out-Who-Registered-a-Domain\" title=\"Find Out Who Registered a Domain\">WHOIS, a domain registry database</a>, to attempt to find contact information if none is listed. If the domain was privately registered, your request will be sent to a proxy company, and may or may not be forwarded to the actual owner.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Send a polite message. If something attached to your name is posted on a domain you can't control - for example, a blog post on someone else's blog - a polite, concise email can go a long way. Simply ask them <b>nicely</b> to remove your name from their site. Keep in mind that they are under no obligation to do as you ask; this is why politeness is absolutely crucial to getting them to fulfill your request.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-12-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Delete Your Name from Search Engines Step 12 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/80/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-12-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You may have heard that it is illegal to publish information about someone that is defamatory or slanderous. In truth, determining whether content is defamatory or slanderous is an extremely nuanced legal matter. Additionally, in the United States, there is a loophole regarding slanderous content online in which website owners are not responsible for user-submitted content.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup> For you, this means that again, they are not under any legal obligation to remove said content. Depending on the website, though, sending a polite email request just might get the job done.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Use the Google site removal tool after the content has been taken down. If the site owner cooperates and removes the content, it may still appear in Google's search results. While this will eventually go away, you can speed up the removal process by filing to have that URL removed from the search results. Fill out the form <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external text\" href=\"https://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/removals?pli=1\">here</a> to have the URL processed for removal.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-13-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Delete Your Name from Search Engines Step 13 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e4/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-13-Version-2.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-13-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Contact \"people finder\" and \"411\" websites. There are a variety of online directories that may have information about you, including your name, phone number, and address. You'll need to send information removal requests to each of these directory sites. Some of the most popular directory sites include Intelius and Spokeo.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-14-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Delete Your Name from Search Engines Step 14 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/64/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-14-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can use services such as <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external text\" href=\"https://joindeleteme.com/\">DeleteMe</a> to automatically contact all of these directory sites with removal requests. This will cost you money, but can be much more time-effective if you want to be thorough.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Contacting Hosting Companies\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Contacting-Hosting-Companies\">Contacting Hosting Companies</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Determine the host. You can use the WHOIS search to find the host of the website. The host has the power to remove pages, especially if they violate the host's terms and policies. Chances are that most hosts don't allow slanderous or defamatory content, and you can use this to remove your information. Contact the host when the site owner isn't responding or is refusing to remove content.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-15-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Delete Your Name from Search Engines Step 15 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d7/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-15-Version-2.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-15-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Send the request to the host. Send a polite but strong message to the host's contact address. If you can, describe the specific policies that the content you want removed is violating. If the host is trustworthy and your claim is legitimate, this will usually be enough to cause action.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-16-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Delete Your Name from Search Engines Step 16 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8e/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-16-Version-2.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-16-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Send a DMCA takedown request. If someone is illegally posting your copyrighted content, you can submit a DMCA takedown request to the host.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup> While this won't work for your name or information, since that isn't copyrightable, it can be effective at keeping your work from being spread illegally. Some hosting companies have contact links dedicated to copyright violations, while others will need to have messages sent to the standard contact addresses. \n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Write-a-DMCA-Take-Down-Request-Step-8.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Write a DMCA Take Down Request Step 8.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5f/Write-a-DMCA-Take-Down-Request-Step-8.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Write-a-DMCA-Take-Down-Request-Step-8.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>See <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Write-a-DMCA-Take-Down-Request\" title=\"Write a DMCA Take Down Request\">How to Write a DMCA Take Down Request</a> for detailed instructions on how to word and send the request.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Improving Your Search Results\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Improving-Your-Search-Results\">Improving Your Search Results</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Know when to take this approach. If you just can't get someone to take down negative information about you, the best course of action is to try to bury it in good content. This means you may be actively taking the opposite approach of removing your name, since you'll want lots of results for your name that are positive.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Think-Like-a-Graphic-Designer-Step-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Think Like a Graphic Designer Step 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2c/Think-Like-a-Graphic-Designer-Step-6.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Think-Like-a-Graphic-Designer-Step-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Sign up for every major social network. Since the goal of this is to bury a negative piece of content, you'll want to create as much neutral and positive content as possible. This includes social networks, as these are often ranked highly in search results. Sign up for every major social network and make sure your accounts are set to be publicly-viewable.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-19-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Delete Your Name from Search Engines Step 19 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e9/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-19-Version-2.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-19-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Sign up for Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Pinterest, Instagram, and any other popular networks.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Create profiles and post on public forums. Create accounts on sites like Quora, GitHub, Stack Exchange, and other public sites. All of these will contribute to your search results. Once you've created a profile, make some helpful posts on popular threads to increase the chance that your name will be linked to it in a search result.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-20-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Delete Your Name from Search Engines Step 20 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fd/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-20-Version-2.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-20-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Register your real name as a domain name. This URL will shoot to the top of any search for your name because it is an exact match.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-21-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Delete Your Name from Search Engines Step 21 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cd/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-21-Version-2.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-21-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>It also helps to include a link to this domain on your public social media profiles. The more a URL is linked to from an outside source, the higher up it will appear in search results.</li> \n    <li>Use this opportunity to market yourself or your business. Include some positive information, especially if you are trying to bury content that doesn't put you in a very good light.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Start a blog. If you really want to make a dent on your search result, a popular blog will go a long way. This will take a lot of time, but is probably the most effective way to bury a bad article or page. You can <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Start-a-Blog\" title=\"Start a Blog\">start a blog</a> for free using WordPress, Squarespace, or a variety of other services. Try to post at least once a week to start building up content.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-22-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Delete Your Name from Search Engines Step 22 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6b/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-22-Version-2.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-22-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Ask happy customers for positive reviews. If you run a business and are trying to bury a bad review, ask your satisfied customers to consider leaving a review on Yelp or Google+. Enough good reviews could quickly drown out a negative one.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-23-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Delete Your Name from Search Engines Step 23 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b4/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-23-Version-2.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-23-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Be patient. It may take weeks or months for your content to overtake the negative piece, especially if it is popular. Even if you go with a paid service, it will likely take a significant amount of time for the search result rankings to change.</li>\n </ol> \n <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n  <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Meditate-for-Self-Discovery-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Meditate for Self Discovery Step 10 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/33/Meditate-for-Self-Discovery-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Meditate-for-Self-Discovery-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n </div> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Using the &quot;Right to be Forgotten&quot; (EU)\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Using-the-&quot;Right-to-be-Forgotten&quot;-(EU)\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Using-the-.22Right-to-be-Forgotten.22-.28EU.29\">Using the \"Right to be Forgotten\" (EU)</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Visit the search removal page for Europe. If you reside in the European Union, you may have Google review your data and decide if it is eligible to be removed from the search results.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup> To do this, you'll need to fill out a form indicating what results you want removed. Not all requests will be granted, and public information such as criminal convictions, malpractice, and financial scams will likely not be removed.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-25-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Delete Your Name from Search Engines Step 25 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7e/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-25-Version-2.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-25-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Go to the <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external text\" href=\"https://support.google.com/legal/contact/lr_eudpa?product=websearch\">form page</a> to begin submitting the request.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Fill out the form. You'll need to include your name as well as the name that retrieves the results you want to remove. You'll also need to include specific URLs for search results that you want to get rid of. Each URL you add will need an explanation as to why you think it should be removed (outdated, irrelevant, objectionable, etc.).\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-26-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Delete Your Name from Search Engines Step 26 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ea/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-26-Version-2.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-26-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Wait for your request to be approved or denied. If the information is deemed not of public interest, then the results will be removed from Google search results. It may take a while for your request to be reviewed, and even longer for it to be processed.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-27-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Delete Your Name from Search Engines Step 27 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/75/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-27-Version-2.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-27-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"547\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Taking Legal Action\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Taking-Legal-Action\">Taking Legal Action</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Know when this is necessary. If the site owner and the host are refusing the remove your content, you may have to resort to legal measures. This will be most effective if either the site owner or the hosting company are in the same country as you.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Get-a-Court-Order-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Get a Court Order Step 2 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8f/Get-a-Court-Order-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Get-a-Court-Order-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Remember, this method will only be useful if the content that is posted is actually illegal (slanderous, defamatory, copyright). It is not illegal for someone to just post your name on a website.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Contact a lawyer to draft an \"intent to sue\" notice. This is the cheapest option, and is often good enough to scare the recipient into taking down the content. You only need a few hours of the lawyer's time to perform this, so it shouldn't cost too much. Send the notice to both the site owner and the hosting company.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Get-Child-Support-Step-27.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Get Child Support Step 27.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bc/Get-Child-Support-Step-27.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Get-Child-Support-Step-27.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Get a court order. This is the most expensive solution, and should only be attempted if you are absolutely sure the content is illegal. You'll have to pay legal fees, unless you are able to win your case and have the site owner or host pay them. Consult with a lawyer to determine if this is the correct course of action for you. You'll have a very hard time even getting a court date if the host is from a different country.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Get-a-Court-Order-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Get a Court Order Step 7 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/82/Get-a-Court-Order-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Get-a-Court-Order-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>See <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Get-a-Court-Order\" title=\"Get a Court Order\">How to Get a Court Order</a> for more information on filing a court order.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: Warnings\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Warnings\">Warnings</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>It is almost impossible to get content immediately and permanently removed from the Internet. If you manage your expectations of what can realistically be removed from search results, you will save yourself a lot of frustration and worry.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10\" title=\"Edit section: Related wikiHows\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Related-wikiHows\">Related wikiHows</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stop-Spam\" title=\"Stop Spam\">Stop Spam</a></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines&amp;action=edit&amp;section=12\" title=\"Edit section: Quick Summary\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Quick-Summary\">Quick Summary</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap\">\n  <ol class=\"references\"> \n   <li id=\"_note-1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines#_ref-1\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a href=\"https://crsreports.congress.gov/product/pdf/R/R46751\">https://crsreports.congress.gov/product/pdf/R/R46751</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines#_ref-2\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines#_ref-3\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.copyright.gov/dmca/\">https://www.copyright.gov/dmca/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-4\"><a target=\"_blank\" +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a4/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-1-Version-7.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-1-Version-7.jpg","linkMd5":"6a6fbba6df4ff1c8293af8cdc9ad4585","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn52@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-27-884_ae908ca1564e60ae.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":51097,"destBytes":28778,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a4/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-1-Version-7.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-1-Version-7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn52@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-27-884_ae908ca1564e60ae.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f5/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-2-Version-7.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-2-Version-7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn83@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-41-484_970c4748b58d833b.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3a/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-3-Version-7.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-3-Version-7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn81@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-42-521_d5e697e7cdfa2f9e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c5/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-4-Version-6.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-4-Version-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn25@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-43-342_4d88e4096c8f4e7c.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4f/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-5-Version-3.jpg":null,"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b1/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-6-Version-5.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-6-Version-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/
