from-Search-Engines-Step-22-Version-2.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-22-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn75@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-39-972_0b988446075cf5d0.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b4/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-23-Version-2.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-23-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn4@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-39-610_f746976833c134ad.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/33/Meditate-for-Self-Discovery-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Meditate-for-Self-Discovery-Step-10-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn7@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-41-873_9201ef173504d646.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7e/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-25-Version-2.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-25-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn80@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-39-791_dba69874a24d95c3.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ea/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-26-Version-2.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-26-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn16@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-40-278_e0981ff5f4973e22.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/75/Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-27-Version-2.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Delete-Your-Name-from-Search-Engines-Step-27-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn24@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-40-749_aa66311bbc0f6563.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8f/Get-a-Court-Order-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Get-a-Court-Order-Step-2-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn8@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-40-603_1e9e39d53e67dc17.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bc/Get-Child-Support-Step-27.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Get-Child-Support-Step-27.jpg":null,"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/82/Get-a-Court-Order-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid1284615-v4-728px-Get-a-Court-Order-Step-7-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn57@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-41-138_6c56a8f3c6c9dafe.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761719629},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","title":"How to Write a Bill of Sale for an RV","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>If you’re selling a recreational vehicle (RV), it’s a good idea to fill out a bill of sale. While it’s not required in every state, this document is still a valuable record of your transaction for both the buyer and the seller. The requirements for a bill of sale vary from one place to another, but we’ll talk you through the basics in this article. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Basic Bill of Sale\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Basic-Bill-of-Sale\">Basic Bill of Sale</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Include the price you and the buyer agreed on. This is typically one of the first items you’ll put on the bill of sale.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup> Write something like “In consideration for the sum of $,” followed by the price.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Write a Bill of Sale for an RV Step 1 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bf/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid3093688-v4-728px-Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>This information usually appears at the top of the form, but in some cases it can go underneath information such as the date or the type of RV you are selling.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>State the name and address of the buyer and seller. After specifying the price of the RV, write “paid by,” followed by the name and mailing address of the buyer (or purchaser). Follow this with “to,” then insert the name and address of the seller.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Write a Bill of Sale for an RV Step 2 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1f/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid3093688-v4-728px-Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Alternatively, fill out the purchaser’s information at the top of the form, then place the seller’s name and address in the “certification” section below the details of the sale. This is the section where the buyer, seller, and witnesses sign the bill of sale.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>If you like, you can insert “(Hereinafter known as the “Buyer”)” and “(Hereinafter known as the “Seller”)” after the names and addresses of each party. However, some forms keep it simple and just put “Buyer:” and “Seller:” before the name and address of each party.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Specify that you’re selling an RV. Somewhere on the form, you will need to indicate what kind of vehicle you are selling. In addition to stating that it’s an RV, you may also need to check a box or write down exactly what kind of vehicle it is.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Write a Bill of Sale for an RV Step 3 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7f/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid3093688-v4-728px-Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>In most states, an RV includes things like camping trailers, motor homes, and truck or van campers.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>However, in some areas, the definition of RV may also include things like dirt bikes, snowmobiles, and ATVs.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Fill in any relevant details about the RV, including the VIN. At minimum, provide the make, model, and <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Find-Your-VIN-(Vehicle-Identification-Number)\" title=\"Find Your VIN (Vehicle Identification Number)\">vehicle identification number (VIN)</a> for your RV.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup> You might also need to write down the registration and license plate number, if applicable. Additionally, you may wish to include details such as:\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Write a Bill of Sale for an RV Step 4 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d7/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid3093688-v4-728px-Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>The color or the RV</li> \n    <li>The year your RV was made</li> \n    <li>The length or weight of the vehicle</li> \n    <li>What kind of fuel it takes (if applicable)</li> \n    <li>The odometer reading (if applicable; depending on the type of RV it is, this is required in some states)</li> \n    <li>Whether you are including a trailer or other add-ons</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Include a statement that you are selling the RV free and clear. Also, state clearly that you are the legal owner of the vehicle and have the right to sell it. If you’re selling the vehicle without a warranty, note that you’re selling it “as is.”<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup> A typical example of the phrasing is:\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Write a Bill of Sale for an RV Step 5 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a9/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid3093688-v4-728px-Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>“The Recreational Vehicle is to be sold free and clear of any liens, encumbrances, or mortgages. Seller certifies to be the legal and true owner of the Recreational Vehicle and that it is to be sold in “as-is” condition.”</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Add the date of the sale agreement. Somewhere on the bill of sale, write out the date of sale. Some forms place this information on the top of the form, while others may include it further down (e.g., after the buyer and seller information, or underneath the statement regarding the terms of the sale).<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup> \n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Write a Bill of Sale for an RV Step 6 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/80/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid3093688-v4-728px-Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Or, to avoid any confusion about the date, you can write out, “on the __ day of [month], [year].” For instance, “on the 4th day of August, 2021.”</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Get the buyer, seller, and witnesses to sign the bill. At the bottom of the form, leave spaces for the buyer’s and seller’s signatures. Depending on where you live, you may also need to get signatures from 1 or 2 witnesses. Have each signer date their signature.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Write a Bill of Sale for an RV Step 7 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fd/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid3093688-v4-728px-Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You may need to include a statement such as “I declare under penalty of perjury that the statements herein contained are true and correct to the best of my knowledge and belief.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>If there are co-purchasers or co-sellers, ask them to sign the form as well.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Attach a certificate of acknowledgment from a notary. Depending on where you live, you may need to get your bill of sale notarized. This involves having the various parties sign in front of a notary, who will then acknowledge that all the signers are who they claim to be.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup> If an acknowledgment is required in your area, ask the notary to fill out a certificate, which may include the following information:\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Write a Bill of Sale for an RV Step 8 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2a/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid3093688-v4-728px-Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Your state and county (or other locality information, if you live outside the U.S.)</li> \n    <li>The date</li> \n    <li>The name of the notary</li> \n    <li>The names of the buyer, seller, and anyone else signing the bill of sale</li> \n    <li>A statement from the notary verifying the identities of everyone involved, as well as the legitimacy of the signing</li> \n    <li>The notary’s signature, official seal, and the date on which their commission expires</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Make copies for the buyer and seller. Depending on where you live, the bill of sale might be required to prove that the buyer now owns the RV. Make sure that everyone involved has their own copy for their records.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Write a Bill of Sale for an RV Step 9 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/96/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid3093688-v4-728px-Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Local Requirements\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Local-Requirements\">Local Requirements</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Call your DMV to find out if a bill of sale is required. Not every state requires you to fill out a bill of sale when you sell a vehicle. To find out if you need one, call your local department of motor vehicles or visit their website.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Write a Bill of Sale for an RV Step 10 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ee/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid3093688-v4-728px-Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Even if a bill of sale isn’t required where you live, it’s still a good idea to write one out. Keeping a record of a major transaction can help prevent future misunderstandings or disputes between the buyer and the seller.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Check your DMV website for bill of sale forms. In some areas, you may not need to draft your own bill of sale. Visit your local DMV or department of transportation (DOT) website and see if any appropriate forms are available to download, or do a search online using terms like “RV bill of sale New Mexico” or “bill of sale trailer Illinois.”\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-11-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Write a Bill of Sale for an RV Step 11 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c4/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid3093688-v4-728px-Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-11-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Some states, like Massachusetts, have specific bill of sale forms for RVs.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup> Other states, such as Connecticut, provide an all-purpose bill of sale template for any kind of vehicle.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>Using a pre-written bill of sale for your state will not only save you some time and effort, but will also ensure that you’re including all the required information.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Find out if your state has any special requirements. The information that must be included in a bill of sale may vary from one area to another. If your DMV or DOT doesn’t provide its own template, call and ask what information you need to include.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-12.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Write a Bill of Sale for an RV Step 12.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6d/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-12.jpg/aid3093688-v4-728px-Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-12.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, some states may require your bill of sale to include a detailed odometer disclosure.<sup id=\"_ref-18\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV#_note-18\">[18]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Fill in any additional forms to prove the transfer of ownership. In many states, a bill of sale alone isn’t enough to prove ownership of a vehicle. Typically, the new owner will also need other paperwork, such as a certificate of title. In some specific cases, however, a bill of sale alone may be enough to prove the transfer of ownership.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-13.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Write a Bill of Sale for an RV Step 13.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/40/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-13.jpg/aid3093688-v4-728px-Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-13.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For instance, in Indiana, a bill of sale alone is sufficient in cases where the former owner wasn’t required to obtain a certificate of title, or where the vehicle was abandoned and sold at auction.<sup id=\"_ref-19\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 19\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV#_note-19\">[19]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Ask a lawyer for advice if you still have questions. If you’ve written your own bill of sale and you’re not sure whether it meets local requirements, a lawyer can look it over for you and determine if anything is missing. Talk to a lawyer who specializes in commercial or business law.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-14.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Write a Bill of Sale for an RV Step 14.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/64/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-14.jpg/aid3093688-v4-728px-Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-14.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Depending on where you live, you may be able to get free or low-cost legal advice about your bill of sale. If you live in the U.S., look for information about affordable legal services here: <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.usa.gov/legal-aid\">https://www.usa.gov/legal-aid</a>.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Sample Bill of Sale\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Sample-Bill-of-Sale\">Sample Bill of Sale</span></h2> \n <div id=\"sd_container\" class=\"sd_lightbox sd_obscured\">\n  <div class=\"sd_thumb sd_normal\" id=\"wh-dialog-sample_929f37b25569a0915e332ad73eecad52\">\n   <div class=\"sd_content\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV#wh-dialog-sample_929f37b25569a0915e332ad73eecad52\" class=\"sd_link\" data-sample-title=\"RV Bill of Sale\" data-sample-link=\"/Sample/RECREATIONAL-VEHICLE-(RV)-BILL-OF-SALE\"><img class=\"whcdn\" width=\"340\" height=\"440\" data-src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/82/RECREATIONAL-VEHICLE-%28RV%29-BILL-OF-SALE_sample.png/340px-RECREATIONAL-VEHICLE-%28RV%29-BILL-OF-SALE_sample.png\" id=\"6151f18b787fd\" /><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('6151f18b787fd')</script>\n     <noscript>\n      <img class=\"whcdn\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/82/RECREATIONAL-VEHICLE-%28RV%29-BILL-OF-SALE_sample.png/340px-RECREATIONAL-VEHICLE-%28RV%29-BILL-OF-SALE_sample.png\" width=\"340\" height=\"440\" />\n     </noscript><span>RV Bill of Sale</span></a>\n   </div>\n  </div>\n  <div class=\"sd_thumb sd_amp\" id=\"wh-dialog-sample_929f37b25569a0915e332ad73eecad52\">\n   <div class=\"sd_content\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV#wh-dialog-sample_929f37b25569a0915e332ad73eecad52\" class=\"sd_link\"><img class=\"whcdn\" width=\"340\" height=\"440\" data-src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/82/RECREATIONAL-VEHICLE-%28RV%29-BILL-OF-SALE_sample.png/340px-RECREATIONAL-VEHICLE-%28RV%29-BILL-OF-SALE_sample.png\" id=\"6151f18b787fd\" /><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('6151f18b787fd')</script>\n     <noscript>\n      <img class=\"whcdn\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/82/RECREATIONAL-VEHICLE-%28RV%29-BILL-OF-SALE_sample.png/340px-RECREATIONAL-VEHICLE-%28RV%29-BILL-OF-SALE_sample.png\" width=\"340\" height=\"440\" />\n     </noscript><span>RV Bill of Sale</span></a>\n   </div>\n  </div>\n </div> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns\">\n  <ol noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" id=\"_note-8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV#_ref-8\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer <li id=\"_note-9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV#_ref-9\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.nasdaq.com/articles/how-write-bill-sale-car-2017-11-09\">https://www.nasdaq.com/articles/how-write-bill-sale-car-2017-11-09</a></span> </li> \n   <li </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 23 Sep 2021 00:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bf/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid3093688-v4-728px-Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-1-Version-2.jpg","linkMd5":"b0e69891d1f778091db7bc19821b8b54","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn72@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-27-728_e29e0ada910fd1a7.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":60856,"destBytes":21332,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bf/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid3093688-v4-728px-Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-1-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn72@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-27-728_e29e0ada910fd1a7.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1f/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid3093688-v4-728px-Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-2-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn41@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-41-327_0613971522b8304c.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7f/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid3093688-v4-728px-Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-3-Version-2.jpg":null,"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d7/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid3093688-v4-728px-Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-4-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn74@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-43-228_f9350bf2ac656ddf.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a9/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid3093688-v4-728px-Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-5-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn9@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-40-850_2918038144b4b5e9.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/80/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid3093688-v4-728px-Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-6-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn13@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-43-444_3343207f22783425.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fd/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid3093688-v4-728px-Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-7-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn40@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-41-734_33cab8ed87028305.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2a/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid3093688-v4-728px-Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-8-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn96@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-41-655_8345058fd73a085e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/96/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid3093688-v4-728px-Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-9-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn90@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-42-225_980375a8241c4aaf.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ee/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid3093688-v4-728px-Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-10-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn32@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-40-502_f10da8042dc7b2b7.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c4/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid3093688-v4-728px-Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-11-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn92@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-39-891_33cda256499dcada.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6d/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-12.jpg/aid3093688-v4-728px-Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-12.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn28@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-41-584_64e7fae1b771bc5c.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/40/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-13.jpg/aid3093688-v4-728px-Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-13.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn87@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-40-293_a78b616460a3a9a3.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/64/Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-14.jpg/aid3093688-v4-728px-Write-a-Bill-of-Sale-for-an-RV-Step-14.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn30@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-40-602_0a3be616bbe01e88.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/82/RECREATIONAL-VEHICLE-%28RV%29-BILL-OF-SALE_sample.png/340px-RECREATIONAL-VEHICLE-%28RV%29-BILL-OF-SALE_sample.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn23@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-41-999_82d4687de44ef840.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761719648},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","title":"How to Is It Bad to Wash Your Hair with Baking Soda","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Step into the world of all-natural hair care, and you’ll be swamped with exciting promises and rave reviews about the effects of baking soda as a shampoo replacement. But you’ll also discover people who are disappointed with the results, or even report extensive hair damage. With all the conflicting stories, it can be hard to know whether to try it! If you’re wondering whether it’s even a good idea to wash your hair with baking soda, we have the answer to that—as well as your follow-up questions, too. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Can I wash my hair with baking soda?\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Can-I-wash-my-hair-with-baking-soda?\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Can-I-wash-my-hair-with-baking-soda.3F\">Can I wash my hair with baking soda?</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Yes, but it may not be effective. Some people do find that baking soda leaves their hair clean and shiny. But others have found it to be virtually ineffective at removing oils from anything but their scalp, even after spending several minutes washing their hair.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup> Since everyone’s hair and styling routine is different, there’s no way to guarantee whether it’ll work for you.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-1.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Is It Bad to Wash Your Hair with Baking Soda Step 1.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2b/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-1.jpg/aid12722591-v4-728px-Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-1.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Baking soda is pretty rough on the hair and skin. While some people might benefit from using it for an occasional deep cleanse, it’s not a good choice for regular hair-washing.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: What does baking soda do to hair?\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"What-does-baking-soda-do-to-hair?\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"What-does-baking-soda-do-to-hair.3F\">What does baking soda do to hair?</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>It typically causes damage, like frizz and dryness. Baking soda is fairly alkaline, which makes it good for breaking down grease and grime—but there’s a risk that it’ll break down your hair, too. Some research has suggested that the more alkaline your hair product is, the more likely it is to give you rough, dry, frizzy hair.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup> In other words, it can cause some pretty serious damage that can take a long time to fix!\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Is It Bad to Wash Your Hair with Baking Soda Step 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/17/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-2.jpg/aid12722591-v4-728px-Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Baking soda also risks irritating or damaging your skin, which is a concern if you have sensitive skin or any skin conditions (like eczema or psoriasis).<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>There’s some chemistry behind this: baking soda has a pH level of around 8 or 9, whereas your hair and skin average around 3.7 and 5.5, respectively. The high pH of the baking soda “clashes” with the low pH of your hair and scalp, which damages it.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup> It’s an interesting science experiment, but probably not one you want to try on your hair.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: What if I mix or dilute it?\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"What-if-I-mix-or-dilute-it?\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"What-if-I-mix-or-dilute-it.3F\">What if I mix or dilute it?</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>That will change the scent or texture, but it won’t prevent damage. There are tons of suggestions for “softening” baking soda shampoos with other ingredients, or rinsing your hair with something to neutralize the damage—such as water, apple cider vinegar, or tea tree oil. But there’s no real way to prevent baking soda from causing mayhem on your hair. In fact, some of these combinations (like baking soda and apple cider vinegar) could actually cause <i>more</i> damage, because you’re “shocking” your hair with the sudden contrast in pH.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Is It Bad to Wash Your Hair with Baking Soda Step 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5e/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-3.jpg/aid12722591-v4-728px-Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Mixing baking soda with water won’t reduce the pH, despite what you might have heard. Water's pH is 7, which is neutral, so adding baking soda just raises the pH of the water.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Can baking soda cure dandruff?\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Can-baking-soda-cure-dandruff?\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Can-baking-soda-cure-dandruff.3F\">Can baking soda cure dandruff?</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Baking soda risks making your dandruff worse, not better. Some people tout baking soda as a permanent end to their scalp flakiness, but the alkalinity of baking soda dries out and breaks down the skin on your scalp. This can result in a stronger dandruff problem than before, because a dry scalp means more flakes. Scalp dryness and irritation alike can also mean more itchiness, meaning more scratching at your scalp!<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Is It Bad to Wash Your Hair with Baking Soda Step 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e8/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-4.jpg/aid12722591-v4-728px-Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: What about removing buildup?\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"What-about-removing-buildup?\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"What-about-removing-buildup.3F\">What about removing buildup?</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>It works, but only as an occasional treatment. It is true that baking soda breaks down anything that may have been building up on your scalp, like oil or hair products. Since it also breaks down skin, though, you don’t want to use it regularly: there won’t be enough buildup for it to remove, and you risk earning a raw and sensitive scalp for your effort.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Is It Bad to Wash Your Hair with Baking Soda Step 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cf/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-5.jpg/aid12722591-v4-728px-Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Is it still safe to try it out?\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Is-it-still-safe-to-try-it-out?\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Is-it-still-safe-to-try-it-out.3F\">Is it still safe to try it out?</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Yes, if you have healthy, oily hair and don't have sensitive skin. If you really want to try baking soda shampoo anyway, you should assess your hair and skin before trying it. If you have thicker, oily hair and don't have sensitive skin, you can give it a shot. And it’s a good idea to dab a little bit of the mixture on your skin before you wash your hair with it, just to make sure you don’t have a reaction.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Is It Bad to Wash Your Hair with Baking Soda Step 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/20/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-6.jpg/aid12722591-v4-728px-Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Avoid baking soda shampoos if you have thin or weak hair, sensitive or dry skin, or have reacted badly to other products based on baking soda.</li> \n    <li>You should also not use baking soda shampoos if you’ve used any kind of bleach, dye, or relaxant on your hair.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: How do I use baking soda shampoo?\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"How-do-I-use-baking-soda-shampoo?\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"How-do-I-use-baking-soda-shampoo.3F\">How do I use baking soda shampoo?</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Use it sparingly, and focus it on your scalp. The simplest way to make a baking soda shampoo is to combine baking soda with water; a common ratio is 1 part baking soda to 3 parts water. Then, use your fingers to massage the mixture into your scalp. After one to two minutes, rinse it out with water, being sure to get all of the baking soda off your scalp and out of your hair.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-7.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Is It Bad to Wash Your Hair with Baking Soda Step 7.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/44/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-7.jpg/aid12722591-v4-728px-Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-7.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Don't leave in the baking soda for longer than two minutes. It can irritate your scalp.</li> \n    <li>Once you've rinsed out the baking soda, treat your hair and scalp with a moisturizing treatment, like conditioner, hair oils, or hair masks. (Baking soda wears down and dries your hair and scalp.)</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: How often can I use baking soda on my hair?\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"How-often-can-I-use-baking-soda-on-my-hair?\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"How-often-can-I-use-baking-soda-on-my-hair.3F\">How often can I use baking soda on my hair?</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Limit it to once or twice a month. You shouldn't replace your normal shampoo with a baking soda shampoo; since baking soda is much stronger than other cleansers, using it regularly will hurt your hair and scalp and give you dry, unhappy hair. It's better for removing excessive oils or product buildup. Depending on how oily your hair is and your typical hair routine, that could mean using it monthly, or every two or three weeks.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-8.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Is It Bad to Wash Your Hair with Baking Soda Step 8.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5b/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-8.jpg/aid12722591-v4-728px-Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-8.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If your hair is weak or treated, you shouldn't use baking soda at all, because it can damage your hair and cause it to break.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10\" title=\"Edit section: Do commercial shampoos work better with baking soda?\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Do-commercial-shampoos-work-better-with-baking-soda?\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Do-commercial-shampoos-work-better-with-baking-soda.3F\">Do commercial shampoos work better with baking soda?</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>There isn’t much evidence for that, but that doesn’t mean you can’t try. Some hair-care resources claim that if you combine baking soda with a store-bought shampoo, it’ll do a better job of cleaning your hair. There isn’t research to back that up, though; it’s most likely to change the pH, which doesn’t mean it’s cleaning your hair any better.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup> But if you’re curious, you can give it a try! You can either add commercial shampoo to a homemade baking soda shampoo, or you can try adding a very small amount of baking soda to a bit of store-bought shampoo.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-9.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Is It Bad to Wash Your Hair with Baking Soda Step 9.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1c/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-9.jpg/aid12722591-v4-728px-Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-9.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Like with a baking soda shampoo, test a little bit on your skin before you wash your hair, to make sure you don’t react.</li> \n    <li>Keep in mind that store-bought shampoos with high pH levels will still damage your hair. Consider testing the pH of the mixture before you try it.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11\" title=\"Edit section: Are there any gentler alternatives?\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Are-there-any-gentler-alternatives?\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Are-there-any-gentler-alternatives.3F\">Are there any gentler alternatives?</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Yes, there are options that are softer on your hair and skin. If you’re curious about baking soda shampoo, but are worried about harming your hair or skin, don’t worry! There are other cheap or natural ways to care for your hair, regardless of whether you just want to wash your hair or are trying to resolve some kind of hair scare.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-10.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Is It Bad to Wash Your Hair with Baking Soda Step 10.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4b/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-10.jpg/aid12722591-v4-728px-Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-10.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Explore different <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Shampoo-Hair-Naturally\" title=\"Shampoo Hair Naturally\">natural shampoo recipes</a> or store-bought shampoos, or even consider <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wash-Your-Hair-Without-Shampoo\" title=\"Wash Your Hair Without Shampoo\">forgoing shampoo entirely</a>.</li> \n    <li>For <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Get-Rid-of-Dandruff-(Natural-Methods)\" title=\"Get Rid of Dandruff (Natural Methods)\">dandruff removal</a>, try a moisturizing solution like coconut oil or <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Condition-Your-Hair-With-Aloe-Vera\" title=\"Condition Your Hair With Aloe Vera\">aloe vera</a>.</li> \n    <li>Use coconut, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Use-Argan-Oil-for-Hair\" title=\"Use Argan Oil for Hair\">argan</a>, or jojoba oil to moisturize or volumize your hair, or get curls to stand out.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda&amp;action=edit&amp;section=12\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>If you use baking soda on your hair, it’s a good idea to regularly inspect it for dryness, split ends, or a loss of strength. (Those with curly hair can give their curls a gentle tug to see if they bounce back, too.)<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda&amp;action=edit&amp;section=13\" title=\"Edit free\" href=\"https://www.curlcentric.com/baking-soda/\">https://www.curlcentric.com/baking-soda/</a></span> </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 26 Sep 2021 16:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2b/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-1.jpg/aid12722591-v4-728px-Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-1.jpg","linkMd5":"8ed0d790083d975a123b620181401088","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn88@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-26-903_a7fb5cd05c7a975e.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":102763,"destBytes":71060,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2b/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-1.jpg/aid12722591-v4-728px-Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn88@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-26-903_a7fb5cd05c7a975e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/17/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-2.jpg/aid12722591-v4-728px-Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn64@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-39-739_07d97db7de821e87.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5e/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-3.jpg/aid12722591-v4-728px-Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn82@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-42-939_e6c154627345e925.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e8/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-4.jpg/aid12722591-v4-728px-Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn43@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-42-994_502051fe38ca7a84.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cf/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-5.jpg/aid12722591-v4-728px-Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn14@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-41-495_b95ccd0e05894976.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/20/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-6.jpg/aid12722591-v4-728px-Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn11@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-42-218_cac07d2f1b0dcf4e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/44/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-7.jpg/aid12722591-v4-728px-Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn3@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-43-241_f751f4f95d7c1299.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5b/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-8.jpg/aid12722591-v4-728px-Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-8.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn14@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-42-710_5adbff901d1d913e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1c/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-9.jpg/aid12722591-v4-728px-Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-9.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn15@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-39-604_28eee9c2cc98a302.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4b/Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-10.jpg/aid12722591-v4-728px-Is-It-Bad-to-Wash-Your-Hair-with-Baking-Soda-Step-10.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn99@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-40-045_f69d900d16d90a2f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761719658},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","title":"How to Not Be Boring in a Long Distance Relationship","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Long-distance relationships are challenging. When you’re not seeing each other in person, it can be hard to feel a sense of connection and excitement. But if you’re concerned that your partner might get bored, don’t worry—there are things you can do to keep the spark alive! In this article, we’ll talk you through some of the best ways to keep your long-distance love life intimate and fun. <br /><br />This article is based off an interview with our professional dating coach, John Keegan, founder of The Awakened Lifestyle. <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external text\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Sample/wikiHow-Expert-Interview-Transcript-John-Keegan-Part-2\">Check out the full interview.</a> </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Make the most of video calling.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Make-the-most-of-video-calling.\">Make the most of video calling.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Don’t rely on just emails, texting, and voice calls. Being able to see each other even when you’re far apart can make a big difference in your level of intimacy. As much as possible, use video platforms to communicate so you can see one another and feel more connected.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-1.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Not Be Boring in a Long Distance Relationship Step 1.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/14/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-1.jpg/aid12700068-v4-728px-Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-1.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Make sure you and your sweetheart both have the same video calling software installed. Some popular options include Skype, FaceTime (for Apple devices), Google Duo, and Zoom.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Have deep conversations.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Have-deep-conversations.\">Have deep conversations.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Your time together is precious, so make it quality time. When you’re dating long distance, it’s especially important to make sure that you’re meeting each other’s emotional needs.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup> When you chat, avoid just making vague small-talk. Instead, try to go a little deeper.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup> For instance, go into the details of anything important or exciting that happened during your day, and talk about how it made you feel.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Not Be Boring in a Long Distance Relationship Step 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/82/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-2.jpg/aid12700068-v4-728px-Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you’re not sure what to talk about, ice-breaker questions can help. For example, you might ask things like, “What’s your most precious memory?” or “What’s something you’ve always dreamed of doing?”<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Connect over shared interests and passions.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Connect-over-shared-interests-and-passions.\">Connect over shared interests and passions.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Finding common ground is important in any relationship. When you don’t have the intimacy of regular in-person interactions, it becomes even more important! Ask lots of questions and try to get a sense of what you’re both into.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup> Try to take a genuine interest in things they like that you’re not as familiar with, too. Look for creative ways to bond over the things you both care about.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Not Be Boring in a Long Distance Relationship Step 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/70/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-3.jpg/aid12700068-v4-728px-Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, you could both read a book by a mutual favorite author and have a chat about it next time you call each other.</li> \n    <li>Or, try collaborating on a creative project, like a blog about a topic you both love.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Plan some virtual dates.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Plan-some-virtual-dates.\">Plan some virtual dates.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Make it as much like an in-person date as you can.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup> Work out a specific time and decide what you want to do in advance. For instance, you could share a candlelight dinner and wine over Zoom, watch a movie together, or go to a virtual concert.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Not Be Boring in a Long Distance Relationship Step 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7b/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-4.jpg/aid12700068-v4-728px-Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You could also play online games together or sign up for an online class on a topic you’re both interested in.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Share an image, video, or song.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Share-an-image,-video,-or-song.\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Share-an-image.2C-video.2C-or-song.\">Share an image, video, or song.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>If something makes you think of your SO, don’t hesitate to send it. It could be a funny video on YouTube, an inspiring quote you saw on Instagram, or a meme that made you laugh. Text them the link so they can enjoy it too and will know that they’re on your mind.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Not Be Boring in a Long Distance Relationship Step 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ed/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-5.jpg/aid12700068-v4-728px-Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can also share your own pictures and videos. For instance, send them a selfie or a photo you just took of a beautiful sunset. Include a heartfelt message, like, “I really wish you were here to see this with me! &lt;3”</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Find ways to get them involved in your everyday life.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Find-ways-to-get-them-involved-in-your-everyday-life.\">Find ways to get them involved in your everyday life.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Including them in your daily routine can bring you closer together. When two people live together or regularly see each other in person, it’s much easier to feel like you’re actually sharing a life. Make a conscious effort to help your SO feel more present in your life by talking to them about day-to-day things, like your work, school, or social interactions.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup> In addition to just talking, look for other ways to let them share in your experiences, such as:\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Not Be Boring in a Long Distance Relationship Step 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9f/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-6.jpg/aid12700068-v4-728px-Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Asking for their advice on work situations.</li> \n    <li>Asking them to help you study or review for a test.</li> \n    <li>Getting their feedback on personal projects you’re working on.</li> \n    <li>Virtually including them in get-togethers with friends or family.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Experiment with virtual sex.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Experiment-with-virtual-sex.\">Experiment with virtual sex.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Get creative and have fun! Whether you’re sexting, getting steamy over the phone, or having a face-to-face encounter over video chat, sexual intimacy can play a huge role in keeping a long-distance relationship exciting. Talk to your partner about what they enjoy and how you can keep things spicy, even if you can’t get physical in person.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-7.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Not Be Boring in a Long Distance Relationship Step 7.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/af/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-7.jpg/aid12700068-v4-728px-Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-7.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For instance, you might both enjoy sharing a naughty fantasy, watching porn together online, doing a little virtual roleplay, or just talking about what you’d like to do with one another next time you meet.</li> \n    <li>Having virtual sex over video chat can be especially exciting and fun. Just make sure to use a secure platform with an encrypted connection, such as Signal, so there’s less danger of somebody else seeing what you’re doing.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: Try to meet in person as often as possible.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Try-to-meet-in-person-as-often-as-possible.\">Try to meet in person as often as possible.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>If you can, plan regular meetups—even if it’s just once a month.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup> While a long-distance relationship can work if you’re both willing to put in the effort, going too long without seeing each other can be really frustrating. To keep things exciting and give you both something to look forward to, do your best to get together now and then.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-8.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Not Be Boring in a Long Distance Relationship Step 8.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5c/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-8.jpg/aid12700068-v4-728px-Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-8.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you live really far apart, consider meeting halfway. For instance, if one of you lives in Pennsylvania and the other lives in California, you might meet up in Montana for a hiking adventure in the mountains.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns\">\n  <ol </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship#_ref-5\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.cosmopolitan.com/sex-love/a32052649/video-sex-safety-tips/\">https://www.cosmopolitan.com/sex-love/a32052649/video-sex-safety-tips/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-14\"><a
