id=\"_note-15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship#_ref-15\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\">[v161147_b01]. 29 June 2021.</span> </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 20 Sep 2021 08:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/14/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-1.jpg/aid12700068-v4-728px-Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-1.jpg","linkMd5":"4267defc541eee3f954b2dfda3304499","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn48@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-27-412_d393e3c4e6edcfd6.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":53691,"destBytes":37716,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/14/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-1.jpg/aid12700068-v4-728px-Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn48@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-27-412_d393e3c4e6edcfd6.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/82/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-2.jpg/aid12700068-v4-728px-Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn27@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-42-406_2ed3d29929845020.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/70/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-3.jpg/aid12700068-v4-728px-Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn20@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-40-107_e7e34b79ba956a17.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7b/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-4.jpg/aid12700068-v4-728px-Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn46@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-42-718_687852d6a6b0650c.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ed/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-5.jpg/aid12700068-v4-728px-Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn64@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-41-397_f1a40a57ec69be0c.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9f/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-6.jpg/aid12700068-v4-728px-Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-6.jpg":null,"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/af/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-7.jpg/aid12700068-v4-728px-Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn65@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-41-084_27f09b48840a3af2.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5c/Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-8.jpg/aid12700068-v4-728px-Not-Be-Boring-in-a-Long-Distance-Relationship-Step-8.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn92@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-43-205_17b5e8ec1545fa37.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761719642},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","title":"How to Steam Potatoes","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Steam-Potatoes","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Mashed, fried, baked - there are plenty of delicious ways to eat potatoes. One of the healthiest methods of preparing potatoes is by steaming them. Not only are steamed spuds better for you, they’re also easy to make and require very little time in the kitchen. Serve them plain or tossed with melted butter. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Steam-Potatoes&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Steam-Potatoes&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Using a Steamer Basket\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Using-a-Steamer-Basket\">Using a Steamer Basket</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Wash the potatoes thoroughly. To do this, simply vigorously scrub the outside of the potatoes with a scrub brush and water to remove any dirt or chemicals.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Steam-Potatoes#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Steam-Potatoes-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Steam Potatoes Step 1 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1b/Steam-Potatoes-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid10312850-v4-728px-Steam-Potatoes-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You don’t need to peel the potatoes. In fact, leaving the skins on will help them keep their shape once they soften.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Boil of water in a pot with a steamer basket. A metal sieve or colander can be used in place of a steamer basket.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Steam-Potatoes#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup> Make sure the water is not touching the steamer basket.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Steam-Potatoes#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup><br /><br />\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Steam-Potatoes-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Steam Potatoes Step 2 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9e/Steam-Potatoes-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid10312850-v4-728px-Steam-Potatoes-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Place the potatoes in the steamer basket with the largest ones on the bottom. The smaller ones can then go on top.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Steam-Potatoes#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup> If your potatoes don’t all fit in the steamer basket at once, cook them in batches.<br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You may want to cut the larger potatoes be the equivalent size of the smaller ones. This will help them cook evenly.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Cover the pot tightly with a lid. This is an incredibly important step - the lid is what traps the moisture in and steams the potatoes.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Steam-Potatoes#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup> Covering the pot also keeps the temperature inside the pot hotter so that the potatoes can cook faster.<br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Cook the potatoes for about 10-15 minutes on medium heat. Keep in mind that larger potatoes may take longer while smaller potatoes could be done in less time.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Steam-Potatoes#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup><br /><br />\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Steam-Potatoes-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Steam Potatoes Step 5 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/53/Steam-Potatoes-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid10312850-v4-728px-Steam-Potatoes-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You’ll know the potatoes are cooked completely when you can easily cut through them with a butter knife.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Steam-Potatoes#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Steam-Potatoes&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Cooking Potatoes with Aluminum Foil\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Cooking-Potatoes-with-Aluminum-Foil\">Cooking Potatoes with Aluminum Foil</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Scrub the potatoes under running water. Use a scrub brush to get rid of dirt or debris on the skins. Don't soak the potatoes as this can actually remove some of their nutrients. <sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Steam-Potatoes#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup><br /><br />\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Steam-Potatoes-Step-6-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Steam Potatoes Step 6 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/54/Steam-Potatoes-Step-6-Version-3.jpg/aid10312850-v4-728px-Steam-Potatoes-Step-6-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>There's no need to peel the potatoes.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Fill a medium pot with of water. You don't need much water, just enough to create moisture when covered with a lid later on. The more water you put in the pot, the longer it will take to boil. A sprinkle of sea salt in the water will add flavor to your potatoes.<br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Place 3 balls of aluminum foil in the pot, laying a heat-proof plate on top. Make the balls about the size of a golf ball, or at least big enough that the plate is not in the water. They should all be the same size, too.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Steam-Potatoes#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can use a small baking rack instead of a plate, if desired.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Bring the pot of water (with the plate inside) to a boil. You'll know it's ready when the water is bubbling and steam is coming out of the pot.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Steam-Potatoes#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup> If you notice that a lot of the water has evaporated from boiling, pour more in so it doesn't dry up completely.<br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Put your potatoes on the plate and cover the pot with a lid. The lid will make sure moisture can’t escape.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Steam-Potatoes#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup> Spread the potatoes out evenly around the plate (don't pile them up in the middle) to make sure they all get cooked evenly.<br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Cook the potatoes for 10-15 minutes. Check the potatoes frequently by removing one potato and cutting into it with a knife to see if they are soft.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Steam-Potatoes#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup> Always cut at the thickest section of the potato because this will be the last part to cook through. <sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Steam-Potatoes#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Steam-Potatoes-Step-11-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Steam Potatoes Step 11 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8c/Steam-Potatoes-Step-11-Version-3.jpg/aid10312850-v4-728px-Steam-Potatoes-Step-11-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Baby potatoes work best for steaming. Larger potatoes can take 20 minutes or more.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Steam-Potatoes#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Steam-Potatoes&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Microwaving the Potatoes\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Microwaving-the-Potatoes\">Microwaving the Potatoes</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Clean the potatoes with water and a scrub brush. You don't need to use soap or anything else on your spuds. Simply scrub the outsides and rinse with water in the sink. <sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Steam-Potatoes#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Steam-Potatoes-Step-12-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Steam Potatoes Step 12 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/71/Steam-Potatoes-Step-12-Version-3.jpg/aid10312850-v4-728px-Steam-Potatoes-Step-12-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Leave the skin of the potatoes intact.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Put the potatoes in a microwave-safe bowl with water. Only put enough water in the bowl to cover about 1/8 of the potatoes. You can microwave the potatoes without water as well but there’s a greater chance they’ll dry out.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Steam-Potatoes#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup><br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Cover the bowl completely with plastic wrap. You can place a microwave-safe plate over the top of the bowl as an alternative.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Steam-Potatoes#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup> As long as no moisture can get out, any cover will do.<br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Cook the potatoes for 5 minutes. The cooking time will depend on the strength of your microwave. The potatoes should be crisp yet easily pierced with a fork when they're done.<sup id=\"_ref-18\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Steam-Potatoes#_note-18\">[18]</a></sup> Check the potatoes every 1-2 minutes so they don’t overcook.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Steam-Potatoes-Step-15-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Steam Potatoes Step 15 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5f/Steam-Potatoes-Step-15-Version-2.jpg/aid10312850-v4-728px-Steam-Potatoes-Step-15-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Steam-Potatoes&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Video\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Video\">Video</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Steam-Potatoes&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Steam-Potatoes&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Quick Summary\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Quick-Summary\">Quick Summary</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns\">\n  <ol class=\"references\"> \n   <li id=\"_note-1\"><a </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 24 Sep 2021 08:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1b/Steam-Potatoes-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid10312850-v4-728px-Steam-Potatoes-Step-1-Version-3.jpg","linkMd5":"fd1a9d8e9833f12475ebdc3b976f9546","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn27@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-33-057_51a97d157896c17a.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":410,"sourceBytes":41427,"destBytes":22508,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1b/Steam-Potatoes-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid10312850-v4-728px-Steam-Potatoes-Step-1-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn27@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-33-057_51a97d157896c17a.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9e/Steam-Potatoes-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid10312850-v4-728px-Steam-Potatoes-Step-2-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn75@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-40-830_aeae968f1c980d79.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/53/Steam-Potatoes-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid10312850-v4-728px-Steam-Potatoes-Step-5-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn91@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-39-548_fafea80c8b984451.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/54/Steam-Potatoes-Step-6-Version-3.jpg/aid10312850-v4-728px-Steam-Potatoes-Step-6-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn42@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-41-100_46c41db28d0b8eb3.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8c/Steam-Potatoes-Step-11-Version-3.jpg/aid10312850-v4-728px-Steam-Potatoes-Step-11-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn82@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-41-244_f4496abd9640de5b.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/71/Steam-Potatoes-Step-12-Version-3.jpg/aid10312850-v4-728px-Steam-Potatoes-Step-12-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn52@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-42-723_21c443421e3035a6.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5f/Steam-Potatoes-Step-15-Version-2.jpg/aid10312850-v4-728px-Steam-Potatoes-Step-15-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn2@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-42-964_ac91a93b36a980d9.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761719648},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","title":"How to Show Affection over the Phone","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Most of us don't think of our phone as a tool to strengthen relationships, but we should. With thought and intention, you can connect with a person anywhere in the world, especially someone you care a lot about. Phones also make it easier to express love. You can send texts, emojis, and pictures or have a romantic conversation. If you need some creative suggestions for showing that you care, check out our tips below. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Show-Affection-over-the-Phone&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Show-Affection-over-the-Phone&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Stay connected with regular communication.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Stay-connected-with-regular-communication.\">Stay connected with regular communication.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Texting is important but make time for real chats, too. We all get that people are busy—sometimes even just picking a time to talk can be a challenge. Plan a time to talk on the phone and stick to the schedule. Try to avoid canceling at the last minute unless you absolutely have no other choice.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Show Affection over the Phone Step 1 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/df/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid12667901-v4-728px-Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Regular phone chats are important if you're in a long-distance relationship. Hearing each other's voices can help you feel a lot closer.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Show-Affection-over-the-Phone&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Call or text them when they wake up or before bed.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Call-or-text-them-when-they-wake-up-or-before-bed.\">Call or text them when they wake up or before bed.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Being their first or last message of the day shows you're thinking of them. If you know the person's going to have a challenging day ahead, texting or leaving them a voicemail first thing can make them feel supported. On the flip side, if they had a long or exciting day, call them in the evening so they know you're eager to hear about it.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Show Affection over the Phone Step 2 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a2/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid12667901-v4-728px-Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For instance, you could say, \"Good morning! How are you feeling about your big day? It's got to be nerve-wracking but I know you'll do great.\"</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Show-Affection-over-the-Phone&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Give them plenty of sincere compliments.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Give-them-plenty-of-sincere-compliments.\">Give them plenty of sincere compliments.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Describe what you like about their personality so they feel valued. Don't just save your compliments for when you're together in person. Make it a point to regularly note specific things that you love about them. For instance, you might say, \"That was really thoughtful of you to help your sister prep for her exam. You're a really caring person.\"<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Show Affection over the Phone Step 3 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9b/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid12667901-v4-728px-Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Notice the quirky stuff, too! For example, maybe they have a totally unique fashion sense that you admire or a love of terrible jokes that you find adorable.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Show-Affection-over-the-Phone&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Show interest in their daily activities.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Show-interest-in-their-daily-activities.\">Show interest in their daily activities.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Inquire about their day, listen thoughtfully, and ask followup questions. Ever noticed that when someone likes you, they pay attention to what you're saying? Give this person the same treatment. Ask them about the little things like their workday, errands, or upcoming plans.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Show Affection over the Phone Step 4 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ae/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid12667901-v4-728px-Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>To show you're listening, ask followup questions like, \"Since you're finished with that, what do you think you'll do tomorrow?\" or, \"It sounds like you have some decisions to make. What do you think you'll do?\"</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Show-Affection-over-the-Phone&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Send a text when you're thinking about them.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Send-a-text-when-you're-thinking-about-them.\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Send-a-text-when-you.27re-thinking-about-them.\">Send a text when you're thinking about them.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>You don't have to make it long or dramatic. A simple, \"Just thinking about you,\" lets them know that they're on your mind. Feeling more creative? Text them about things that remind you of them. For example, \"I saw a beautiful sunrise this morning and it made me think of you.\" Here are a few more thoughtful ideas to text:<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Show Affection over the Phone Step 5 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f0/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid12667901-v4-728px-Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>How did I get so lucky to have you in my life?</li> \n    <li>I was just thinking about you. It made me smile.</li> \n    <li>Stop making me think about you! I'm busy.</li> \n    <li>Why does it hurt so much when I miss you?</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Show-Affection-over-the-Phone&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Check in with them throughout the day.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Check-in-with-them-throughout-the-day.\">Check in with them throughout the day.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Send them thoughtful reminders and helpful hints to show you're connected. This shows that you're thinking of them throughout the day and that you care. Are they notoriously bad at remembering to eat lunch, for instance? Text them, \"Hey, time to eat!\" If you know they've got a doctor's appointment, you might call and ask them how the exam went. You get the idea—be there for the person even when you can't physically be together.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Show Affection over the Phone Step 6 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/88/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid12667901-v4-728px-Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Celebrate them throughout the day, too! Did they pass a tricky exam or get a new job? Call to congratulate them or send them a fun celebratory GIF.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Show-Affection-over-the-Phone&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Call or text them to say thanks.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Call-or-text-them-to-say-thanks.\">Call or text them to say thanks.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Remember to express gratitude to show your appreciation. Everyone likes feeling valued so drop them a text to say that you're grateful for them. If you've got more time, give them a call or leave them a voicemail. Sometimes, a simple message like, \"Thank you for being you,\" is all it takes to show your affection.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Show Affection over the Phone Step 7 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7c/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid12667901-v4-728px-Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You could also text something like, \"Thanks for working so hard to take care of me,\" or, \"Thank you for making me feel so special when I'm with you.\"</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Show-Affection-over-the-Phone&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: Use a video chat app to visually connect.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Use-a-video-chat-app-to-visually-connect.\">Use a video chat app to visually connect.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Seeing each other’s faces can help you feel closer. Although it's no substitute for physically getting together, being able to express yourself on a video screen help you keep your connection strong. You don't have to save video chats for important stuff—talk about your day, how much you miss the person, or go on a virtual date.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Show Affection over the Phone Step 8 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/13/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid12667901-v4-728px-Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, if you're in a long-distance relationship, make plans to video chat while you watch a movie together or set your camera in the kitchen so you can prepare dinner together.</li> \n    <li>FaceTime, WhatsApp, Google Duo, and Facebook Messenger are popular options.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Show-Affection-over-the-Phone&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10\" title=\"Edit section: Send a virtual hug.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Send-a-virtual-hug.\">Send a virtual hug.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>A random hug emoji can make them feel special. Sure, a virtual hug isn't quite the same as wrapping your arms around someone, but it's the next best thing. You can choose either the happy emoji face with two hands open in a hug or an emoji of two people hugging. Either way, this simple image can brighten someone's day.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Show Affection over the Phone Step 9 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a9/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid12667901-v4-728px-Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>On Twitter or Facebook? You can easily message them a hug emoji or GIF using those apps.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Show-Affection-over-the-Phone&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11\" title=\"Edit section: Share fun, sweet, or memorable photos and videos.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Share-fun,-sweet,-or-memorable-photos-and-videos.\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Share-fun.2C-sweet.2C-or-memorable-photos-and-videos.\">Share fun, sweet, or memorable photos and videos.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Send them photos or short videos that you think they'd like. A picture's worth a thousand words, right? Snap a shot of something they'd love and send it to them. This shows that they're on you're mind and you care about them even when you're not together. You might send them a short video of the two of you if you're missing the person and want to remind them of how much you care.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Show Affection over the Phone Step 10 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e6/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid12667901-v4-728px-Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For instance, do a throwback photo of when you first started dating, send them a pic from somewhere you went on your anniversary, or share a sweet video you took of them. You could also film a short video of yourself doing something silly or romantic to share with them.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Show-Affection-over-the-Phone&amp;action=edit&amp;section=12\" title=\"Edit section: Send flirty texts to have fun with them.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Send-flirty-texts-to-have-fun-with-them.\">Send flirty texts to have fun with them.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Show your playful side and build anticipation for when you see each other. If you're direct, you might send something like, \"You. Me. Takeout. Tonight,\" or \"What would you say if I asked you to come over right now?\" Don't be afraid to be bold! You'll get them excited to see you again.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-11-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Show Affection over the Phone Step 11 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/23/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid12667901-v4-728px-Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-11-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Feeling stuck with what to text? Try sending a few lines of their favorite poem or some lyrics from a song that means something special to you both.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Show-Affection-over-the-Phone&amp;action=edit&amp;section=13\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns\">\n  <ol class=\"references\"> \n   <li id=\"_note-1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone#_ref-1\">↑</a> <span \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 22 Sep 2021 00:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/df/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid12667901-v4-728px-Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-1-Version-2.jpg","linkMd5":"2369dc228a06b0ea86a9811eb4c9db98","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn44@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-33-533_57b76eaddce8a085.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":72141,"destBytes":45408,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/df/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid12667901-v4-728px-Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-1-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn44@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-33-533_57b76eaddce8a085.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a2/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid12667901-v4-728px-Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-2-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn84@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-40-790_1e367b4e291dc0f3.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9b/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid12667901-v4-728px-Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-3-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn11@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-52-016_15bc842d4e3aed88.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ae/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid12667901-v4-728px-Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-4-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn88@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-43-193_48d6ceab31034290.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f0/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid12667901-v4-728px-Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-5-Version-2.jpg":null,"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/88/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid12667901-v4-728px-Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-6-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn56@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-39-875_df76ec31461c9fbc.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7c/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid12667901-v4-728px-Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-7-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn32@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-42-986_4f61dccb36c97d58.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/13/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid12667901-v4-728px-Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-8-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn59@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-43-101_7ae22a1b0a3132da.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a9/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid12667901-v4-728px-Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-9-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn1@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-40-810_707a8d8f41cb4164.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e6/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid12667901-v4-728px-Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-10-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn35@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-40-064_84616cc2c0afa3d5.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/23/Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid12667901-v4-728px-Show-Affection-over-the-Phone-Step-11-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn2@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-42-562_42e94a1f4ac49e97.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761719644},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","title":"How to Plant Trees to Fight Climate Change","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Climate change is one of the biggest issues in the world right now, so you may be wondering what you can do to help. If you want to give back to the environment and help reduce greenhouse gases, planting trees is a great natural solution. We have the answers to some of your most pressing questions, so keep reading to learn how you can go green and keep our planet safe for years to come! </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: How does planting trees help the environment?\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"How-does-planting-trees-help-the-environment?\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"How-does-planting-trees-help-the-environment.3F\">How does planting trees help the environment?</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Trees absorb carbon dioxide from the air. When trees go through photosynthesis, they take in carbon dioxide and convert it into energy to grow taller and make more leaves. They then store the carbon inside their trunks before producing oxygen.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup> Since carbon dioxide is one of the main greenhouse gases that makes our planet warmer, trees play an important role in controlling the climate.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Plant Trees to Fight Climate Change Step 1 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/ff/Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid12500200-v4-728px-Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Trees hold onto carbon for as long as they’re alive. Since many trees live for around 50–100 years, they can be great long-term solutions.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: What are the best trees to plant to combat climate change?\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"What-are-the-best-trees-to-plant-to-combat-climate-change?\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"What-are-the-best-trees-to-plant-to-combat-climate-change.3F\">What are the best trees to plant to combat climate change?</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Broad-leafed deciduous trees trap more carbon dioxide. Deciduous trees lose their leaves every year, but they absorb a lot of carbon when they’re in the growing season. Since their leaves are larger, they absorb a lot more sunlight and carbon dioxide to convert to energy.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup> Fast-growing trees like maple, oak, and catalpa are great options since they'll start trapping carbon dioxide sooner than slower-growing trees.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Plant Trees to Fight Climate Change Step 2 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/ca/Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid12500200-v4-728px-Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Look for trees that are native to your location since they’ll grow better in their natural environment. Visit a local plant nursery and ask the employees for their recommendations.</li> \n    <li>Plant a diverse mix of trees rather than only planting one species. That way, you also promote biodiversity and are less likely to spread tree-specific pests or diseases between them.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Coniferous pine trees absorb less carbon dioxide, but do it all year. Since pine trees have smaller needles, they don’t absorb as much carbon dioxide. However, they can still be effective to help fight against climate change since they don’t drop their needles in the winter. Some conifers you can try planting include blue spruce, white pine, Hispaniola, and Ponderosa.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change-Step-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Plant Trees to Fight Climate Change Step 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/45/Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change-Step-3.jpg/aid12500200-v4-728px-Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change-Step-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Try planting your trees around September or November when they’re dormant. This helps them establish a large and healthy root system.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: How many trees should I plant to offset my carbon footprint?\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"How-many-trees-should-I-plant-to-offset-my-carbon-footprint?\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"How-many-trees-should-I-plant-to-offset-my-carbon-footprint.3F\">How many trees should I plant to offset my carbon footprint?</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>It takes about 1,025 trees to offset 1 person’s emissions. On average, you create a whopping 16 tons of carbon dioxide during the year. Since a large tree can absorb about of carbon dioxide every year, you’ll need quite a few trees to completely get rid of your emissions. Even though 1,025 trees sounds like a lot, planting 8–9 trees a month for the next 10 years can help you reach that goal.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Plant Trees to Fight Climate Change Step 4 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/45/Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid12500200-v4-728px-Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Trees can get a bit expensive and take up a lot of space. If you don’t have the room or budget for your own trees, donate to an initiative and non-profit organization that can plant trees in your name.</li> \n    <li>Do what you can to <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Reduce-Your-Carbon-Footprint-at-Home\" title=\"Reduce Your Carbon Footprint at Home\">reduce your own carbon footprint</a> at home, such as turning off and unplugging electronics, biking or taking public transportation, and limiting how often you use single-use products.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: How many trees do we need to plant to stop climate change?\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"How-many-trees-do-we-need-to-plant-to-stop-climate-change?\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"How-many-trees-do-we-need-to-plant-to-stop-climate-change.3F\">How many trees do we need to plant to stop climate change?</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>A half-trillion trees could reduce carbon dioxide by 25%. That’s about equivalent to half of the carbon we’ve emitted to our planet since 1960. While that’s a lot of trees we need to plant, it’s not impossible to do since we have a lot of areas where we can restore or plant forests. If we all put forth the effort and plant a few trees, we can help close the gap and make our planet safer and healthier.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Plant Trees to Fight Climate Change Step 5 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/74/Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid12500200-v4-728px-Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>There’s a lot of conflicting research between scientists about whether or not planting enough trees is possible or will actually help the environment. Many of the arguments state trees need to grow to maturity before they’re fully effective and climate conditions keep changing.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: How can we save trees?\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"How-can-we-save-trees?\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"How-can-we-save-trees.3F\">How can we save trees?</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Limit how much paper you’re using. Trees get cut down to make new paper, so try to use the paper that you do have as efficiently as you can. Buy paper made from recycled products and be sure you write on both sides of the sheet before getting rid of it. Rather than wasting new sheets, use scrap paper to take notes, sketch, or make crafts.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Plant Trees to Fight Climate Change Step 6 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e8/Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid12500200-v4-728px-Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you pack lunch in a brown paper bag, consider getting a reusable lunch box instead.</li> \n    <li>If you’re a bookworm, shop at used book stores or borrow books from your local library rather than buying new copies. You can even donate old books that you don’t read anymore.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Recycle paper and cardboard so trees don’t need to get cut down. Recycling reduces emissions from production and prevents deforestation to make new products. Rather than tossing old paper products with the rest of your trash, separate it into a separate bin to take to a recycling center instead.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup> \n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Recycle-Newspaper-Step-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Recycle Newspaper Step 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/03/Recycle-Newspaper-Step-3.jpg/aid12500200-v4-728px-Recycle-Newspaper-Step-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you put paper in the trash, it will go to a landfill and could contribute to methane emissions, which is a greenhouse gas 21 times worse than carbon dioxide.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Put out fires completely before leaving them.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Build-a-Campfire-Pit-Step-9.jpeg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Build a Campfire Pit Step 9.jpeg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/09/Build-a-Campfire-Pit-Step-9.jpeg/aid12500200-v4-728px-Build-a-Campfire-Pit-Step-9.jpeg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> Forest fires damage a lot of healthy trees and contribute harmful chemicals to the atmosphere. If you’re having an outdoor fire, completely extinguish the flames and embers so you don’t risk it catching and spreading. Similarly, throw away lit cigarettes in proper containers rather than tossing them on the ground.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you see any unattended fires, immediately contact your local fire department to put them out.</li> \n    <li>Check the fire conditions in your area before lighting anything. If there’s a drought or severe burn risk, don’t start any fires since it’s more likely to spread.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Will planting trees stop global warming?\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Will-planting-trees-stop-global-warming?\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Will-planting-trees-stop-global-warming.3F\">Will planting trees stop global warming?</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Planting trees won’t stop global warming by itself. While trees will help control some carbon emissions in the air, we still produce a lot more than what forests can absorb. Stay aware of your carbon footprint and do everything you can to bring it down. If we can all lower our emissions as well as plant trees, we have a better chance at saving the planet from climate change.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change-Step-9.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Plant Trees to Fight Climate Change Step 9.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/24/Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change-Step-9.jpg/aid12500200-v4-728px-Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change-Step-9.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Plant-Trees-to-Fight-Climate-Change&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns\">\n  <ol
