</li> \n   <li id=\"_note-27\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Clean-Old-Rubber#_ref-27\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"http://www.maxammadestudio.com/2017/09/how-to-restore-vintage-rubber-stamp.html\">http://www.maxammadestudio.com/2017/09/how-to-restore-vintage-rubber-stamp.html</a> </span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-28\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Clean-Old-Rubber#_ref-28\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.rubberflooringinc.com/assets/pdf/maintenance/RubberFlooringCleaningandMaintenanceInstructions.pdf\">https://www.rubberflooringinc.com/assets/pdf/maintenance/RubberFlooringCleaningandMaintenanceInstructions.pdf</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-29\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Clean-Old-Rubber#_ref-29\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://floorcritics.com/how-to-clean-rubber-flooring/\">https://floorcritics.com/how-to-clean-rubber-flooring/</a></span> </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 27 Sep 2021 16:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/23/Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-1.jpg/aid12701641-v4-728px-Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-1.jpg","linkMd5":"ded88296bb0ecd9f0408edaa2c5ab79f","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn8@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-28-304_44963a1a5800b69a.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":56168,"destBytes":42694,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/23/Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-1.jpg/aid12701641-v4-728px-Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn8@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-28-304_44963a1a5800b69a.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5a/Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-2.jpg/aid12701641-v4-728px-Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn58@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-42-366_cf8874788980260f.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7c/Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-3.jpg/aid12701641-v4-728px-Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn95@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-40-530_a4f4e3a5170ae5c3.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/55/Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-4.jpg/aid12701641-v4-728px-Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn48@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-40-103_aa44d3ad87075d65.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1e/Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-5.jpg/aid12701641-v4-728px-Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn98@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-41-164_418783b5c1c3dbf2.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/aa/Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-6.jpg/aid12701641-v4-728px-Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn14@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-41-064_ac25862e950d1178.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f5/Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-7.jpg/aid12701641-v4-728px-Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn68@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-42-832_0feed609bc9b7ffa.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/ce/Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-8.jpg/aid12701641-v4-728px-Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-8.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn28@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-42-987_33ec24dc31b9f9f0.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e8/Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-9.jpg/aid12701641-v4-728px-Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-9.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn18@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-42-711_2e06ea0368a31781.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a4/Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-10.jpg/aid12701641-v4-728px-Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-10.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn91@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-41-477_f36d11e4f5b4217d.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5b/Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-11.jpg/aid12701641-v4-728px-Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-11.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn37@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-52-040_c560e741ea43e4c8.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bd/Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-12.jpg/aid12701641-v4-728px-Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-12.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn50@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-42-889_fdefbefc417dd25d.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b2/Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-13.jpg/aid12701641-v4-728px-Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-13.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn64@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-43-071_207a7e27defd45b5.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d6/Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-14.jpg/aid12701641-v4-728px-Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-14.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn31@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-39-784_10711711e075edda.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b8/Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-15.jpg/aid12701641-v4-728px-Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-15.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn88@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-41-919_a05bb2f32876d1c4.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/79/Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-16.jpg/aid12701641-v4-728px-Clean-Old-Rubber-Step-16.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn20@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-39-607_bfb63a25cbcc0d3b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761719653},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","title":"How to Be Diplomatic with Your Boss","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>You've probably heard to be assertive in the work environment, but talking to your boss often requires a little more tact—especially if whatever you have to say isn't really \"good news.\" In the world of international politics, diplomats navigate the complex and sometimes tense relationships between two countries with politeness and finesse. Here, we've compiled some tips you can use to channel that diplomatic nature into your dealings with your boss so you can get things done without ruffling any feathers. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Choose the right time and place for difficult conversations.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Choose-the-right-time-and-place-for-difficult-conversations.\">Choose the right time and place for difficult conversations.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Your surroundings impact how your boss receives your message. Finding the right time and place to say what you want to say is a crucial part of being diplomatic. Choose a setting in which you're both comfortable, can easily be heard, and are less likely to be interrupted. Give critical feedback in private, rather than in public or in front of coworkers.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-1.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Be Diplomatic with Your Boss Step 1.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/32/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-1.jpg/aid12693961-v4-728px-Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-1.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, you might invite your boss out of the office for a coffee and then raise your concerns there.</li> \n    <li>If your boss is particularly busy, it's a good idea to ask them when would be a good time to chat. Keep it casual! Just say something like, \"There's something I'd like to chat with you about for maybe 5 minutes. When would be best?\"</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Start with a positive comment.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Start-with-a-positive-comment.\">Start with a positive comment.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Tell your boss about something they're doing really well. This is less about buttering your boss up before delivering criticism, and more about giving them a balanced picture. Starting off with what's going right also helps set the tone and puts you on a constructive path.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Be Diplomatic with Your Boss Step 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0e/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-2.jpg/aid12693961-v4-728px-Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, you might say, \"I'd like to take a moment to thank you for implementing the new reporting system. Things are going much more smoothly on the floor and our productivity has increased.\"</li> \n    <li>The comment should relate to the focus of your conversation as much as possible. For example, if you're going to discuss the problems you're having with a recent hire, you might start by mentioning the things that person is doing well.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Emphasize your own perspective.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Emphasize-your-own-perspective.\">Emphasize your own perspective.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Speak in \"I\" statements to clearly express your thoughts. Present your thoughts or ideas as belonging to you without projecting them onto your boss or anyone else. If you frame your statement with \"you,\" it can make your boss feel attacked—and that's hardly being diplomatic!<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Be Diplomatic with Your Boss Step 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6e/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-3.jpg/aid12693961-v4-728px-Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, you might say, \"I'm concerned that John isn't adapting to his new role.\" This is far less confrontational than saying, \"you shouldn't have promoted John.\"</li> \n    <li>Use \"I\" statements when you respond to your boss as well. For example, rather than saying \"you're wrong,\" say \"I disagree.\" This is assertive, diplomatic communication that leaves room open for discussion.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Offer a solution to any problem you raise.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Offer-a-solution-to-any-problem-you-raise.\">Offer a solution to any problem you raise.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Explain anything you've already done and provide a couple of other options. Most likely, your boss is less concerned with the problem that exists and more concerned with how to fix it so that it doesn't continue to happen. Let your boss know that you've thought about this before you brought it to their attention and have some ideas.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Be Diplomatic with Your Boss Step 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ee/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-4.jpg/aid12693961-v4-728px-Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you have more than one possible solution, present the pros and cons of each. Then, let your boss know which you recommend. At the same time, you also want to reinforce that you're open to other options and will ultimately go along with whatever your boss decides.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Focus on the good of the company.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Focus-on-the-good-of-the-company.\">Focus on the good of the company.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Root your argument in the common goals you and your boss have. This helps your boss to see that you're looking after the best interests of the company, not your own selfish desires or interests. State how your idea benefits the company and back that conclusion up with hard data.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Be Diplomatic with Your Boss Step 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a9/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-5.jpg/aid12693961-v4-728px-Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, you might say, \"Doing away with TPS reports would increase productivity by 25%, which could increase sales by as much as 50%.\"</li> \n    <li>You could also explicitly acknowledge this common ground. For example, you might say, \"I know we both want to increase the productivity of this department. Eliminating some of these reports that aren't actually used by anyone would be a good way to do that.\"</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Rephrase negative statements in more positive terms.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Rephrase-negative-statements-in-more-positive-terms.\">Rephrase negative statements in more positive terms.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Include words like \"able\" and \"yet\" to signal you're still working hard. This technique works especially well if you've hit a snag on an assignment or project. Using some form of \"able\" implies that you would have it done had something out of your control not intervened. Adding \"yet\" lets your boss know that it will be completed soon.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Be Diplomatic with Your Boss Step 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/44/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-6.jpg/aid12693961-v4-728px-Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, you might say, \"I'm afraid I've not been able to close the Dunder Mifflin account yet. I could use a few more days to wrap it up.\"</li> \n    <li>Verbs in past-progressive tense indicate that you're still working, which is more positive than simple past tense. For example, \"I haven't finished that project yet,\" rather than \"I didn't finish that project.\"</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Use helping verbs to express possibility.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Use-helping-verbs-to-express-possibility.\">Use helping verbs to express possibility.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Verbs like \"could,\" \"should,\" \"would,\" and \"might\" soften a demand. You want your boss to do something for you, but you can't just demand that they do it—after all, they're still your boss. Add a helping verb that indicates what you're asking is a possibility or suggestion, rather than a requirement.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-7.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Be Diplomatic with Your Boss Step 7.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/68/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-7.jpg/aid12693961-v4-728px-Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-7.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, you might say, \"It would help to have a little more time to finish that project,\" or \"I could use a little more time to finish that project. It might also help to have someone else assist me with the final numbers.\"</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: Soften forceful statements with polite language.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Soften-forceful-statements-with-polite-language.\">Soften forceful statements with polite language.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Add an apology or a qualifier to make your statement less harsh. While being direct is typically important in business communication, a little politeness can go a long way when you're talking to your boss. Use this to show empathy for your boss's position.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-8.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Be Diplomatic with Your Boss Step 8.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1e/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-8.jpg/aid12693961-v4-728px-Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-8.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, you might say, \"I'm so sorry that I won't be able to attend the meeting. Could I have someone else go in my place?\"</li> \n    <li>Don't be afraid to include a statement acknowledging your boss's work as well. For example, you might say, \"I know you've put a lot of work into this presentation. I'm so sorry I haven't been able to compile these numbers yet. Would it be okay if I got them to you on Friday?\"</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10\" title=\"Edit section: Ask questions to gain a better understanding.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Ask-questions-to-gain-a-better-understanding.\">Ask questions to gain a better understanding.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Listen actively and get clarification when necessary. Part of being diplomatic is making sure you're both on the same page. Asking your boss questions shows that you're listening to them and making an effort to understand them. It also shows that you're interested in their viewpoint and value what they have to say.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-9.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Be Diplomatic with Your Boss Step 9.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ab/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-9.jpg/aid12693961-v4-728px-Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-9.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, you might say, \"I'm sorry, but why is the CEO so concerned about the Stanton office? I thought everything there was under control.\"</li> \n    <li>If you don't have any questions, you might also restate something your boss said in your own words. That helps you make sure you understood them correctly. For example, you might say, \"Am I hearing you right? You think that Avery would do better if you transferred them out of my department and into sales?\"</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11\" title=\"Edit section: Control your own emotions.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Control-your-own-emotions.\">Control your own emotions.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Stick to the facts and keep the discussion professional. Discuss your concerns in a calm manner and avoid lashing out at your boss in frustration. Keep a cool head and look towards solutions for whatever problem you have, rather than harping on about the problem itself.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-10.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Be Diplomatic with Your Boss Step 10.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e5/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-10.jpg/aid12693961-v4-728px-Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-10.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>It can be hard not to take things at work personally—especially if you have a complaint! Just try to remember that you and your boss both have the same overall goals to help the company succeed.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss&amp;action=edit&amp;section=12\" title=\"Edit section: Maintain positive and assertive body language.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Maintain-positive-and-assertive-body-language.\">Maintain positive and assertive body language.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Sit or stand straight with your shoulders back and make eye contact. This body language communicates to your boss that you're confident and open to them. Avoid crossing your arms and legs, which will make you seem closed off.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-11.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Be Diplomatic with Your Boss Step 11.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f9/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-11.jpg/aid12693961-v4-728px-Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-11.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Keep a positive or neutral facial expression. An angry or frustrated facial expression can make your message come across far more negatively than you intend.</li> \n    <li>If you have a hard time with assertive body language, practice in front of a mirror or get a friend to help. With some time, it will become second nature.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss&amp;action=edit&amp;section=13\" title=\"Edit section: Listen actively to your boss's response.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Listen-actively-to-your-boss's-response.\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Listen-actively-to-your-boss.27s-response.\">Listen actively to your boss's response.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Make eye contact and ask clarifying questions to show that you're listening. Being diplomatic isn't just about what you say—paying attention to what your boss says in response is equally important. Lean forward a little as they speak, perhaps mirroring their body language or facial expressions.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-12.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Be Diplomatic with Your Boss Step 12.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/92/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-12.jpg/aid12693961-v4-728px-Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-12.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Before you say something in response, briefly summarize what they said in your own words. This ensures them not only that you were listening but also that you understood what they were saying. And if you happened to misunderstand, you've given them an opportunity to correct that.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss&amp;action=edit&amp;section=14\" title=\"Edit section: Be open to criticism from your boss.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Be-open-to-criticism-from-your-boss.\">Be open to criticism from your boss.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Turn negative statements into ways that you can improve. It can be all too easy to beat yourself up when your boss gives you negative feedback. Take a few deep breaths if you need to and remind yourself that all feedback is intended to help you become better at your job. Your boss wouldn't give you feedback at all if they didn't believe you could improve.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-13.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Be Diplomatic with Your Boss Step 13.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1d/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-13.jpg/aid12693961-v4-728px-Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-13.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, if your boss mentions errors in your report, you might reframe that as \"I need to give my reports an extra round of editing before I submit them.\"</li> \n    <li>It can also help to ask your boss about what you came up with. For example, you might say \"Would it help if I edited my reports one more time before I submitted them?\" They might also give you other ideas you can use to correct whatever problem they've raised.</li> \n    <li>Try to understand the reasons that your boss made the comments they made. Ask questions if you're not sure! It's important that you understand their expectations so you can fulfill them to the best of your ability.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss&amp;action=edit&amp;section=15\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/32/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-1.jpg/aid12693961-v4-728px-Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-1.jpg","linkMd5":"3f85a52404f5d94af49e61ef110c5670","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn66@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-26-257_72623ef9cdba2ee2.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":91738,"destBytes":53102,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/32/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-1.jpg/aid12693961-v4-728px-Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn66@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-26-257_72623ef9cdba2ee2.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0e/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-2.jpg/aid12693961-v4-728px-Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn40@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-39-645_e3ccfe3bdf201dc2.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6e/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-3.jpg/aid12693961-v4-728px-Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn62@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-41-184_214d38d0040450a3.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ee/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-4.jpg/aid12693961-v4-728px-Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn28@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-41-914_6797eff992ba4268.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a9/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-5.jpg/aid12693961-v4-728px-Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn12@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-39-721_18ff1f64a3ca0a63.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/44/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-6.jpg/aid12693961-v4-728px-Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn49@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-40-645_0158e4c01e8bc64c.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/68/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-7.jpg/aid12693961-v4-728px-Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn72@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-40-632_3ffea2b2ba28403a.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1e/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-8.jpg/aid12693961-v4-728px-Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-8.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn84@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-41-811_4a69c37b03273c75.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ab/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-9.jpg/aid12693961-v4-728px-Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-9.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn52@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-41-700_3ccd27ab7715b85e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e5/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-10.jpg/aid12693961-v4-728px-Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-10.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn66@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-42-079_b6427aaf3d92401c.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f9/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-11.jpg/aid12693961-v4-728px-Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-11.jpg":null,"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/92/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-12.jpg/aid12693961-v4-728px-Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-12.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn7@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-40-485_724d2bb97d4f28e6.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1d/Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-13.jpg/aid12693961-v4-728px-Be-Diplomatic-with-Your-Boss-Step-13.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn27@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-41-340_dd8a2d77b5bf3d5c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761719658},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","title":"How to Season Brown Rice","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Brown-Rice","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p><b>Seasoning your brown rice makes this already yummy food into a delicious addition to a number of dishes!</b> While there is no \"right way\" to season brown rice, there are a few tried-and-true methods. You can toast your rice to bring out a nutty flavor, cook it in a broth for a rich and salty tang, or add various herbs and spices to create unique flavor profiles. After you get these basics down, you can change up your seasoning methods however you like in order to make your brown rice exactly how you like or match it with different dishes to build incredible, restaurant-worthy meals. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Season-Brown-Rice&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Ingredients\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Ingredients\">Ingredients</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Season-Brown-Rice&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Toasting Your Rice\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Toasting-Your-Rice\">Toasting Your Rice</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>1 cup (175-185 grams) of rice</li> \n  <li>of cooking oil or melted butter</li> \n  <li>¼-1 teaspoon (1-4 grams) of herbs and spices like oregano, pepper, parsley, or turmeric</li> \n  <li>1 tablespoon (14 grams) of aromatic seasonings like shallots, garlic, or ginger</li>\n </ul> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Season-Brown-Rice&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Cooking Your Rice in Broth\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Cooking-Your-Rice-in-Broth\">Cooking Your Rice in Broth</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>1 cup (175-185 grams) of rice</li> \n  <li>of broth</li>\n </ul> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Season-Brown-Rice&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Seasoning Your Rice with Herbs and Spices\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Seasoning-Your-Rice-with-Herbs-and-Spices\">Seasoning Your Rice with Herbs and Spices</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>2/3 cup (115-125 grams) of rice</li> \n  <li>of water</li> \n  <li>of soy sauce</li> \n  <li>of dried basil</li> \n  <li>to of ground ginger</li> \n  <li>of cayenne pepper</li> \n  <li>1 bay leaf</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Season-Brown-Rice&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Season-Brown-Rice&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Toasting Your Rice\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Toasting-Your-Rice_2\">Toasting Your Rice</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Combine your rice with cooking oil or melted butter in a pan. Put 1 cup (175-185 grams) of rice into a pan and pour enough cooking oil or butter in to evenly coat it, usually . Toast the rice in the oil over medium heat. You'll know it's starting to toast once you smell a nutty aroma.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Brown-Rice#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup><br /><br />\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Season-Brown-Rice-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Season Brown Rice Step 1 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8e/Season-Brown-Rice-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid10203434-v4-728px-Season-Brown-Rice-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Avoid grapeseed and canola oil. Instead, use fattier oils like sesame oil, coconut oil, or olive oil to get more flavor.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Brown-Rice#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Mix in the herbs and spices of your choice. Your choice of herbs and spices will depend on the specific flavor profile or ethnic cuisine you're interested in making.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Brown-Rice#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup> Regardless of what seasonings you choose, sprinkle them over your toasting rice a little bit at a time until they are at the strength you like based on your own tastes.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Brown-Rice#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Seasonings like oregano, pepper, parsley and turmeric go well with brown rice, usually in amounts between ¼ teaspoon (1 gram) and 1 teaspoon (4 grams) depending on your tastes.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Brown-Rice#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>Adding aromatic seasonings in small amounts (a single shallot, a clove of garlic, or 1 tablespoon (14 grams) of chopped ginger) will give your rice tons of flavor.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Brown-Rice#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Add of boiling water to the pan. While your rice is toasting, boil water separately in a pot or kettle. When it has reached a boil, pour it over your seasoned rice in the pan.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Brown-Rice#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup><br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Simmer the rice for 20 minutes. After adding the boiling water, stir the contents of your pan and then cover it with a lid. Cook the mixture on low for 20 minutes.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Brown-Rice#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup><br /><br />\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Season-Brown-Rice-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Season Brown Rice Step 4 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ec/Season-Brown-Rice-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid10203434-v4-728px-Season-Brown-Rice-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Once the rice is cooked, let it stand for 5 minutes, then uncover it and fluff it with a fork.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Brown-Rice#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Season-Brown-Rice&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Cooking Your Rice in Broth\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Cooking-Your-Rice-in-Broth_2\">Cooking Your Rice in Broth</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Put the rice and broth in a large pot. Mix 1 cup (175-185 grams) of rice and of broth together in a pot. Make sure to use a pot with a wide base, so that the heat from your stove disperses as evenly as possible.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Brown-Rice#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup><br /><br />\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Season-Brown-Rice-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Season Brown Rice Step 5 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cc/Season-Brown-Rice-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid10203434-v4-728px-Season-Brown-Rice-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can also consider using a liquid mixture of half broth and half water to add some flavor to your rice without making it too rich depending on your tastes.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Brown-Rice#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Bring the broth to a boil. Cook your rice and broth mixture on high heat until the broth begins to bubble. You should stir the mixture regularly during this stage to prevent the rice from sticking to your pot.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Brown-Rice#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup><br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Cover the pot and let it simmer for 40-50 minutes. Turn your stove down to low heat and cover your rice and broth mixture with a lid. Let the mixture simmer until the rice has absorbed most of the moisture and has a tender texture.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Brown-Rice#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup><br /><br />\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Season-Brown-Rice-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Season Brown Rice Step 7 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4f/Season-Brown-Rice-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid10203434-v4-728px-Season-Brown-Rice-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Stir your rice occasionally to keep it from sticking to your pot.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Brown-Rice#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>Let your cooked rice stand for 5 minutes covered and then fluff it with a fork.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Brown-Rice#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Season-Brown-Rice&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Seasoning Your Rice with Herbs and Spices\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Seasoning-Your-Rice-with-Herbs-and-Spices_2\">Seasoning Your Rice with Herbs and Spices</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Bring rice and water to a boil. Combine your rice and water in a small saucepan at a ratio of 2/3 cup (115-125 grams) of rice to of water. Cook the rice and water on high heat until it begins to bubble.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Brown-Rice#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup><br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Simmer the rice for 35-45 minutes. Reduce the heat to low and cover your rice. Cook the rice at a low simmer until it has absorbed all of the moisture in the saucepan. The rice should be tender but not mushy.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Brown-Rice#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup><br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Mix your seasonings into the rice. Add of soy sauce, of dried basil, to of ground ginger, and of cayenne pepper to your cooked rice. Allow your rice to sit covered for 5 minutes and then fluff it with a fork<sup id=\"_ref-18\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Brown-Rice#_note-18\">[18]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can also season your rice with other herbs and spices according to your tastes. The herbs and spices you use will depend on your own personal tastes and the cuisine you're trying to prepare.</li> \n    <li>Whole spices will give your dish a more subtle flavor, while ground spices will help bring out the flavor of your rice.<sup id=\"_ref-19\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 19\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Brown-Rice#_note-19\">[19]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>Adding a bay leaf to your pan will give your dish an earthy flavor that will complement almost any rice dish.<sup id=\"_ref-20\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 20\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Brown-Rice#_note-20\">[20]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Season-Brown-Rice&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: Video\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Video\">Video</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Season-Brown-Rice&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10\" title=\"Edit section: Things You'll Need\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Things-You'll-Need\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Things-You.27ll-Need\">Things You'll Need</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Season-Brown-Rice&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11\" title=\"Edit section: Toasting Your Rice\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Toasting-Your-Rice_3\">Toasting Your Rice</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Frying pan</li> \n  <li>Pot or kettle</li>\n </ul> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Season-Brown-Rice&amp;action=edit&amp;section=12\" title=\"Edit section: Cooking Your Rice in Broth\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Cooking-Your-Rice-in-Broth_3\">Cooking Your Rice in Broth</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Pot and lid</li>\n </ul> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Season-Brown-Rice&amp;action=edit&amp;section=13\" title=\"Edit section: Seasoning Your Rice with Herbs and Spices\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Seasoning-Your-Rice-with-Herbs-and-Spices_3\">Seasoning Your Rice with Herbs and Spices</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Small saucepan and lid</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Season-Brown-Rice&amp;action=edit&amp;section=14\" title=\"Edit section:
