</ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 25 Sep 2021 16:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8e/Season-Brown-Rice-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid10203434-v4-728px-Season-Brown-Rice-Step-1-Version-3.jpg","linkMd5":"b5aa07849a39f2691cc75a64012fe0ef","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn96@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-27-156_3a1af861b5ea9fc2.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":410,"sourceBytes":62682,"destBytes":42028,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8e/Season-Brown-Rice-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid10203434-v4-728px-Season-Brown-Rice-Step-1-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn96@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-27-156_3a1af861b5ea9fc2.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ec/Season-Brown-Rice-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid10203434-v4-728px-Season-Brown-Rice-Step-4-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn20@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-41-894_7b6e3e7243244892.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cc/Season-Brown-Rice-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid10203434-v4-728px-Season-Brown-Rice-Step-5-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn70@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-40-810_52c2cf61b5035100.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4f/Season-Brown-Rice-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid10203434-v4-728px-Season-Brown-Rice-Step-7-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn77@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-43-236_fa625166c3408dab.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761719654},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","title":"How to Politely Ask a Question","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>When you ask someone a question in English, it could come across as a little rude if you say something too directly. That’s why we tend to use indirect questions when we make requests. Luckily, there are a lot of different phrases that help you sound more polite. Keep reading for a ton of helpful tips and examples for how to word your questions so you're always using good manners no matter what you ask! </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Politely-Ask-a-Question&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Politely-Ask-a-Question&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Phrasing a Polite Question\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Phrasing-a-Polite-Question\">Phrasing a Polite Question</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Start with “excuse me” or “pardon me” to get a person’s attention. If you’re approaching a stranger or if you’re not already talking to the person, try out one of these phrases to start off your conversation. To sound even more curious, try leading with “Sorry to bother you, but…” and then ask your question. Some things you could try asking include:<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-1.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Politely Ask a Question Step 1.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6e/Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-1.jpg/aid12714986-v4-728px-Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-1.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>“Excuse me, where is the nearest bus stop?”</li> \n    <li>“Excuse me, what time is it?”</li> \n    <li>“Pardon me, is there a bathroom over here?”</li> \n    <li>“Sorry to bother you, but have you seen James at all?”</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Begin a statement with “may” if you need to ask for permission. Starting a question with “may” is a great option for making your request sound more formal. Rather than saying directly what you need or want to do, ask the other person if it’s okay for you to do it. Some questions you could try are:<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Politely Ask a Question Step 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/17/Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-2.jpg/aid12714986-v4-728px-Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>“May I use your phone for a minute?”</li> \n    <li>“May I come in?”</li> \n    <li>“May I make a quick suggestion?”</li> \n    <li>“May I have some food?”</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Use “can,” “could,” or “would” when you make a request. Leading right away with a question word, like “who,” “what,” “why,” “where,” or “how,” might make your question sound rude or demanding. Ease into the question with one of these words instead so it sounds a little more polite when you’re asking for information.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Politely Ask a Question Step 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/41/Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-3.jpg/aid12714986-v4-728px-Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, instead of asking “Where is the bathroom?” you could say, “Would you mind telling me where the bathroom is?”</li> \n    <li>As another example, avoid asking something like, “When does the store close?” You could ask, “Could you tell me how late you’re open?”</li> \n    <li>Try adding the word “possibly” into your question to sound even more courteous. For example, you might ask, “Can you possibly drive me to the airport tonight?”<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>You could instead add the phrase to the end of your sentence if the statement initially sounds negative. For example, you could ask, “You couldn’t help me out, could you?” or “You wouldn’t mind picking me up later, would you?”<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Say “did you want” or “did you need” to find out what someone prefers. If you’re trying to figure out what someone wants to do, try adding one of these at the start of your question. Use “did” instead of “do” when you ask your question so it sounds more indirect and polite. Some questions that use this structure include:<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Politely Ask a Question Step 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4a/Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-4.jpg/aid12714986-v4-728px-Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>“Did you want some more water?”</li> \n    <li>“Did you want to go see that movie later?”</li> \n    <li>“Did you need some help with that?”</li> \n    <li>“Did you have a nice weekend?”</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Use “know” or “remember” if you’re not sure whether the person can answer. Sometimes, you may ask a question that the other person doesn’t know the answer to. To take some of the pressure off of them to be correct, start your question with a phrase like, “do you remember,” or “would you know” so they can easily say “yes” or “no” in response. Some examples of using these phrases include:<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Politely Ask a Question Step 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4b/Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-5.jpg/aid12714986-v4-728px-Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>“Do you know when the meeting starts?”</li> \n    <li>“Would you happen to know when she’s supposed to arrive?”</li> \n    <li>“Do you remember what he said last night?”</li> \n    <li>“Can you remember where I left my keys?”</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Add the phrases “if” or “whether” when you’re posing a yes/no question. Using “if” or “whether” works best if the question doesn’t have the words “who,” “what,” “where,” “when,” or “why.” Begin your question with other phrases, like “do you” or “could you,” before adding “if” or “whether.” Some examples include:<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Politely Ask a Question Step 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3a/Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-6.jpg/aid12714986-v4-728px-Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>“Do you know if the train has already left?”</li> \n    <li>“Do you remember if we fed the dog?”</li> \n    <li>“Could you tell me whether or not she arrived on time?”</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Say “please” once in your question. Saying “please” shows that you have good manners, so don’t forget to say it when you’re requesting something. You can either add please to the start or the end of your question to make it sound more courteous. Some things you might say are:<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-7.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Politely Ask a Question Step 7.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ea/Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-7.jpg/aid12714986-v4-728px-Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-7.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>“Could you please tell me where to throw this away?”</li> \n    <li>“Can you please explain that to me again?”</li> \n    <li>“May I have another cookie, please?”</li> \n    <li>“Excuse me, but would you please tell me what time it is?”</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Politely-Ask-a-Question&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Maintaining Good Etiquette\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Maintaining-Good-Etiquette\">Maintaining Good Etiquette</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Speak in a friendly, higher tone. If you speak with a low voice or don’t change your inflection, you may come off as blunt or unfriendly. Raise the pitch of your voice slightly as you ask your question so the other person is more likely to respond to you.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-8.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Politely Ask a Question Step 8.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/be/Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-8.jpg/aid12714986-v4-728px-Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-8.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Smile while you’re talking to help you naturally have a cheery tone.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Let the other person speak without interruption. As the person gives you their answer, give them your full attention and avoid talking over them. Look them in the eyes and avoid getting distracted or checking your phone. Wait until the person is completely finished answering before responding to them so you get their full answer.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-9.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Politely Ask a Question Step 9.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/62/Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-9.jpg/aid12714986-v4-728px-Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-9.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Avoid thinking of what to say next while the person is talking, or else you might miss important information they’re giving you.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Lean in and nod to show that you’re listening. Turn your body toward the person you’re talking to and slightly lean closer to show that you’re interested in what they have to say. As they’re talking, nod or say “mmhmm” to let them know that you’re following the conversation. Keep your arms uncrossed to maintain open body language with them.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-10.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Politely Ask a Question Step 10.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9f/Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-10.jpg/aid12714986-v4-728px-Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-10.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can even repeat things the person has said back to them to prove that you’re listening.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Follow-up with more questions if you need more clarification. If you’re asking about a confusing topic or if you want to continue the conversation, ask the person something else. Use their answer as a jumping-off point for your next question so you can get more information.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-11.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Politely Ask a Question Step 11.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/40/Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-11.jpg/aid12714986-v4-728px-Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-11.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, let’s say you asked, “Could you please tell me where the nearest bus stop is?” and the person responds, “On Main Street.” You could follow up by asking, “Would you mind telling me which direction that is?”</li> \n    <li>As another example, if you asked “Did you need some help with that?” and they say yes, you might ask, “What can I do to be the most helpful right now?”</li> \n    <li>If you’re asking the person to repeat themselves because you missed what they said, apologize. For example, you might say, “I’m sorry, could you please repeat that for me?”<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Steer clear of judging the other person on their answer. If you’re asking for an opinion or something about a person, keep an open mind and view it from their perspective. Even if you disagree with what the person has to say, think about it for a minute so you can understand where they’re coming from. Think about what you want to say before responding so you don’t say anything hurtful.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-12.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Politely Ask a Question Step 12.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/68/Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-12.jpg/aid12714986-v4-728px-Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-12.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Try learning more about the topic on your own time so you can get a better understanding of it as well.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Avoid personal or controversial questions at first. If you’re getting to know someone better, stay away from questions about things like money, politics, religion, and their personal life. A lot of people don’t feel comfortable talking about these subjects with strangers, so it could be rude to ask about them. Instead, stick to simple questions or small-talk topics, like sports, pop culture, or even the weather until you know the person better.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-13.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Politely Ask a Question Step 13.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/59/Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-13.jpg/aid12714986-v4-728px-Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-13.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Reflect on if you need to know the answer or not. If it’s something that isn’t very important and could be controversial, just avoid asking it.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Politely-Ask-a-Question&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Warnings\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Warnings\">Warnings</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Try your best to avoid direct questions, such as “Why did you do that?” or “What are you doing?” since they could come across as rude.<sup id=\"_ref-18\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_note-18\">[18]</a></sup></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Politely-Ask-a-Question&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns\">\n  <ol class=\"references\"> \n   <li id=\"_note-1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_ref-1\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.bbc.co.uk/learningenglish/course/lower-intermediate/unit-21/session-2\">https://www.bbc.co.uk/learningenglish/course/lower-intermediate/unit-21/session-2</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_ref-2\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.andoverscf.org/esl-lesson-4-2\">https://www.andoverscf.org/esl-lesson-4-2</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_ref-3\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://speechyard.com/english-grammar/polite-question-forms/\">https://speechyard.com/english-grammar/polite-question-forms/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_ref-4\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.crownacademyenglish.com/polite-requests-english/\">https://www.crownacademyenglish.com/polite-requests-english/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_ref-5\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.crownacademyenglish.com/polite-requests-english/\">https://www.crownacademyenglish.com/polite-requests-english/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_ref-6\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://learningenglish.voanews.com/a/everyday-grammar-simple-past-tense/3683495.html\">https://learningenglish.voanews.com/a/everyday-grammar-simple-past-tense/3683495.html</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_ref-7\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://englishwithkim.com/indirect-questions-requests/\">https://englishwithkim.com/indirect-questions-requests/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_ref-8\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.bbc.co.uk/learningenglish/course/lower-intermediate/unit-21/session-2\">https://www.bbc.co.uk/learningenglish/course/lower-intermediate/unit-21/session-2</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_ref-9\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.andoverscf.org/esl-lesson-4-2\">https://www.andoverscf.org/esl-lesson-4-2</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_ref-10\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://files.eric.ed.gov/fulltext/EJ1247031.pdf\">https://files.eric.ed.gov/fulltext/EJ1247031.pdf</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_ref-11\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://hbr.org/2016/07/what-great-listeners-actually-do\">https://hbr.org/2016/07/what-great-listeners-actually-do</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_ref-12\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/guides/smarterliving/be-a-better-listener\">https://www.nytimes.com/guides/smarterliving/be-a-better-listener</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_ref-13\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.entrepreneur.com/article/254264\">https://www.entrepreneur.com/article/254264</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_ref-14\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://englishwithkim.com/clarifying-confirming-understanding/\">https://englishwithkim.com/clarifying-confirming-understanding/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_ref-15\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.psychologytoday.com/us/blog/living-the-questions/201410/10-reasons-stop-judging-people\">https://www.psychologytoday.com/us/blog/living-the-questions/201410/10-reasons-stop-judging-people</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_ref-16\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/guides/smarterliving/be-better-at-parties\">https://www.nytimes.com/guides/smarterliving/be-better-at-parties</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_ref-17\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://hbr.org/2020/11/the-case-for-asking-sensitive-questions\">https://hbr.org/2020/11/the-case-for-asking-sensitive-questions</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Politely-Ask-a-Question#_ref-18\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://speechyard.com/english-grammar/polite-question-forms/\">https://speechyard.com/english-grammar/polite-question-forms/</a></span> </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 25 Sep 2021 08:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6e/Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-1.jpg/aid12714986-v4-728px-Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-1.jpg","linkMd5":"5f688ec4c26be2b3a7823feeb9cf6654","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn59@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-28-100_553e96436a49be64.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":69396,"destBytes":45528,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6e/Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-1.jpg/aid12714986-v4-728px-Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn59@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-28-100_553e96436a49be64.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/17/Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-2.jpg/aid12714986-v4-728px-Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn80@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-40-310_893cb3d597a3eaaf.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/41/Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-3.jpg/aid12714986-v4-728px-Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn89@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-42-899_9b153c7e076c01d7.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4a/Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-4.jpg/aid12714986-v4-728px-Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn62@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-40-685_5946311d789b9c90.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4b/Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-5.jpg/aid12714986-v4-728px-Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn8@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-40-049_9ccb2e68e6962153.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3a/Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-6.jpg/aid12714986-v4-728px-Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn94@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-42-888_c446d46b991a58f8.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ea/Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-7.jpg/aid12714986-v4-728px-Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn60@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-39-714_f803044c1721bcde.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/be/Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-8.jpg/aid12714986-v4-728px-Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-8.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn90@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-40-815_59cf2613dba588ba.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/62/Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-9.jpg/aid12714986-v4-728px-Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-9.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn10@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-41-326_3ebc777f799b913c.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9f/Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-10.jpg/aid12714986-v4-728px-Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-10.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn68@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-40-157_18b6355f2b7fbe56.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/40/Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-11.jpg/aid12714986-v4-728px-Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-11.jpg":null,"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/68/Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-12.jpg/aid12714986-v4-728px-Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-12.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn22@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-42-632_4719e6d4da26f5ce.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/59/Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-13.jpg/aid12714986-v4-728px-Politely-Ask-a-Question-Step-13.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn87@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-39-530_5504dab6d18ee9a7.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761719667},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","title":"How to Install Fonts on Your PC","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>This wikiHow teaches you how to find, download, and install a new font on your Windows PC. Whether you want to purchase a font from its creator or download one for free, installing a font in Windows is super easy! </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Downloading a Font\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Downloading-a-Font\">Downloading a Font</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Browse for a font on a reputable font site. If you've already got your eye on a particular font, search for it online—if it's not free, you'll need to pay to download it. Fonts on these popular sites are generally free (more on that soon), and you can browse by category and type:\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-1-Version-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Install Fonts on Your PC Step 1 Version 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/be/Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-1-Version-6.jpg/aid42134-v4-728px-Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-1-Version-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.dafont.com\">https://www.dafont.com</a></li> \n    <li><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.1001freefonts.com\">https://www.1001freefonts.com</a></li> \n    <li><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.fontspace.com\">https://www.fontspace.com</a></li> \n    <li><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.fontsquirrel.com\">https://www.fontsquirrel.com</a></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Check out the font's characters. When you select a font to view, you'll see what each character in the font looks like. Some fonts only have upper-case or lower-case letters, and some don't contain all punctuation marks. Make sure the font you choose has the characters you need.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-2-Version-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Install Fonts on Your PC Step 2 Version 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/13/Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-2-Version-6.jpg/aid42134-v4-728px-Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-2-Version-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Read the license information. Many fonts are royalty-free, meaning that you can use them however you wish without paying anything at all. Other fonts are free for personal use only, meaning that you can't use them for commercial purposes (such as in your business's logo or for designs you're selling).\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-3-Version-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Install Fonts on Your PC Step 3 Version 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/24/Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-3-Version-6.jpg/aid42134-v4-728px-Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-3-Version-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you plan to use a font for commercial purposes, you'll usually need to purchase a commercial license. Make sure you understand the font's rules before using it for commercial purposes—the creator of the font could sue you if you don't purchase a license!</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Click the download button on the font you want to install. When you download a font, it will usually save to your computer in the ZIP format—this file contains the font itself, and sometimes a Readme or Info file. Depending on the site you're using, you may be able to select the font format you want to download. The font formats supported by Windows are:\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-4-Version-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Install Fonts on Your PC Step 4 Version 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e5/Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-4-Version-6.jpg/aid42134-v4-728px-Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-4-Version-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li><b>True Type</b> (.TTF or .TTC) fonts are easy to install, as they contain fonts for both on-screen and printing in a single file.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup> This font type can be installed on both Windows and macOS.</li> \n    <li><b>OpenType</b> (.OTF) fonts, which can also be used on both Windows and macOS, are similar to True Type fonts in that they are easy to install and contain both on-screen and print fonts in a single file. However, the technology is more modern, so the fonts can contain alternate characters, small caps, and other extras.</li> \n    <li><b>PostScript</b> (.PFB and .PFM) fonts are much older and less prevalent these days, as they require two separate files to install. You likely won't find many of these fonts available on free font sits, but you can install them if you do. Just remember you'll need both the .PFB and .PFM file to install the font.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Installing a Font\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Installing-a-Font\">Installing a Font</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Unzip the font files. After downloading the font, you'll usually have a ZIP file (called something like <i>fontname.zip</i>) in your Downloads folder. To install the font, you'll want to unzip the files inside. Here's how:\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-5-Version-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Install Fonts on Your PC Step 5 Version 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2d/Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-5-Version-6.jpg/aid42134-v4-728px-Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-5-Version-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Right-click the .ZIP file and select <b>Extract All…</b></li> \n    <li>Make sure there's a checkmark in the box labeled \"Show extracted files when complete.\"</li> \n    <li>Click the <b>Extract</b> button. When the files are extracted, you'll see a window containing all files pertaining to the font.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Double-click the font file. This is the file that ends with .OTF, .TTF, or .TTC. If you downloaded a PostScript font, you'll have both a .PFB and .PFM file—the one you want to double-click is the .PFM file.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-6-Version-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Install Fonts on Your PC Step 6 Version 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9d/Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-6-Version-6.jpg/aid42134-v4-728px-Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-6-Version-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Click the button. It's at the top-left corner of the window. This installs the font by placing it into the Fonts folder. When the font is installed, the \"Install\" button will dim.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Install Fonts on Your PC Step 7 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fa/Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid42134-v4-728px-Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Restart or launch the app you want to use the font in. For example, if you want to use the font in Adobe Photoshop and already had Photoshop open, you'll need to close it and restart it so it can recognize the font.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Install Fonts on Your PC Step 8 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b0/Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid42134-v4-728px-Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Type with your new font. Your new font should be recognized in any Windows app that allows you to select fonts to type with.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Install Fonts on Your PC Step 9 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c1/Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid42134-v4-728px-Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you use your font in a Word, PowerPoint, or other non-image document, the font will only be visible on computers on which it's installed. For example, let's say you've used your newly-installed font in a Word document. If someone who doesn't have the font installed on their own computer opens the on their computer, they won't see the same font—it will be replaced with their own computer's default font. \n     <ul>\n      <li>One way to get around this in a Word or PowerPoint file is to embed the font inside the file.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup> Just click the <b>File</b> menu, select <b>Options</b>, click the <b>Save</b> tab, check the box next to \"Embed fonts in this file,\" and then click <b>OK</b>.</li>\n     </ul></li> \n    <li>If you use your new font on an image, such as on a graphic you create in Photoshop or Paint, or in a PDF file, it will appear as intended on any device—the only time the font won't show up on another computer is if you use it in a text file.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Video\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Video\">Video</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>If you really like a font, let the creator know! You can usually find the creator's contact information on the site you downloaded the font from, or in the Readme or Info file inside the ZIP.</li> \n  <li>If a font is free for personal use, you can usually still use it for a non-profit organization or charity—check with the font creator to be sure.</li> \n  <li>Avoid downloading fonts that need to be installed using an installer that ends with .EXE. These could be malware!</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Related wikiHows\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Related-wikiHows\">Related wikiHows</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Install-TrueType-Fonts-on-Ubuntu\" title=\"Install TrueType Fonts on Ubuntu\">Install TrueType Fonts on Ubuntu</a></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Quick Summary\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Quick-Summary\">Quick Summary</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap\">\n  <ol class=\"references\"> \n   <li id=\"_note-1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC#_ref-1\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.fonts.com/support/faq/font-formats\">https://www.fonts.com/support/faq/font-formats</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC#_ref-2\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.dafont.com/faq.php\">https://www.dafont.com/faq.php</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC#_ref-3\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/embed-fonts-in-documents-or-presentations-cb3982aa-ea76-4323-b008-86670f222dbc\">https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/embed-fonts-in-documents-or-presentations-cb3982aa-ea76-4323-b008-86670f222dbc</a></span> </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 19 Sep 2021 08:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/be/Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-1-Version-6.jpg/aid42134-v4-728px-Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-1-Version-6.jpg","linkMd5":"b5d78d55ffd4f34633f5fe3163fe25bd","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn16@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-25-552_92ab3f2b216a5f06.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":75311,"destBytes":41804,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/be/Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-1-Version-6.jpg/aid42134-v4-728px-Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-1-Version-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn16@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-25-552_92ab3f2b216a5f06.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/13/Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-2-Version-6.jpg/aid42134-v4-728px-Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-2-Version-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn73@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-42-242_d3b0e885552942a8.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/24/Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-3-Version-6.jpg/aid42134-v4-728px-Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-3-Version-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn100@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-41-736_0e138b06ebf96218.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e5/Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-4-Version-6.jpg/aid42134-v4-728px-Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-4-Version-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn9@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-43-054_985346936291a579.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2d/Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-5-Version-6.jpg/aid42134-v4-728px-Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-5-Version-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn3@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-41-553_ba3b114f4a92397b.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9d/Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-6-Version-6.jpg/aid42134-v4-728px-Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-6-Version-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn16@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-41-896_d0a9505c732b55e0.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fa/Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid42134-v4-728px-Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-7-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn73@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-41-127_ec2c4356e5f18d6a.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b0/Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid42134-v4-728px-Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-8-Version-2.jpg":null,"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c1/Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid42134-v4-728px-Install-Fonts-on-Your-PC-Step-9-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn100@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-39-516_28c39ffbc4333856.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761719637},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","title":"How to Season Salmon","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Salmon","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Salmon is a versatile fish because its strong flavor stands up to a variety of spices. This flavorful fish is delicious seasoned with only salt and pepper, but the possibilities for how to season salmon are only limited to your imagination. You can simply sprinkle seasonings on before you cook the fish or use a spice rub. You can also try a glaze, marinade, or sauce to flavor the fish. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Season-Salmon&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Season-Salmon&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Sprinkling Seasoning on the Fish\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Sprinkling-Seasoning-on-the-Fish\">Sprinkling Seasoning on the Fish</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Create a very simple baked fish with olive oil, salt, and pepper. Pour a dollop of olive oil on top of the fillets, and use your fingers to rub it in. Sprinkle salt and pepper on top before popping the fish in the oven.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Salmon#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Season-Salmon-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Season Salmon Step 1 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/96/Season-Salmon-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid1858305-v4-728px-Season-Salmon-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Salmon has a wonderful flavor all on its own, so sometimes, simple seasonings are all you need.</li> \n    <li>If you want, you can squeeze a bit of lemon on the salmon before serving.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Try rosemary or thyme with roasted or broiled salmon. When salmon is cooked in one of these methods, the flavors of the fish get stronger, so you want strong herbs to go with it. Both rosemary and thyme can stand up to the stronger flavors of roasted salmon.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Salmon#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Season-Salmon-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Season Salmon Step 2 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/64/Season-Salmon-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid1858305-v4-728px-Season-Salmon-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Sprinkle on a bit of dried herbs with olive oil, or tuck a few pieces of fresh rosemary or thyme under the fish while it roasts.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Use smoked paprika, chipotle powder, or cumin for a smoky flavor. Sprinkle one or all of these on your fish before roasting for a smoky finish. You can also use these flavors when grilling to enhance the smokiness you get from the charcoal.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Salmon#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Season-Salmon-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Season Salmon Step 3 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/70/Season-Salmon-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid1858305-v4-728px-Season-Salmon-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Sprinkle on your favorite seasoning blend. Salmon is robust, and it can stand up to a variety of spices. Try sprinkling on taco seasoning, for instance, or Italian seasoning. It also does well with jerk seasoning, curry powder, Cajun seasoning, a Moroccan blend, or Chinese 5 spice. Just sprinkle the seasoning on the fish, and cook it how you'd like, by pan frying it, roasting it, or grilling it.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Season-Salmon-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Season Salmon Step 4 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3b/Season-Salmon-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid1858305-v4-728px-Season-Salmon-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If the blend doesn't have salt, consider adding a sprinkle to heighten the flavors.</li> \n    <li>To brighten the fish, squeeze on some citrus juice at the end.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Season-Salmon&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Using Seasoning Rubs\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Using-Seasoning-Rubs\">Using Seasoning Rubs</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Create a basic rub with salt, pepper, garlic, paprika, and olive oil. In a small bowl, pour in of smoked paprika, garlic powder, Kosher salt, and a couple of grinds of fresh black pepper. Pour in of olive oil and the juice and zest of 1 lemon. Stir the mixture well.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Salmon#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Rub the mixture on a salmon fillet that's about . Let it rest for 10-15 minutes.</li> \n    <li>Roast the fish in an oven that's for 25 minutes.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Try a sweet and spicy rub with brown sugar and spices. Add 2 spoonfuls of brown sugar to a small bowl. Pour in of chili powder and of cumin. Add in a couple of dashes of salt and pepper, and stir the mixture.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Salmon#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Start with 6 salmon fillets. Brush on olive oil, then brush the rub on the fillets.</li> \n    <li>Grill the salmon for 5-6 minutes on each side.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Make an earthy rub with cumin, coriander, and fennel. Pour of coriander seeds, of cumin seeds, and of fennel seeds into a spice grinder. Add in each of smoked paprika, garlic powder, and salt, as well as a few grinds of black pepper. Grind the mixture until it's a fine powder. Spread oil on the fish, and rub the mixture in. Let it sit for a few minutes before cooking.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Salmon#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For extra flavor, cook the seeds in a pan for 3-5 minutes until lightly brown before you grind them. You don't need oil for this process, but keep an eye on them, as they brown quickly.</li> \n    <li>If you don't have a spice grinder, you can use pre-ground spices.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Season-Salmon&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Adding Flavor with Glazes, Sauces, and Marinades\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Adding-Flavor-with-Glazes,-Sauces,-and-Marinades\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Adding-Flavor-with-Glazes.2C-Sauces.2C-and-Marinades\">Adding Flavor with Glazes, Sauces, and Marinades</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Mix citrus with fresh herbs and olive oil for a quick flavor burst. Chop any fresh herbs you have on hand, from dill to parsley. Zest a lemon into a small bowl and squeeze the juice in. Add a dollop of olive oil, along with the fresh herbs.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Salmon#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You could also try fresh basil, rosemary, parsley, cilantro, or even mint.</li> \n    <li>Spread the herb mixture on before baking or even pan frying.</li> \n    <li>You can also use store-bought pesto instead.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Create an Asian-style marinade for grilled salmon. When grilled, salmon's flavors intensify, so you need strong flavors to go with it. Try a marinade that incorporates flavors like fresh ginger and garlic to marinade your fish.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Salmon#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Season-Salmon-Step-9-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Season Salmon Step 9 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/da/Season-Salmon-Step-9-Version-3.jpg/aid1858305-v4-728px-Season-Salmon-Step-9-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Mix minced fresh <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Mince-Garlic\" title=\"Mince Garlic\">garlic</a> and <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Mince-Ginger\" title=\"Mince Ginger\">ginger</a> with a couple of dashes of soy sauce, a few drops of sesame oil, a dash or 2 of rice wine vinegar, and a spoonful of brown sugar to create your marinade. Let the fish marinate for at least 2 hours.</li> \n    <li>You can sub honey for the brown sugar if you prefer.</li> \n    <li>Cook the salmon in the marinade in a pan or drain it off if you want to grill it.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Pour garlic, lemon juice, and butter into foil packets for an easy sauce. Add the juice of 1 lemon, of melted butter, 2 cloves of minced garlic, and of salt for of salmon. Close the packets, and cook the fish for about 15 minutes at . Open the packets to broil the fish for an additional 2-3 minutes at the end.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Salmon#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can also add a dash of black pepper, oregano, and/or crushed red pepper, depending on your preferences.</li> \n    <li>When plating, spoon out a bit of the sauce on top of the fish. Sprinkle with a bit of fresh, chopped parsley at the end.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Use flavored butter at the end for a simple, flavorful \"sauce.\" Let butter soften on the counter. Mix in your favorite fresh herbs or seasoning mix. For instance, add in a couple of dashes of Cajun seasoning or even Italian seasoning, along with some salt and pepper. After cooking the salmon, place a pat of the butter on top of the salmon to melt and flavor it.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Salmon#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You could also use black pepper or citrus zest.</li> \n    <li>Try mixing in a bit of bourbon or whisky, along with a dash of honey or brown sugar.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Make a quick, cool yogurt sauce with spices. You can use crème fraîche, yogurt, or even sour cream mixed with a bit of milk. Stir in any spices you like, such as dill, lemon zest, salt, and black pepper or curry powder.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Salmon#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Season-Salmon-Step-12-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Season Salmon Step 12 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/14/Season-Salmon-Step-12-Version-3.jpg/aid1858305-v4-728px-Season-Salmon-Step-12-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You could also try scallions, sriracha, a little hot sauce, or fresh parsley and lemon zest.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <p><br /> </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Season-Salmon&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>If picking salmon from a fish counter, choose fillets that have brightly colored flesh. Do not purchase fillets that have a fishy smell.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Season-Salmon&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Warnings\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Warnings\">Warnings</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Wash your hands after touching raw salmon.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Season-Salmon&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Things You'll Need\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Things-You'll-Need\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Things-You.27ll-Need\">Things You'll Need</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Spices</li> \n  <li>Zester, optional</li> \n  <li>Small bowls</li> \n  <li>Spice grinder, optional</li> \n  <li>Pans</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Season-Salmon&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Related wikiHows\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Related-wikiHows\">Related wikiHows</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prepare-and-Cook-Salmon\" title=\"Prepare and Cook Salmon\">Prepare and Cook Salmon</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Marinate-Salmon\" title=\"Marinate Salmon\">Marinate Salmon</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Bake-Salmon\" title=\"Bake Salmon\">Bake Salmon</a></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Season-Salmon&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Season-Salmon&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10\" title=\"Edit section: Quick Summary\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Quick-Summary\">Quick Summary</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns\">\n  <ol class=\"references\"> \n   <li id=\"_note-1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Salmon#_ref-1\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.thekitchn.com/how-to-cook-salmon-in-the-oven-cooking-lessons-from-the-kitchn-204559\">https://www.thekitchn.com/how-to-cook-salmon-in-the-oven-cooking-lessons-from-the-kitchn-204559</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Salmon#_ref-2\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.finecooking.com/article/matching-flavors-and-methods-with-salmon\">https://www.finecooking.com/article/matching-flavors-and-methods-with-salmon</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Salmon#_ref-3\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"http://www.cookinglight.com/food/in-season/what-to-eat-right-now-pacific-salmon#our-favorite-salmon-flavor-combinations\">http://www.cookinglight.com/food/in-season/what-to-eat-right-now-pacific-salmon#our-favorite-salmon-flavor-combinations</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Salmon#_ref-4\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.epicurious.com/recipes/food/views/lemon-paprika-roasted-salmon-51189020\">https://www.epicurious.com/recipes/food/views/lemon-paprika-roasted-salmon-51189020</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Salmon#_ref-5\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Salmon#_ref-6\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Salmon#_ref-8\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" id=\"_note-10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Salmon#_ref-10\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\"
