</li> \n   <li id=\"_note-11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Season-Salmon#_ref-11\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.thekitchn.com/5-easy-ways-to-dress-up-a-salmon-fillet-tips-from-the-kitchn-208745\">https://www.thekitchn.com/5-easy-ways-to-dress-up-a-salmon-fillet-tips-from-the-kitchn-208745</a></span> </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 22 Sep 2021 16:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/96/Season-Salmon-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid1858305-v4-728px-Season-Salmon-Step-1-Version-3.jpg","linkMd5":"d1a9100c80c2ee5e707763f043351761","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn11@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-25-401_a3a4566e5b624ad2.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":410,"sourceBytes":57728,"destBytes":41994,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/96/Season-Salmon-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid1858305-v4-728px-Season-Salmon-Step-1-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn11@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-25-401_a3a4566e5b624ad2.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/64/Season-Salmon-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid1858305-v4-728px-Season-Salmon-Step-2-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn86@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-41-145_d07943a570e4c192.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/70/Season-Salmon-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid1858305-v4-728px-Season-Salmon-Step-3-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn18@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-43-351_0989824fad0b124f.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3b/Season-Salmon-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid1858305-v4-728px-Season-Salmon-Step-4-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn8@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-43-310_add1082ca6410627.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/da/Season-Salmon-Step-9-Version-3.jpg/aid1858305-v4-728px-Season-Salmon-Step-9-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn43@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-42-339_2dabf58a007b7067.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/14/Season-Salmon-Step-12-Version-3.jpg/aid1858305-v4-728px-Season-Salmon-Step-12-Version-3.jpg":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761719645},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","title":"How to Prevent Land Pollution","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Prevent-Land-Pollution","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>If you're concerned about land pollution, there's a lot you can do in your home and community to slow this environmental problem. Using these suggestions from organizations like the Environmental Protection Agency, you'll be able to take steps to reduce your waste, reverse deforestation, limit your chemical usage, and conserve energy, which will help prevent land pollution and create a cleaner planet. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Prevent-Land-Pollution&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Prevent-Land-Pollution&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Conserving Energy\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Conserving-Energy\">Conserving Energy</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Reduce your <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Reduce-Your-Energy-Consumption\" title=\"Reduce Your Energy Consumption\">electricity consumption</a>. Burning fossil fuels to create electric power emits nitrogen into the air. This nitrogen is deposited back onto the land, leading to both soil and water pollution. To reduce your electricity consumption, turn off and unplug devices and equipment you aren’t using, such as televisions, printers, tablets, and computers.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prevent-Land-Pollution#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-10-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Prevent Land Pollution Step 10 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c9/Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-10-Version-3.jpg/aid4634977-v4-728px-Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-10-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Turn off lights in rooms you’re not in and use LED bulbs rather than fluorescent or incandescent bulbs.</li> \n    <li>Select energy-efficient light bulbs and appliances, like washing machines, refrigerators, and air conditioning units.</li> \n    <li>Use a programmable thermostat and keep the temperature between in the summer and in the winter.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Use renewable energy sources. Solar, wind, and hydroelectric power are better for the environment than burning fossil fuels for energy.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prevent-Land-Pollution#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup> Call up your power company and see if you can purchase your electricity from renewable sources. Or, install solar panels or a wind turbine to power your home and/or office!<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prevent-Land-Pollution#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-11-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Prevent Land Pollution Step 11 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ab/Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-11-Version-3.jpg/aid4634977-v4-728px-Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-11-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>In many cases, you can receive a tax credit for using renewable energy sources.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Limit your vehicle emissions.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prevent-Land-Pollution#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup> Vehicle emissions contain a lot of nitrogen which pollutes the air, water, and land. Burning gasoline also contributes to land pollution since drilling for oil releases contaminants into the soil. Rather than driving everywhere you need to go, carpool or take public transportation. If your destination is close enough, ride your bike or walk.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prevent-Land-Pollution#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-12-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Prevent Land Pollution Step 12 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b1/Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-12-Version-3.jpg/aid4634977-v4-728px-Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-12-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Flying also contributes to pollution. Try to consolidate or limit your business trips and vacations so as to reduce the number of flights you take each year.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Prevent-Land-Pollution&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Reducing Your Waste\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Reducing-Your-Waste\">Reducing Your Waste</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Reduce-Household-Waste\" title=\"Reduce Household Waste\">Limit your consumption</a> of material goods. It takes a lot of energy and raw materials to manufacture everyday items. To reduce the amount of waste you produce, don’t buy something unless you absolutely need it!<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prevent-Land-Pollution#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup> When an item you do own breaks, see if it can be repaired rather than replacing it. Also, buy used items, including furniture, clothing, toys, books, electronics, and decorations for your home.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prevent-Land-Pollution#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Prevent Land Pollution Step 1 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2a/Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid4634977-v4-728px-Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you only need to use something a few times, ask a friend or neighbor if you can borrow that item instead of buying a new one.</li> \n    <li>Using biodegradable products also reduces the amount of waste you create.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prevent-Land-Pollution#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Recycle\" title=\"Recycle\">Recycle</a> as much you can. Landfills are a major contributor to land pollution. Instead of throwing away your waste, recycle as much of it as you can. Glass, plastic, paper and cardboard, and aluminum and other metals can all be recycled.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prevent-Land-Pollution#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Prevent Land Pollution Step 2 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/71/Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid4634977-v4-728px-Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Sort your recyclables as per your recycling company or city municipality prefers.</li> \n    <li>If you don’t have a recycling service, see if you can arrange for one to pick up recyclables from your home and office.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prevent-Land-Pollution#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Use <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Reduce-Plastic-Use\" title=\"Reduce Plastic Use\">less plastic</a>. Plastic waste is clogging up landfills and oceans around the world. Avoid buying and using plastic products, such as plastic bags, cutlery, cups, straws, and bottles.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prevent-Land-Pollution#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup> Another great way to cut down on plastic use is to buy items in bulk packaged in boxes instead of plastic containers.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prevent-Land-Pollution#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Prevent Land Pollution Step 3 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/dd/Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid4634977-v4-728px-Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Use fabric bags to carry your groceries, pack your lunch in reusable containers, and invest in reusable bags to store food items like leftovers and snacks.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Prevent-Land-Pollution&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Stopping Deforestation\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Stopping-Deforestation\">Stopping Deforestation</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Reduce your paper consumption. The best way to do this is to avoid using disposable paper products. Paper towels, plates, cups, napkins, and other throwaway items are made from trees. Deforestation is a major cause of land pollution since it contributes to soil erosion and exposes the soil to contaminants. Instead of purchasing disposable paper products, opt for reusable plates and cloth towels and napkins.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prevent-Land-Pollution#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Prevent Land Pollution Step 4 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e8/Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid4634977-v4-728px-Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Opt for paperless billing and cancel magazine and newspaper subscriptions.</li> \n    <li>You can also limit your paper consumption by sending emails instead of snail mail, avoiding printing things unless you truly need to, and using both sides of a sheet of paper.</li> \n    <li>When you do need to use paper, opt for recycled paper. And be sure to recycle any paper you do use!</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Get-Elected-Officials-to-Listen\" title=\"Get Elected Officials to Listen\">Encourage your government</a> to preserve forested areas. All types of forests are critical to the health of the environment. Reforestation can dramatically reduce land pollution. Write to or call your elected officials and ask them to take steps to stop deforestation. Ask them to crack down on illegal logging and encourage sustainable land use.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prevent-Land-Pollution#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Prevent Land Pollution Step 5 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/47/Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid4634977-v4-728px-Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Furthermore, encourage them to support worldwide reforestation efforts.</li> \n    <li>You can also donate time, money, or both to organizations dedicated to reforestation.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Plant-a-Tree\" title=\"Plant a Tree\">Plant trees</a>. Reforestation efforts can help reduce land and air pollution around the world. Planting trees increases biodiversity, stops soil erosion, reduces carbon monoxide buildup, and adds aesthetic value to the area. You can plant trees in your own community or work with worldwide organizations to plant trees in deforested areas.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prevent-Land-Pollution#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-6-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Prevent Land Pollution Step 6 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a3/Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-6-Version-3.jpg/aid4634977-v4-728px-Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-6-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you plant trees in your own community, be sure to choose trees that are native to your region and will thrive in your specific climate.</li> \n    <li>Check the laws in your area before planting trees on land other than your own.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Prevent-Land-Pollution&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Limiting Chemical Usage\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Limiting-Chemical-Usage\">Limiting Chemical Usage</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Avoid using fertilizers and pesticides. Both fertilizers and pesticides leach into the soil and contaminate it. This contaminated soil is often no longer able to support the growth of crops, leading to less land available for food production. If you have a farm, yard, or garden, avoid applying pesticides or fertilizers to your soil.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prevent-Land-Pollution#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Prevent Land Pollution Step 7 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/67/Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid4634977-v4-728px-Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Use natural or organic fertilizers instead of chemical ones.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Dispose-of-Industrial-Chemicals\" title=\"Dispose of Industrial Chemicals\">Dispose of toxic chemicals</a> properly. Household cleaning products, solvents, paints, automotive fluids, and aerosol containers all contain toxic materials. Rather than tossing these items in the trash, where they will leach into the soil in a landfill, take the time to figure out how to dispose of them properly. Read the label on each container as well as the material data safety sheet to figure out the best way to get rid of each type of chemical.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prevent-Land-Pollution#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Prevent Land Pollution Step 8 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/43/Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid4634977-v4-728px-Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Be sure to store these kinds of chemicals in spill-proof containers as well.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Buy organic foods. Organic foods are grown without the use of pesticides. Select fruits and veggies that are certified organic to reduce chemical pesticide usage in the agriculture industry. Though you may spend a little more money, organic foods are better for both your health and the planet!<sup id=\"_ref-18\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prevent-Land-Pollution#_note-18\">[18]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-9-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Prevent Land Pollution Step 9 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ed/Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-9-Version-3.jpg/aid4634977-v4-728px-Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-9-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Prevent-Land-Pollution&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Prevent-Land-Pollution&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Quick Summary\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Quick-Summary\">Quick Summary</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns\">\n  <ol class=\"references\"> \n   <li id=\"_note-1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prevent-Land-Pollution#_ref-1\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.epa.gov/nutrientpollution/sources-and-solutions-fossil-fuels\">https://www.epa.gov/nutrientpollution/sources-and-solutions-fossil-fuels</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prevent-Land-Pollution#_ref-2\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\">[v161055_b01]. 28 June 2019.</span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-3\"><a href=\"https://www.epa.gov/nutrientpollution/sources-and-solutions-fossil-fuels\">https://www.epa.gov/nutrientpollution/sources-and-solutions-fossil-fuels</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-4\"><a href=\"https://news.nationalgeographic.com/2018/06/reduce-plastic-use-families-kids-environment-culture/\">https://news.nationalgeographic.com/2018/06/reduce-plastic-use-families-kids-environment-culture/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prevent-Land-Pollution#_ref-13\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer id=\"_note-15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prevent-Land-Pollution#_ref-15\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 22 Sep 2021 08:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c9/Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-10-Version-3.jpg/aid4634977-v4-728px-Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-10-Version-3.jpg","linkMd5":"a872eb2935d9fc512b3c2559ca19a22f","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn23@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-35-807_8d202f5f21ae2c3e.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":35577,"destBytes":19150,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c9/Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-10-Version-3.jpg/aid4634977-v4-728px-Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-10-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn23@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-35-807_8d202f5f21ae2c3e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ab/Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-11-Version-3.jpg/aid4634977-v4-728px-Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-11-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn63@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-41-721_d259360c0e299e5c.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b1/Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-12-Version-3.jpg/aid4634977-v4-728px-Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-12-Version-3.jpg":null,"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2a/Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid4634977-v4-728px-Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-1-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn34@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-41-291_636acdf322183fcb.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/71/Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid4634977-v4-728px-Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-2-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn57@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-42-767_64f5278bff0d992b.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/dd/Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid4634977-v4-728px-Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-3-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn72@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-40-086_4eda79633b2e63db.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e8/Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid4634977-v4-728px-Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-4-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn100@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-43-358_6a07139dcfff654e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/47/Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid4634977-v4-728px-Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-5-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn98@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-40-925_1dad3390d65d1667.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a3/Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-6-Version-3.jpg/aid4634977-v4-728px-Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-6-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn83@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-39-802_5520ca930c83c517.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/67/Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid4634977-v4-728px-Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-7-Version-3.jpg":null,"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/43/Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid4634977-v4-728px-Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-8-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn32@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-42-031_b20c2425e4ef0a2c.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ed/Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-9-Version-3.jpg/aid4634977-v4-728px-Prevent-Land-Pollution-Step-9-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn22@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-43-431_90e3afb4711f38cc.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761719645},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","title":"How to Start an Afterschool Program","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Start-an-Afterschool-Program","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Afterschool programs can help meet your community’s needs.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Start-an-Afterschool-Program#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup> Some are academically-focused on building skills like reading, math, and language. Others may highlight outdoor play, art, sports, or music. To set up an afterschool program, consider where you will run it, what staff you’ll need, and where you’ll find funding for supplies and food. Any program that cares for young children may also have to comply with national and local government guidelines. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Start-an-Afterschool-Program&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Start-an-Afterschool-Program&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Researching and Planning\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Researching-and-Planning\">Researching and Planning</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Define who your program will serve. Determine what age group you will work with and what kind of programming you want to offer. Will you serve K-5th graders that attend the same school? Or, will your program enroll 7-8th graders who all share a similar interest?<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Start-an-Afterschool-Program#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Start an Afterschool Program Step 1 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1d/Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid10912354-v4-728px-Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you’re a teacher, consider whether your students could benefit from an extended-day program.</li> \n    <li>If you’re a parent or community leader, think about a childcare solution close to home where the kids in your neighborhood can safely spend a few hours.</li> \n    <li>If you’re a student yourself, consider proposing a program that provides a unique opportunity for yourself and your peers.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Ask parent, teachers, and kids what they want. Talk to the people in your community about what they are looking for in an afterschool program. Hold a community conversation at a school, church, or community center to discuss your ideas and to get feedback. Send out a request for input online using email, social media, or a free online survey platform.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Start-an-Afterschool-Program#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Start an Afterschool Program Step 2 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b3/Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid10912354-v4-728px-Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Involve the people who will use the program from the beginning so you can build it to meet their needs.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Set goals for your program. Determine what the ultimate purpose of your program will be. Are you mainly interested in providing a safe place for kids to hang out after school? Do you want to help kids do their homework? Are you interested in providing art or music enrichment? You can do a combination things, but it’s important to make sure that you can state your goals clearly.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Start an Afterschool Program Step 3 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/24/Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid10912354-v4-728px-Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, some afterschool programs simply provide an environment that is safe and comfortable, where kids can play and hang out with adult supervision while their parents work.</li> \n    <li>Other programs set educational goals to improve reading skills or math scores for students who are struggling academically.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Plan the organizational set-up and staff requirements. At minimum you’ll need a director who will oversee the program as well as someone who will actually run the programming on a day to day basis. These roles could be filled by the same person for a small program.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Start-an-Afterschool-Program#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Start an Afterschool Program Step 4 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d4/Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid10912354-v4-728px-Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you’re setting up a program at a school that already has other afterschool programs in place, model your organization around these.</li> \n    <li>Ask for volunteers from the community to help you meet your staffing needs.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Locate a designated space for your program. Check with local schools, churches, and community centers to see if there is space you can use that is free or low-cost. Make sure the space you choose includes access to necessities like bathrooms, food, and water.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Start-an-Afterschool-Program#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Start an Afterschool Program Step 5 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/93/Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid10912354-v4-728px-Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>It is possible to run a program outdoors, but you will also need to make sure students have access to restrooms, shade, and adequate protection from weather extremes (like heat, cold, rain, etc.)</li> \n    <li>Try to choose a space that is accessible and inclusive for students regardless of their ability.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Research and obtain proper licensing for your program. Depending on where you live, afterschool programs may be regulated by national, state, or local agencies. Learn more about the specific requirements for afterschool in your area by visiting the websites of a national group, like Afterschool Alliance in the U.S. (<a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"http://www.afterschoolalliance.org/policyState.cfm\">http://www.afterschoolalliance.org/policyState.cfm</a>).\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-6-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Start an Afterschool Program Step 6 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/55/Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-6-Version-3.jpg/aid10912354-v4-728px-Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-6-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>In other countries with more centralized educational programming, check your government’s website for a section on childcare and education. For example, in the UK, visit <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.gov.uk/after-school-holiday-club\">https://www.gov.uk/after-school-holiday-club</a>.</li> \n    <li>Reach out to the contacts listed for your state or local agencies by email and phone to discuss the specific requirements for your program.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Start-an-Afterschool-Program&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Funding Your Program\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Funding-Your-Program\">Funding Your Program</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Charge tuition fees to cover your expenses. The cost of a high-quality, out-of-school-time program can range from $1,500 per child to more than double that, depending on where it is and what it includes.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Start-an-Afterschool-Program#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup> To cover costs, many afterschool programs charge fees for enrollment.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Start-an-Afterschool-Program#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Start an Afterschool Program Step 7 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/75/Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid10912354-v4-728px-Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>When setting your tuition cost, consider the needs of the community your program serves. If the fees are too high, you may not be able to reach to the population you want to help.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Start-an-Afterschool-Program#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Apply for government funding to supplement your income. Seeking funding from government sources is a great way to subsidize your program’s funding base. Check agency websites in your country, like: <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.youth.gov/funding-search\">https://www.youth.gov/funding-search</a> in the U.S. or, in Canada check out the page for the Ministry of Education in your province.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Start-an-Afterschool-Program#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup> When searching for funding programs, look for those that are targeted to specific activities or subject areas.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Start an Afterschool Program Step 8 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8d/Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid10912354-v4-728px-Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, if you need funds to purchase arts and crafts supplies, you can look into the Arts Learning Program of the National Endowment for the Arts (<a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.arts.gov/grants-organizations/art-works/arts-education\">https://www.arts.gov/grants-organizations/art-works/arts-education</a>).<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Start-an-Afterschool-Program#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>There are also numerous Federal and state funding programs in the U.S. that specifically fund programming in Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Start-an-Afterschool-Program#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Ask local community foundations and businesses for help. If you need craft supplies, reach out to the local arts and craft supply store to see if they can make a donation of materials. If you need snacks, contact local grocery stores near you and ask for help. Local community funding agencies are also a great resource. Search for them online and contact their grant officers for more help.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Start-an-Afterschool-Program#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-9-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Start an Afterschool Program Step 9 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7f/Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-9-Version-3.jpg/aid10912354-v4-728px-Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-9-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Material donations like crafts and food from local businesses can help reduce your financial burden.</li> \n    <li>Community funding agencies are often helpful in providing much-needed money for overhead costs like rent and maintenance.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Maintain a diverse funding stream. Keep your afterschool program going by obtaining funds and supplies from several different sources. This way, if one source of funding dwindles or disappears, your program will remain afloat.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Start-an-Afterschool-Program#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-10-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Start an Afterschool Program Step 10 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e6/Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-10-Version-3.jpg/aid10912354-v4-728px-Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-10-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Start-an-Afterschool-Program&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Implementing the Program\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Implementing-the-Program\">Implementing the Program</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Provide structure but be flexible in your programming. Afterschool programs should supplement and enrich, not simply extend the school day. After attending school all day, students deserve a change of pace. You may require certain activities, like completing homework or rehearsing a piece of music, but students also need time to relax and have some fun.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Start-an-Afterschool-Program#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-11-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Start an Afterschool Program Step 11 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b6/Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-11-Version-3.jpg/aid10912354-v4-728px-Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-11-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Set-up stations for students like an arts and crafts station, a building station, a games station, and a reading station. This allows students to choose between a variety of different options within an organized structure.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Start-an-Afterschool-Program#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Offer nutritious snacks. An aftercare program extends a student’s day to as many as 10-12 hours, or more. It’s important to provide healthy nourishment so that your students have the energy and focus they need to make the most of your programming.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Start-an-Afterschool-Program#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-12-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Start an Afterschool Program Step 12 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/46/Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-12-Version-3.jpg/aid10912354-v4-728px-Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-12-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Ask parents and students about any food allergies your students may have before offering snacks.</li> \n    <li>Fruits, like apples, whole grains crackers, and protein, like cheese, nuts, or hummus, are great options.</li> \n    <li>Avoid foods that are high in sugar as these cause an initial spike in energy levels, followed by a steep decline.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Include students in decision-making. To help your students get the most out of their afterschool experience, allow them to have some control over the programming. This can be as simple as letting them vote on a theme to explore as a group or letting them participate in decisions about what snack to eat.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Start-an-Afterschool-Program#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-13-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Start an Afterschool Program Step 13 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7d/Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-13-Version-3.jpg/aid10912354-v4-728px-Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-13-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>By allowing them to participate in this way, you’ll help create a stronger sense of community and belonging in your students</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Use themes to connect different activities. Students are more likely to participate in activities if they understand why they are doing them. Moving through different not only keeps things interesting with variety, it also provides students with a sense of purpose for each individual activity.<sup id=\"_ref-18\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Start-an-Afterschool-Program#_note-18\">[18]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-14-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Start an Afterschool Program Step 14 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5b/Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-14-Version-3.jpg/aid10912354-v4-728px-Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-14-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, one theme you could explore might be “spring.” Your arts and crafts activities could revolve around making flower and gardening-themed projects. You might offer building activities that include making birdhouses or terrariums. You can learn songs, games, and dances related to the seasonal change, as well.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Start-an-Afterschool-Program&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns\">\n  <ol </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 21 Sep 2021 08:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1d/Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid10912354-v4-728px-Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-1-Version-3.jpg","linkMd5":"0bfe8e83c317efe6b8669b673395dfe0","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn3@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-36-685_6ffe34fbba3783e0.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":42821,"destBytes":25978,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1d/Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid10912354-v4-728px-Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-1-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn3@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-36-685_6ffe34fbba3783e0.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b3/Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid10912354-v4-728px-Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-2-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn95@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-41-882_3c51b1946bdf7a5c.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/24/Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid10912354-v4-728px-Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-3-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn100@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-40-998_a7e14de9c89ed9c4.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d4/Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid10912354-v4-728px-Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-4-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn57@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-41-703_458f59b39e4992e0.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/93/Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid10912354-v4-728px-Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-5-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn3@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-40-607_3a487470cb7a5119.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/55/Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-6-Version-3.jpg/aid10912354-v4-728px-Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-6-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn80@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-41-818_6dbe8b69ecef9254.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/75/Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid10912354-v4-728px-Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-7-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn48@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-41-707_af796b9a5d07f3ee.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8d/Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid10912354-v4-728px-Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-8-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn96@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-39-420_56d0e99fbeb8c8bf.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7f/Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-9-Version-3.jpg/aid10912354-v4-728px-Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-9-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn36@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-42-049_03a3eb75ea110a7a.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e6/Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-10-Version-3.jpg/aid10912354-v4-728px-Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-10-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn81@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-42-283_c95d1f7eeed79e90.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b6/Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-11-Version-3.jpg/aid10912354-v4-728px-Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-11-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn8@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-42-324_4752e1bacb6a21f9.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/46/Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-12-Version-3.jpg/aid10912354-v4-728px-Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-12-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn95@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-40-113_53e6d89a7ea86bf5.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7d/Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-13-Version-3.jpg/aid10912354-v4-728px-Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-13-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn68@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-39-749_1908a3b9931c9cac.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5b/Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-14-Version-3.jpg/aid10912354-v4-728px-Start-an-Afterschool-Program-Step-14-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn84@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-43-171_f218a639044006e8.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761719633},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","title":"How to Flip an Omelet","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Flip-an-Omelet","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Omelets are a classic breakfast choice, but they can be fragile and hard to flip correctly. By knowing the right way to use a spatula and pan and a few different flipping methods, you'll quickly master the omelet flip and make your omelet cook and look how it should. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Flip-an-Omelet&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Flip-an-Omelet&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Using a Spatula\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Using-a-Spatula\">Using a Spatula</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Allow the eggs to turn white on the edges of the omelet. Timing is everything in omelet flipping, and a good rule of thumb is to look for solidified eggs on the edges. Once they have begun to turn white, you have a short amount of time before they become too hard. Use medium heat and allow the center to solidify slightly.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Flip-an-Omelet#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Flip-an-Omelet-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Flip an Omelet Step 1 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/95/Flip-an-Omelet-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid651993-v4-728px-Flip-an-Omelet-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Flipping an omelet when the sides have started to turn brown will sometimes result in an omelet that is well-done on the outside, but runny inside.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Insert the spatula underneath your omelet. Look for which side has the most cooked-through eggs, and insert the spatula about 1/3 of the way in. Don't insert it all the way to the center, or you may end up splitting the omelet in half.<br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you can't get the spatula underneath the eggs cleanly, you may not have used enough oil or butter, or you may need to let the omelet cook longer to solidify more.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Lift the side of the omelet slightly, looking for breaks. Make sure the side that you plan to fold stays together before committing to the flip. You don't need to insert the spatula any further than 1/3 of the way.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Flip-an-Omelet#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If the eggs seem to start breaking apart, either try to flip it from another side or wait a few seconds longer to let the eggs cook through more.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Flip and fold the omelet. If your eggs are white on the sides and have begun to solidify in the center, the omelet is ready to be flipped. Gently lift one side with the spatula to fold it in half, and press down on the top to allow the center to stick together.<br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Allow the side still on the pan to cook to a golden brown, then flip it again, and allow the other side to cook to a golden brown too.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Flip-an-Omelet&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Inverting Onto a Plate\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Inverting-Onto-a-Plate\">Inverting Onto a Plate</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Grab a plate that is about larger than your pan on each side. Don't use a plate the same size as your pan or smaller or your omelet will not fit and could spill over the side of the plate.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Flip-an-Omelet-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Flip an Omelet Step 5 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b5/Flip-an-Omelet-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid651993-v4-728px-Flip-an-Omelet-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Tip the pan to allow the omelet to fall halfway onto the plate. With the bottom of the omelet solidified, you will be able to slide it off without breaking it.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Flip-an-Omelet#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup> Make sure the pan and the plate are touching so the omelet does not fall from a height - you want to slide it out, not drop it out.<br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Don't tip the whole omelet onto the plate, as you will need to use the pan's edge to flip it in half.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Fold the other half with the edge of the pan. With half of the omelet in the pan and half on the plate, carefully move the pan forward over the plate to allow the other half to slide onto itself.<br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Don't raise the pan high or you may accidentally drop the omelet by dragging it off the plate. Instead, use a slow forward motion to push the omelet onto itself.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Flip-an-Omelet#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Flip-an-Omelet&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Flipping With the Pan\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Flipping-With-the-Pan\">Flipping With the Pan</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Tilt the pan to a 30-degree angle with the far edge tilted down. This will allow you to snap your wrist and flip the omelet in one smooth motion.<br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Tilting the pan more than 30 degrees could cause the omelet to slip out, and less will not give you good leverage for the flipping motion.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Flip-an-Omelet#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Shake the pan gently to ensure the bottom of the omelet is loose. Make sure the bottom is solidified and does not stick to the pan, which can be done by gently shaking the pan to allow the omelet to slide around.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Flip-an-Omelet#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Flipping an omelet that is stuck to the pan will make a mess, as some of it will stick in the pan and some of it will fly out.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Throw the pan forward, upward, and back in a sharp motion. Thrust forward to about the halfway point in the omelet, then flick your wrist upward slightly to lift half the omelet up. Then, sharply draw the pan slightly back towards you, lifting the far edge to fold the omelet in half.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Flip-an-Omelet#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you flick too hard you could end up flipping the entire thing over, but flick too soft and you won't get a proper fold.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Flip-an-Omelet&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Video\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Video\">Video</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Flip-an-Omelet&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Chop fillings into smaller pieces, and use less than you think. Having too much filling in an omelet makes it much harder to flip, as does having chunky fillings.</li> \n  <li>Opt for a non-stick pan. Any size pan will work for omelets, but small non-stick pans are your best bet for cooking the omelet through and maintaining its shape.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Flip-an-Omelet#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup></li> \n  <li>Add shredded cheese into the mix before you pour the egg into the pan. This acts as a binder and can help keep the omelet together when you flip it.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Flip-an-Omelet#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Flip-an-Omelet&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Warnings\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Warnings\">Warnings</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Be careful of grease and oil when flipping. If there is too much oil in the pan when you go to flip, pour the excess out into a container to prevent burning yourself.</li> \n  <li>Don't turn the heat up too high as you may cook the outside too quickly and leave the inside liquefied. Cooking at medium heat is best because it allows the omelet to cook fully through.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Flip-an-Omelet#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Flip-an-Omelet&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Things You'll Need\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Things-You'll-Need\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Things-You.27ll-Need\">Things You'll Need</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Spatula</li> \n  <li>Non-stick pan</li> \n  <li>Plate</li> \n  <li>Omelette ingredients (eggs, cheese, fillings)</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Flip-an-Omelet&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: Related wikiHows\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Related-wikiHows\">Related wikiHows</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-Mushroom-Omelette\" title=\"Make a Mushroom Omelette\">Make a Mushroom Omelette</a></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Flip-an-Omelet&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Flip-an-Omelet&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11\" title=\"Edit section: Quick Summary\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Quick-Summary\">Quick Summary</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap\">\n  <ol class=\"references\"> \n   <li id=\"_note-1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Flip-an-Omelet#_ref-1\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.eggrecipes.co.uk/ways-to-cook/omelettes-tortillas-frittatas/cooking-tips/how-flip-omelette\">https://www.eggrecipes.co.uk/ways-to-cook/omelettes-tortillas-frittatas/cooking-tips/how-flip-omelette</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Flip-an-Omelet#_ref-2\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Flip-an-Omelet#_ref-3\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" \n   <li id=\"_note-6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Flip-an-Omelet#_ref-6\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.incredibleegg.org/cooking-school/egg-cookery/make-an-omelet\">https://www.incredibleegg.org/cooking-school/egg-cookery/make-an-omelet</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Flip-an-Omelet#_ref-7\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.foodnetwork.com/recipes/alton-brown/perfect-omelet-recipe-2107557\">https://www.foodnetwork.com/recipes/alton-brown/perfect-omelet-recipe-2107557</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Flip-an-Omelet#_ref-8\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.bonappetit.com/test-kitchen/common-mistakes/article/omelet-common-mistakes\">https://www.bonappetit.com/test-kitchen/common-mistakes/article/omelet-common-mistakes</a></span> </li>
