class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.finecooking.com/article/mastering-the-omelet\">https://www.finecooking.com/article/mastering-the-omelet</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Flip-an-Omelet#_ref-10\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.incredibleegg.org/cooking-school/egg-cookery/make-an-omelet\">https://www.incredibleegg.org/cooking-school/egg-cookery/make-an-omelet</a></span> </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 21 Sep 2021 00:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/95/Flip-an-Omelet-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid651993-v4-728px-Flip-an-Omelet-Step-1-Version-3.jpg","linkMd5":"78f0bd65cdb68bf1b583bde75afa51cb","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn100@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-31-395_3c82f4d515b93117.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":410,"sourceBytes":76842,"destBytes":53692,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/95/Flip-an-Omelet-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid651993-v4-728px-Flip-an-Omelet-Step-1-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn100@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-31-395_3c82f4d515b93117.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b5/Flip-an-Omelet-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid651993-v4-728px-Flip-an-Omelet-Step-5-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn18@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-43-316_2aeb4a9b9d5348a6.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761719624},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","title":"How to Draw a Skull","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Draw-a-Skull","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Whether you're drawing anatomy or preparing for Halloween, learning to draw skulls is a practice in proportion. Start with a simple circle and make a few faint guidelines that help you place the jawline, teeth, and eye sockets. Once you draw these outlines, give your skull definition by shading in the shadows. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Draw-a-Skull&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Draw-a-Skull&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Sketching the Front View of a Skull\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Sketching-the-Front-View-of-a-Skull\">Sketching the Front View of a Skull</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Make a circle. Press lightly with your pencil to make a faint <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Draw-a-Circle\" title=\"Draw a Circle\">circle</a>. Sketch the circle so it's as wide as you'd like the whole skull to be. You'll use this outline to make the top portion of the skull.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Draw-a-Skull#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup><br /><br />\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Draw-a-Skull-Step-1-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Draw a Skull Step 1 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b1/Draw-a-Skull-Step-1-Version-4.jpg/aid214430-v4-728px-Draw-a-Skull-Step-1-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you're struggling to draw a circle, use a compass or trace a round object that's as large as you want the skull to be.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Draw a straight horizontal and vertical line through the center of the circle. To make guidelines for placing features, lay a ruler on your paper so it passes through the middle of the circle. Make a straight horizontal line and then turn the ruler to make a vertical line.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Draw-a-Skull#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Make the vertical line extend below the circle so you can use it to draw the jaw.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Create 2 hexagons along the bottom of the horizontal line. Draw an eye socket in both of the bottom quarters of the circle. Make the top line of each <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Draw-a-Hexagon\" title=\"Draw a Hexagon\">hexagon</a> along the horizontal guideline and sketch each hexagon large enough to fill half of each quarter.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Draw-a-Skull#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Leave a space that's 1/5 the width of the circle between the hexagons.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Sketch the nose cavity along the vertical guideline. Make a short horizontal line on the vertical guideline so it's halfway down the eye sockets. Draw a straight line that comes down from each end and away from the center of the circle. When your pencil is close to the bottom of the circle, bring the 2 lines together in a point at the very bottom of the circle on the vertical line.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Draw-a-Skull#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>The nose cavity is diamond-shaped near the bottom, but boxier near the top.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Draw the angular outline of the sides and middle of the skull. Lightly sketch from the temples towards the eye socket so the skull bulges out a little. Curve the line back towards the center of the skull before making it curve away at the level of the nose cavity. Then, draw a straight line down at an angle below the nose cavity. Make this line go across horizontally to connect to the opposite side of the skull.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Draw-a-Skull#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Repeat this on the opposite side so it connects with the line you just drew.</li> \n    <li>Draw the horizontal line of the middle of the skull so it's about twice the width of the nose cavity.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Make the upper teeth along the horizontal line in the middle of the skull. Draw vertical ovals that extend below the line to make the teeth. Each tooth should be about 1/2 the size of the distance between the bottom of the nasal cavity and line for teeth. Sketch 3 full-size teeth to the right and the left of the vertical guideline. Then, draw 2 smaller ovals that at both ends to show teeth that are receding.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Draw-a-Skull#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Draw the teeth as rounded or square as you like. Consider using a reference photo to help you <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Learn-Anatomy-for-Drawing\" title=\"Learn Anatomy for Drawing\">draw anatomically</a> since people's teeth are quite unique.</li> \n    <li>If you want the skull to be missing a few teeth, leave some of them out as you draw.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Draw the outline of the jaw. Measure the distance from the top of the skull to the point where the horizontal and vertical guidelines meet. Draw a horizontal line that's the same distance from the bottom of the nose cavity to the bottom of jaw. Sketch the line so it's about half the length of the teeth and draw a straight line at each end that angles up and away from the center. Then, draw a straight line that connects the bottom of the jaw to each side of the skull.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Draw-a-Skull#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Make both of the straight lines at an angle the same length as the horizontal line in the center of the jaw.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Sketch the lower teeth along the jaw. Make the teeth about the same size as the upper teeth and draw the teeth in the front larger than the ones on the sides. Draw 4 or 5 teeth on each side of the vertical guideline and make 1 or 2 small teeth off to the sides.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Draw-a-Skull#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>To give the skull some perspective, you can draw a small gap at each end of the line of teeth. This shows space between the skull and the jaw.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Fill in the nasal and eye cavities. Use a darker pencil or press firmly to shade in each eye socket and the nasal cavity. Since these are deep and empty, make them darker than other parts of the skull that you'll be shading.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Draw-a-Skull#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you want the cavities to be smooth, go back with a <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Use-Blending-Stumps\" title=\"Use Blending Stumps\">blending stump</a> to rub the graphite.</li> \n    <li>To make the teeth stand out, go over the lines between the teeth and the skull and jaw again.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Erase unnecessary guidelines. Before you start shading in the skull, take an eraser and remove the horizontal and vertical guidelines that are still visible. Lightly erase the lines for the circle as well.<br /><br />\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Draw-a-Skull-Step-10-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Draw a Skull Step 10 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f8/Draw-a-Skull-Step-10-Version-3.jpg/aid214430-v4-728px-Draw-a-Skull-Step-10-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Take care to not erase the actual drawing when you're removing the guidelines.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Shade in the skull to show depth. Lightly cross-hatch or <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Shade-Drawings\" title=\"Shade Drawings\">shade</a> in the space above the eye cavities where the brow would be. Keep going over the spaces until they appear deeper-set than the rest of the skull. Other areas to shade include:<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Draw-a-Skull#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>The top sides of the skull</li> \n    <li>Along the jawline</li> \n    <li>To the sides of the nasal cavity</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Draw-a-Skull&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Drawing the Side View of a Skull\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Drawing-the-Side-View-of-a-Skull\">Drawing the Side View of a Skull</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Draw a circle that's slightly longer at the ends. Instead of making an oval with narrow ends, sketch a circle that's as big as you want the skull to be. Make the circle a little longer than it is wide, but don't make the ends taper.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Draw-a-Skull#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup><br /><br />\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Draw-a-Skull-Step-12-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Draw a Skull Step 12 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4e/Draw-a-Skull-Step-12-Version-3.jpg/aid214430-v4-728px-Draw-a-Skull-Step-12-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Sketch a concentric circle and make guidelines through the skull. Lightly draw another circle inside the one you just drew. Make this circle 1/4 the distance from the larger circle. Then, draw a horizontal line through the center of the skull and make a vertical line that also passes through the middle. To help you draw the jaw, put your pencil on the vertical line where it touches the bottom of the smaller circle. Draw a straight horizontal line to 1 side of the skull.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Draw-a-Skull#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Draw lightly so you can erase the guidelines later.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Create the outline of the jaw to 1 side of the skull. Sketch a faint vertical line coming straight down from the side of the skull where you're positioning the jaw. Put your pencil where the jaw's vertical guideline meets the horizontal line you just drew. Create a curved line that extends away from the skull and down towards the bottom of the jaw. Once this line is the same length as half of the skull's width, make it into a straight line that angles back up towards the skull.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Draw-a-Skull#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Make the outline of the jaw stop at the smaller concentric circle where it meets the vertical guideline.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Draw the nose cavity and where the brow sticks out. Place your pencil on the top of the jawline where it sticks away from the skull. As you draw up towards where the nose would be, make the line curve in towards where the bottom horizontal guideline meets the vertical guideline of the jaw. Then, draw the line back up at an angle and make it bump out a little.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Draw-a-Skull#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>The top bump is the brow before it reconnects to the skull.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Sketch the eyesocket and shade it in. Draw a vertical crescent shape just behind and below the brow. Extend the crescent until it's halfway down the length of the nose cavity. Then, shade in the eye socket so it looks empty and deep.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Draw-a-Skull#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup><br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Draw a jagged line at the bottom of the skull where it meets the jawline. Sketch a line coming down below the eye socket and bring it up towards the center of the skull. Keep drawing the line in a horizontal direction that zigs and zags a little until it reaches the center jawline. Then, make the jagged line bend down so it connects to the curve of the skull.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Draw-a-Skull#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>This creates the bottom of the skull itself.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Make the upper and lower rows of teeth. Draw an elongated S-shape down the middle of the jaw and make 2 faint horizontal lines that go from the side of the jaw to the shape. Leave a gap between the lines that's big enough to fit the teeth. Then, draw 6 or 7 teeth along each horizontal line. Make the teeth that are closest to the S-shape about the same width as the eye socket. Sketch the teeth at the other end of the row progressively smaller until they're only slivers at the end.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Draw-a-Skull#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup><br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Erase visible guidelines. To make your drawing look finished, use a small eraser and remove the horizontal and vertical guidelines that you can still see. If you've already drawn over them, leave them. Just erase the ones that stand out.<sup id=\"_ref-18\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Draw-a-Skull#_note-18\">[18]</a></sup><br /><br />\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Draw-a-Skull-Step-19-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Draw a Skull Step 19 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/61/Draw-a-Skull-Step-19-Version-2.jpg/aid214430-v4-728px-Draw-a-Skull-Step-19-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Instead of using a large eraser, try working with the eraser on the end of a pencil.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Shade in parts of the skull where you want to show depth. Press firmly as you sketch along the back of the skull to show its curve. Then, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Shade-Drawings\" title=\"Shade Drawings\">shade</a> in the center of the skull behind the eye socket. Make this a large crescent shape and use cross-hatching to make the skull appear bumpy.<sup id=\"_ref-19\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 19\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Draw-a-Skull#_note-19\">[19]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Make the jaw look distinctive by shading the top of it where it meets the bottom of the skull.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Draw-a-Skull&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Video\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Video\">Video</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Draw-a-Skull&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Embellish your skull by drawing flames, crossbones, wings, or roses around it.</li> \n  <li>Go back and color in the skull with colored pencils or markers if you like.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Draw-a-Skull&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Things You'll Need\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Things-You'll-Need\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Things-You.27ll-Need\">Things You'll Need</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Pencil</li> \n  <li>Ruler</li> \n  <li>Eraser</li> \n  <li>Paper</li> \n  <li>Blending stump, optional</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Draw-a-Skull&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Related wikiHows\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Related-wikiHows\">Related wikiHows</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Draw-a-Detailed-Tree\" title=\"Draw a Detailed Tree\">Draw a Detailed Tree</a></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Draw-a-Skull&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Draw-a-Skull&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: Quick Summary\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Quick-Summary\">Quick Summary</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap href=\"https://youtu.be/bT-HGNkFKnc?t=647\">https://youtu.be/bT-HGNkFKnc?t=647</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Draw-a-Skull#_ref-15\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://youtu.be/bT-HGNkFKnc?t=684\">https://youtu.be/bT-HGNkFKnc?t=684</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Draw-a-Skull#_ref-16\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://youtu.be/bT-HGNkFKnc?t=752\">https://youtu.be/bT-HGNkFKnc?t=752</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Draw-a-Skull#_ref-17\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://youtu.be/bT-HGNkFKnc?t=897\">https://youtu.be/bT-HGNkFKnc?t=897</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Draw-a-Skull#_ref-18\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://youtu.be/bT-HGNkFKnc?t=798\">https://youtu.be/bT-HGNkFKnc?t=798</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-19\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Draw-a-Skull#_ref-19\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://youtu.be/bT-HGNkFKnc?t=798\">https://youtu.be/bT-HGNkFKnc?t=798</a></span> </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 19 Sep 2021 16:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b1/Draw-a-Skull-Step-1-Version-4.jpg/aid214430-v4-728px-Draw-a-Skull-Step-1-Version-4.jpg","linkMd5":"e781d1ca42f3d1a02879acfe67221cf6","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn40@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-31-182_de0e2fae746919fa.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":410,"sourceBytes":11346,"destBytes":4218,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b1/Draw-a-Skull-Step-1-Version-4.jpg/aid214430-v4-728px-Draw-a-Skull-Step-1-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn40@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-31-182_de0e2fae746919fa.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f8/Draw-a-Skull-Step-10-Version-3.jpg/aid214430-v4-728px-Draw-a-Skull-Step-10-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn47@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-39-648_7663c6b27f1e7d72.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4e/Draw-a-Skull-Step-12-Version-3.jpg/aid214430-v4-728px-Draw-a-Skull-Step-12-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn80@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-40-729_aad6304190200b3d.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/61/Draw-a-Skull-Step-19-Version-2.jpg/aid214430-v4-728px-Draw-a-Skull-Step-19-Version-2.jpg":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761719636},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","title":"How to Soften Butter","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Soften-Butter","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Butter is a key ingredient in many recipes and is crucial for creating delicious baked goods. Many recipes call for softened butter, but you may have forgotten to leave a stick out at room temperature. If you need to soften butter quickly, there are many ways to do it. Just be careful not to heat the butter too much or else it will melt! </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Soften-Butter&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Soften-Butter&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Chopping Butter into Smaller Pieces\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Chopping-Butter-into-Smaller-Pieces\">Chopping Butter into Smaller Pieces</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Measure-Butter\" title=\"Measure Butter\">Measure the amount of butter</a> you need. Cut and measure your butter before you soften it since the stick could deform. Consult the recipe you’re using to see how much butter you need before using a measuring spoon or kitchen scale to get the exact amount you need.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Soften-Butter#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Soften-Butter-Step-1-Version-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Soften Butter Step 1 Version 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/36/Soften-Butter-Step-1-Version-5.jpg/aid1384812-v4-728px-Soften-Butter-Step-1-Version-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If the butter is still in its wrapper, you may be able to see the measurements printed on the side so you can accurately cut it.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Cut the butter into cubes. Use a sharp knife to cut the measured butter into small chunks. Make sure the chunks are about the same size so they all soften evenly. Separate the cubes from one another so they don’t stick together since that could slow down how fast they soften.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Soften-Butter#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>The increased surface area of the butter will allow it to soften faster.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Leave the butter at room temperature for 10-20 minutes. Set the chunks of butter on a plate and cover them with a tray or aluminum foil so nothing can get into the butter. Keep the butter in a place out of direct sunlight so it doesn’t melt. Leave the butter for about 20 minutes so it’s soft and easily spreadable.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Soften-Butter#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Soften-Butter-Step-3-Version-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Soften Butter Step 3 Version 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ed/Soften-Butter-Step-3-Version-5.jpg/aid1384812-v4-728px-Soften-Butter-Step-3-Version-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Soften-Butter&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Rolling the Butter\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Rolling-the-Butter\">Rolling the Butter</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Place the butter between 2 sheets of wax paper. Lay out a piece of wax paper on a flat countertop and set the amount of butter you need in the middle of the sheet. Put another layer of wax paper on top of the butter and press it down firmly so it stays in place. Make sure the wax paper pieces are the same size so the butter doesn’t squeeze out the side.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Soften-Butter#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You may choose to cut the butter into cubes beforehand if you want.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Hit the butter with a rolling pin 3-4 times to pound it down. Keep the wax paper in place with your non-dominant hand and hold a rolling pin by one of the handles with your other hand. Hit the butter firmly with your rolling pin 3-4 times to start the flattening process. Hit the butter until it’s a uniform thickness throughout.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Soften-Butter#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup><br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Roll the butter flat with the rolling pin. Once the butter is slightly flattened after hitting it, hold your rolling pin with both hands and spread it out like you would with dough. Aim to get the butter between thick to maximize the surface area. When you’re finished, peel off the top layer of wax paper.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Soften-Butter#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup><br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Leave the butter at room temperature for about 5 minutes. The butter should feel relatively soft after you roll it out, but leave it on your counter for another 5 minutes. Once the butter is completely soft, peel it off of the wax paper and mix it in with the rest of your ingredients.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Soften-Butter#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Soften-Butter-Step-7-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Soften Butter Step 7 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e9/Soften-Butter-Step-7-Version-4.jpg/aid1384812-v4-728px-Soften-Butter-Step-7-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Softened butter could possibly stick to the wax paper. If you need to, scrape the butter with a knife to get it off completely.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Soften-Butter&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Grating the Butter\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Grating-the-Butter\">Grating the Butter</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Measure the amount of butter you need for your recipe. Look at the side of the butter’s wrapper to see the measurements. Use a knife to cut the amount of butter you need for your recipe. If the butter is out of the wrapper, use measuring spoons or a kitchen scale to find the amount that you need.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Soften-Butter#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Soften-Butter-Step-8-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Soften Butter Step 8 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/21/Soften-Butter-Step-8-Version-4.jpg/aid1384812-v4-728px-Soften-Butter-Step-8-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Grate the butter into a bowl. Use the side of a box grater that has the largest holes so the butter pieces are the right size and shape for baking. Hold the grater and butter over a clean bowl so the pieces can fall in easily. Press the butter into the side of the grater with a firm amount of pressure to grate it into the bowl. Continue grating the butter until all of the pieces are in the bowl.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Soften-Butter#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Only move the butter up and down rather than moving the grater. This will make it easier for you to grate.</li> \n    <li>Grating works best if the butter comes directly out of the fridge or freezer.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Let the butter pieces soften for 5 minutes before adding it to your recipe. Leave the butter pieces in the bowl and let them heat up to room temperature for about 5 minutes. This will ensure that they’re soft and mix well with any other ingredients you’re using.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Soften-Butter#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Soften-Butter-Step-10-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Soften Butter Step 10 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/59/Soften-Butter-Step-10-Version-4.jpg/aid1384812-v4-728px-Soften-Butter-Step-10-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Grated butter works best for making crumbles or shortbread since it mixes thoroughly with the other ingredients.</li> \n    <li>You can grate the butter directly in the bowl with your other ingredients if you want.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Soften-Butter&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Using a Double Boiler\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Using-a-Double-Boiler\">Using a Double Boiler</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Heat of water in a pot. Put the water in a small pot and warm it up over medium heat. Keep heating the water until it starts steaming, and then reduce the temperature to low heat.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Soften-Butter#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup><br /><br />\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Soften-Butter-Step-11-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Soften Butter Step 11 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/44/Soften-Butter-Step-11-Version-4.jpg/aid1384812-v4-728px-Soften-Butter-Step-11-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You don’t need to bring the water to a boil or else it may get too hot.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Set a glass or metal bowl on top of the pot. Put a heat-safe bowl over the pot to cover it. Make sure the bowl covers the opening on the pot entirely or else it may not heat up as well. Let the bowl heat up for 1-2 minutes so it’s warm to the touch.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Soften-Butter#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Soften-Butter-Step-12-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Soften Butter Step 12 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/df/Soften-Butter-Step-12-Version-4.jpg/aid1384812-v4-728px-Soften-Butter-Step-12-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you have a special double boiler pot, you can use that as well.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Put your butter into the bowl to soften it. Place the amount of butter you need for your recipe inside the bowl and watch it carefully. The steam from the pot will heat up the bowl and start to soften the butter. Test the softness of the butter with a spoon to see if it’s still hard or not. When the butter breaks apart easily with a spoon, take the bowl off the pot.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Soften-Butter#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Be sure to remove the bowl before the butter starts to melt.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Soften-Butter&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Heating the Butter in a Microwave\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Heating-the-Butter-in-a-Microwave\">Heating the Butter in a Microwave</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Cut the butter into squares. Measure out the amount of butter you need for your recipe and cut it off the stick with a chef’s knife. Then use your knife to cut the pieces into chunks so it softens faster. Put all of the chunks in a microwave-safe container.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Soften-Butter#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Soften-Butter-Step-14-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Soften Butter Step 14 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cd/Soften-Butter-Step-14-Version-4.jpg/aid1384812-v4-728px-Soften-Butter-Step-14-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You don’t need to cut the butter, but it will make it soften faster in your microwave.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Put the butter in your microwave for 5 seconds. Set the container of butter in the center of the microwave and turn it on for 5 seconds. Watch the butter as the microwave runs to make sure it doesn’t melt. After the microwave is finished, test the hardness of your butter with your finger or a spoon. See if the cubes feel solid in the center or if they’re soft.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Soften-Butter#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Soften-Butter-Step-15-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Soften Butter Step 15 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/df/Soften-Butter-Step-15-Version-4.jpg/aid1384812-v4-728px-Soften-Butter-Step-15-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>In most microwaves, your butter won’t be fully softened after the first 5 seconds.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Use 5 seconds increments until the butter is soft but not melted. If your butter still feels hard after the first time you microwave it, put it in for another 5 seconds. Be sure to watch the butter so it doesn’t start melting. When the butter feels soft throughout, take it out and incorporate it in your recipe.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Soften-Butter#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Soften-Butter-Step-16-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Soften Butter Step 16 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/93/Soften-Butter-Step-16-Version-4.jpg/aid1384812-v4-728px-Soften-Butter-Step-16-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Butter can melt quickly in a microwave, so be ready to stop the machine at a moment’s notice.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <p><br /> </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Soften-Butter&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Video\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Video\">Video</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Soften-Butter&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Leave a whole stick of butter on a plate or tray at room temperature so you always have softened butter whenever you need to use it.</li> \n  <li>Use unsalted butter while you’re baking so it doesn’t affect the flavor of your baked goods.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Soften-Butter&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: Warnings\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Warnings\">Warnings</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Do not allow butter to melt when softening since it may negatively impact your baking.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Soften-Butter&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10\" title=\"Edit section: Things You’ll Need\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Things-You’ll-Need\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Things-You.E2.80.99ll-Need\">Things You’ll Need</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Soften-Butter&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11\" title=\"Edit section: Chopping Butter into Smaller Pieces\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Chopping-Butter-into-Smaller-Pieces_2\">Chopping Butter into Smaller Pieces</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Cutting board</li> \n  <li>Chef’s knife</li> \n  <li>Plate</li>\n </ul> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Soften-Butter&amp;action=edit&amp;section=12\" title=\"Edit section: Rolling the Butter\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Rolling-the-Butter_2\">Rolling the Butter</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Knife</li> \n  <li>Wax paper</li> \n  <li>Rolling pin</li>\n </ul> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Soften-Butter&amp;action=edit&amp;section=13\" title=\"Edit section: Grating the Butter\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Grating-the-Butter_2\">Grating the Butter</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Box grater</li> \n  <li>Bowl</li>\n </ul> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Soften-Butter&amp;action=edit&amp;section=14\" title=\"Edit section: Using a Double Boiler\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Using-a-Double-Boiler_2\">Using a Double Boiler</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Pot</li> \n  <li>Glass or metal bowl</li> \n  <li>Oven mitt</li>\n </ul> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Soften-Butter&amp;action=edit&amp;section=15\" title=\"Edit section: Heating the Butter in a Microwave\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Heating-the-Butter-in-a-Microwave_2\">Heating the Butter in a Microwave</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Chef’s knife</li> \n  <li>Microwave-safe bowl</li> \n  <li>Microwave</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Soften-Butter&amp;action=edit&amp;section=16\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Soften-Butter&amp;action=edit&amp;section=17\" title=\"Edit section: Quick Summary\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Quick-Summary\">Quick Summary</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns\">\n  <ol class=\"references\"> \n   <li id=\"_note-1\"><a href=\"https://www.mybakingaddiction.com/how-to-soften-butter/\">https://www.mybakingaddiction.com/how-to-soften-butter/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Soften-Butter#_ref-2\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.mybakingaddiction.com/how-to-soften-butter/\">https://www.mybakingaddiction.com/how-to-soften-butter/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Soften-Butter#_ref-3\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Soften-Butter#_ref-5\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Soften-Butter#_ref-6\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.simplyrecipes.com/recipes/tip_how_to_soften_butter_quickly/\">https://www.simplyrecipes.com/recipes/tip_how_to_soften_butter_quickly/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Soften-Butter#_ref-7\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.simplyrecipes.com/recipes/tip_how_to_soften_butter_quickly/\">https://www.simplyrecipes.com/recipes/tip_how_to_soften_butter_quickly/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-8\"><a </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Soften-Butter#_ref-9\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Soften-Butter#_ref-10\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Soften-Butter#_ref-11\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer id=\"_note-12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Soften-Butter#_ref-12\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" \n   <li id=\"_note-13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Soften-Butter#_ref-13\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.thekitchn.com/3-ways-to-soften-butter-quickly-and-easily-54814\">https://www.thekitchn.com/3-ways-to-soften-butter-quickly-and-easily-54814</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Soften-Butter#_ref-14\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.mybakingaddiction.com/how-to-soften-butter/\">https://www.mybakingaddiction.com/how-to-soften-butter/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Soften-Butter#_ref-15\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.mybakingaddiction.com/how-to-soften-butter/\">https://www.mybakingaddiction.com/how-to-soften-butter/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Soften-Butter#_ref-16\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.mybakingaddiction.com/how-to-soften-butter/\">https://www.mybakingaddiction.com/how-to-soften-butter/</a></span> </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 27 Sep 2021 08:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/36/Soften-Butter-Step-1-Version-5.jpg/aid1384812-v4-728px-Soften-Butter-Step-1-Version-5.jpg","linkMd5":"43c02b09bf8a637af2f12e65497ce7c1","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn36@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-27-614_d017c092a7538f30.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":410,"sourceBytes":75401,"destBytes":49692,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/36/Soften-Butter-Step-1-Version-5.jpg/aid1384812-v4-728px-Soften-Butter-Step-1-Version-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn36@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-27-614_d017c092a7538f30.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ed/Soften-Butter-Step-3-Version-5.jpg/aid1384812-v4-728px-Soften-Butter-Step-3-Version-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn50@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-41-366_69b10d15e5c168c5.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e9/Soften-Butter-Step-7-Version-4.jpg/aid1384812-v4-728px-Soften-Butter-Step-7-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn40@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-42-984_f8e1436a0cc618d8.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/21/Soften-Butter-Step-8-Version-4.jpg/aid1384812-v4-728px-Soften-Butter-Step-8-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn75@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-41-577_06d6a2b6d45711b5.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/59/Soften-Butter-Step-10-Version-4.jpg/aid1384812-v4-728px-Soften-Butter-Step-10-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn24@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-40-024_f7025a57e1a4b466.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/44/Soften-Butter-Step-11-Version-4.jpg/aid1384812-v4-728px-Soften-Butter-Step-11-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn57@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-52-002_1509c139f86985f6.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/df/Soften-Butter-Step-12-Version-4.jpg/aid1384812-v4-728px-Soften-Butter-Step-12-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn98@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-42-210_c97eb56a63a3992c.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cd/Soften-Butter-Step-14-Version-4.jpg/aid1384812-v4-728px-Soften-Butter-Step-14-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn43@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-41-740_151ca79125f56045.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/df/Soften-Butter-Step-15-Version-4.jpg/aid1384812-v4-728px-Soften-Butter-Step-15-Version-4.jpg":null,"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/93/Soften-Butter-Step-16-Version-4.jpg/aid1384812-v4-728px-Soften-Butter-Step-16-Version-4.jpg":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761719656},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","title":"How to Fix the Skin Around Your Nails","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Many people suffer from dry, cracked skin surrounding their nails due to things like cold, dry weather and <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stop-Biting-Your-Nails\" title=\"Stop Biting Your Nails\">biting their nails</a>. Along with biting their nails, sometimes people even bite the skin surrounding their nail. This can lead to painful rips and tears that have the potential to become infected. Thankfully, dry, cracked, and ripped skin around the nail can be repaired by following a few easy steps to ensure your hands stay groomed and moisturized. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Repairing Your Cuticles\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Repairing-Your-Cuticles\">Repairing Your Cuticles</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Soak your hands. Take a medium sized bowl and fill it approximately 4 inches deep with warm water. Dip your hands in the water, making sure to submerge your nails and cuticles. Soak your hands for about 5 minutes.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails-Step-1-Version-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Fix the Skin Around Your Nails Step 1 Version 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d0/Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails-Step-1-Version-6.jpg/aid1975-v4-728px-Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails-Step-1-Version-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"485\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Warm water helps to soften the skin around the nail for easy and pain-free grooming.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Dry your hands. Pat dry your hands with a towel. Your cuticles should be free of water drops, but still moist. You want your skin to stay moist and soft while you manicure your cuticles, so it’s easier and less painful to remove dead skin.<br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Push back your cuticles. Using a wooden cuticle pusher, or an orange stick (a manicuring stick with a pointed end and a flat end) can help keep your cuticles from growing out onto your nail. Use the flat end of the orange stick to push the cuticle back, and the pointy end to run along the underside of your fingernail and remove any built up dirt.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Metal or plastic cuticle pushers should be sterilized before and after every use, and wooden orange sticks should be thrown away after every use, otherwise they can harbor bacteria.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Cut the extra skin around your nails. Using manicure nippers and manicure scissors, cut away extra, dead skin around your nails. This could include skin near your cuticle that you pushed back with the manicuring sticks, but be very careful to only cut away skin that is loose, soft and translucent, not your actual cuticles. The only skin you should cut is the part that grew out over your nail and is now loose.<br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You should not cut the skin that surrounds and protects your nail, which is your upper cuticle.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>Loose, extra skin will be white in color compared to the actual attached skin on your fingers. You only want to nip away skin that can snag on things and cause skin tears.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Apply moisturizer. Use lotions, moisturizing oils, or store bought moisturizers specifically made for cuticles to moisturize the dry areas around your nails. Rub a generous amount of moisturizer on the nail, and pay special attention to your cuticles. The entire area surrounding your nail should be coated with the moisturizer.<br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can also try applying moisturizer underneath your nails as well.</li> \n    <li>Alcohol and fragrance free moisturizers usually hydrate skin better.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Wear moisture locking gloves. Put on cotton gloves and wear them overnight. The gloves seal in the moisturizer and help heal your nails and cuticles. Remove the gloves in the morning.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails-Step-3-preview.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Fix the Skin Around Your Nails Step 3 preview.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4a/Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails-Step-3-preview.jpg/728px-Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails-Step-3-preview.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you want to improve the absorption of your moisturizer, cover it with petroleum jelly or paraffin wax to seal in the moisture. Then, put your gloves over your hands.</li> \n    <li>For better, longer lasting results, repeat this procedure every night.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Preventing Dry Cuticles\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Preventing-Dry-Cuticles\">Preventing Dry Cuticles</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Moisturize often. For smoother, hydrated skin around your nails, moisturize everyday, multiple times a day. You always want your cuticles and nails to be hydrated, because hangnails, rips, and breaks happen when your nails and cuticles are dry.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails-Step-7-Version-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Fix the Skin Around Your Nails Step 7 Version 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/dc/Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails-Step-7-Version-6.jpg/aid1975-v4-728px-Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails-Step-7-Version-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"485\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Keeping your hands moisturized is especially important in the dry, winter months.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Avoid drying agents. Dry hands are prone to cracking and peeling, so protect your hands from unnecessary exposure to activities that can dry out your skin. Avoid things like:\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Fix the Skin Around Your Nails Step 8 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/df/Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid1975-v4-728px-Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"485\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li><b>Washing dishes in hot water without gloves</b>. The hot water and soap pull out moisture from your hands. Wear gloves while you wash the dishes to protect your nails and hands. After you wash dishes, make sure your hands are fully dry.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup></li> \n    <li><b>Acetone-based nail polish remover</b>. Acetone removes important natural oils from your skin and nails.</li> \n    <li><b>Not wearing gloves in the winter months</b>. The cold, dry air during the winter dries out your skin, so protect your hands by wearing gloves.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Avoid picking your skin. Rather than picking at loose skin around your nails, soak and moisturize your hands. Picking can lead to open cuts, which can breed infections.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails-Step-9-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Fix the Skin Around Your Nails Step 9 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a0/Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails-Step-9-Version-3.jpg/aid1975-v4-728px-Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails-Step-9-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"485\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Some people pick the skin around their nails as a nervous habit. Looking into better ways to curb nervous habits, and practicing self-control can break this habit.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Keep your hands out of your mouth. Try to refrain from biting your nails or nibbling on the pieces of loose skin around the nail. Bacteria in the mouth can lead to an infection if you rip your skin around your nail, or bite your nail too low.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails-Step-10-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Fix the Skin Around Your Nails Step 10 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/34/Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails-Step-10-Version-3.jpg/aid1975-v4-728px-Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails-Step-10-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"485\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Try using a special foul-tasting ointment to keep you from putting your fingers near your mouth.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stay-Hydrated\" title=\"Stay Hydrated\">Stay hydrated</a> by drinking at least 8 glasses of fluids daily. Keeping yourself hydrated helps keep your skin, including your cuticles, soft and moist.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup> Water is your best option, and you can add flavor to your water using orange, lemon, lime, or cucumber slices. You can also increase your hydration with other fluids, such as tea or juice. Eating water-based foods such as soup and watery fruits also helps boost hydration.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Avoid-Acne-Step-14-Version-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Avoid Acne Step 14 Version 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/be/Avoid-Acne-Step-14-Version-5.jpg/aid1975-v4-728px-Avoid-Acne-Step-14-Version-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you sweat a lot, increase your fluid consumption.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy\" title=\"Eat Healthy\">Eat a healthy, balanced diet</a>. If your body is deficient on nutrients, your skin, hair, and nails all suffer. Eat plenty of lean proteins, vegetables, and fruits. To make sure your body properly absorbs nutrients, eat healthy fats.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Prevent-Acne-Step-15-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Prevent Acne Step 15 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/57/Prevent-Acne-Step-15-Version-3.jpg/aid1975-v4-728px-Prevent-Acne-Step-15-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can also take a vitamin supplement to support healthy nails. However, talk to your doctor before you take any supplements.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>File your nails. Keep your nails at a length that prevents them from getting caught and snagged on things. Pay special attention to the corners of your nails and keep them smooth, so the edges don’t injure the skin around your nail.<br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>When you do file your nails, pull the file across your nail in one, steady direction. This helps prevent splits and tears in nails that \"sawing\" (pulling the nail file back and forth) creates.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <p><br /> </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Video\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Video\">Video</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Warnings\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Warnings\">Warnings</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Never completely remove the cuticles around your nail. Any loose, dead (white) skin can be snipped at, but the whole cuticle should never be totally removed.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Related wikiHows\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Related-wikiHows\">Related wikiHows</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Take-Care-of-Your-Skin\" title=\"Take Care of Your Skin\">Take Care of Your Skin</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stop-Your-Cuticle-Skin-from-Peeling\" title=\"Stop Your Cuticle Skin from Peeling\">Stop Your Cuticle Skin from Peeling</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Give-Yourself-a-Manicure\" title=\"Give Yourself a Manicure\">Give Yourself a Manicure</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Deal-With-Peeling-Skin\" title=\"Deal With Peeling Skin\">Deal With Peeling Skin</a></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Videos provided by <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external text\" href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zfQzv9NIfeM\">myfatpocket</a></li>\n </ul> \n <p><br /> </p>\n <p><br /> </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Quick Summary\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Quick-Summary\">Quick Summary</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap\">\n  <ol class=\"references\"> \n   <li id=\"_note-1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails#_ref-1\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\">[v161425_b01]. 19 May 2020.</span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails#_ref-2\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"http://www.wisegeek.org/what-is-an-orange-stick.htm\">http://www.wisegeek.org/what-is-an-orange-stick.htm</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails#_ref-3\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\">[v161425_b01]. 19 May 2020.</span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails#_ref-4\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.mayoclinic.org/healthy-lifestyle/adult-health/in-depth/nails/art-20044954\">https://www.mayoclinic.org/healthy-lifestyle/adult-health/in-depth/nails/art-20044954</a></span> noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.webmd.com/beauty/features/hands-fingernails\">https://www.webmd.com/beauty/features/hands-fingernails</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails#_ref-6\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.webmd.com/beauty/features/caring-for-your-cuticles\">https://www.webmd.com/beauty/features/caring-for-your-cuticles</a></span> </li> \n   <li
