noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.glamour.com/story/best-nail-tips-how-to-grow-out-your-nails\">https://www.glamour.com/story/best-nail-tips-how-to-grow-out-your-nails</a></span> </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 20 Sep 2021 00:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d0/Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails-Step-1-Version-6.jpg/aid1975-v4-728px-Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails-Step-1-Version-6.jpg","linkMd5":"4081595f93b89412e16806ec5c2a81a8","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn20@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-33-739_e0330cd93e23a451.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":485,"sourceBytes":36021,"destBytes":18478,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d0/Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails-Step-1-Version-6.jpg/aid1975-v4-728px-Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails-Step-1-Version-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn20@2020_2/2021/09/27/16-55-33-739_e0330cd93e23a451.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4a/Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails-Step-3-preview.jpg/728px-Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails-Step-3-preview.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn16@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-42-285_0fe17713c51438f9.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/dc/Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails-Step-7-Version-6.jpg/aid1975-v4-728px-Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails-Step-7-Version-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn53@2020_5/2021/09/27/16-55-42-182_31dfa75df59f8fb8.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/df/Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid1975-v4-728px-Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails-Step-8-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn38@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-40-524_5f6b770d4e865574.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a0/Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails-Step-9-Version-3.jpg/aid1975-v4-728px-Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails-Step-9-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn16@2020_3/2021/09/27/16-55-40-428_722e1b55118fb180.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/34/Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails-Step-10-Version-3.jpg/aid1975-v4-728px-Fix-the-Skin-Around-Your-Nails-Step-10-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn34@2020_1/2021/09/27/16-55-40-890_68b058a8814b47f4.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/be/Avoid-Acne-Step-14-Version-5.jpg/aid1975-v4-728px-Avoid-Acne-Step-14-Version-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn38@2020_4/2021/09/27/16-55-41-058_f4f872648cec3239.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/57/Prevent-Acne-Step-15-Version-3.jpg/aid1975-v4-728px-Prevent-Acne-Step-15-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn44@2020_6/2021/09/27/16-55-39-678_2b3d90679d17fa0c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1632761719634},{"createdTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","updatedTime":"2021-09-28 00:55:19","title":"How to Crochet a Chevron Blanket","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Crocheting basic stitches can be fun, but if you need a little challenge, make your own chevron blanket. By alternating simple stitches with skipped stitches, you'll create a blanket with the classic peaks and valleys or ripple shapes. It's a great classic blanket that's easy to customize. Use soft yarn for a baby blanket or crochet with different colored yarn to make the chevrons stand out. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Casting On\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Casting-On\">Casting On</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Get out 3 skeins of super bulky yarn in any color. If you'd like to make a blanket with just 1 color, you'll need 3 skeins that are each 10.5 ounces (300 g) or in size. To make a blanket with alternating colors, choose a main color and buy 2 skeins of it. Then, pick a contrasting color and buy 1 skein of it.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-1.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Crochet a Chevron Blanket Step 1.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2e/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-1.jpg/aid11821791-v4-728px-Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-1.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Super bulky yarn is also sold as just \"bulky\" or \"roving\" yarn.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Make a slip knot and slide it onto a US size L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook. If you're using 2 colors, take the main color for your blanket and pull about of yarn from the skein. Wrap the yarn around your fingers to make a loop and pinch it so the working yarn hangs behind. Slide your crochet hook through the loop and grab the working yarn. Then, pull so the slip knot is firmly on your hook.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Crochet a Chevron Blanket Step 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7e/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-2.jpg/aid11821791-v4-728px-Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you're only using 1 color for the entire blanket, don't worry about the instructions for working with a contrasting color.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Chain 86 stitches to start the chevron blanket. For your first chain, wrap the yarn around your hook and pull it through the loop. Keep doing this until you've chained up a total of 86 stitches. This is the foundation you'll use for crocheting the blanket.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Crochet a Chevron Blanket Step 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/72/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-3.jpg/aid11821791-v4-728px-Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>86 might seem like a lot of chain stitches to count, but it goes quickly!</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Making the First Chevron Row\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Making-the-First-Chevron-Row\">Making the First Chevron Row</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Skip 1 stitch and make 2 single crochet stitches into the second chain. Don't work the chain that's closest to your hook. Instead, skip it and put your hook in the following stitch. Grab the working yarn and pull it onto the hook. Then, wrap the yarn over and pull the hook through both loops to make a single crochet (SC) stitch. Make another single crochet stitch into the same space.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Crochet a Chevron Blanket Step 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/71/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-4.jpg/aid11821791-v4-728px-Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Single crochet into each of the next 6 stitches. You're working from the edge of the blanket that will be a peak down into a low point. Keep track of your stitches so you don't accidentally make the strip of single crochet stitches too long.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Crochet a Chevron Blanket Step 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/23/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-5.jpg/aid11821791-v4-728px-Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Skip 1 stitch and single crochet into the following 6 stitches. To make your chevron point back up in a diagonal direction, skip the next stitch. Then, continue to make a single crochet stitch into the next 6 stitches of your first row.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Crochet a Chevron Blanket Step 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f8/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-6.jpg/aid11821791-v4-728px-Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>As you work, you'll see the crocheted strip begin to angle up and down diagonally.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Make 3 single crochet stitches into the next stitch. To direct the crocheted strip back down, work 3 single crochet stitches into 1 stitch. This forces the work to go down diagonally, which gives it the chevron shape.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-7.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Crochet a Chevron Blanket Step 7.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/93/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-7.jpg/aid11821791-v4-728px-Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-7.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Repeat the chevron pattern until you have 1 stitch left on row 1. Continue to single crochet across the row, but skip a stitch when you reach a valley and make 3 single crochet stitches to make a peak. Keep following this pattern until you reach the last stitch:<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-8.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Crochet a Chevron Blanket Step 8.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fd/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-8.jpg/aid11821791-v4-728px-Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-8.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>SC into 6, skip 1, SC into 6, 3 SC into next stitch</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Make 2 single crochet stitches into the last stitch of row 1. Once you've almost finished the first row, work 2 single crochet stitches into the last chain stitch on your hook. Then, turn your work so you can start row 2.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-9.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Crochet a Chevron Blanket Step 9.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3b/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-9.jpg/aid11821791-v4-728px-Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-9.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Crocheting the Second Row\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Crocheting-the-Second-Row\">Crocheting the Second Row</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Chain 1 stitch and make 2 single crochet stitches into the first stitch. Don't count the chain stitch that you just made as the first stitch. Instead, insert your hook into the first stitch of the row and work 2 single crochet stitches into the space.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-10.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Crochet a Chevron Blanket Step 10.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/27/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-10.jpg/aid11821791-v4-728px-Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-10.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Single crochet into the next 6 stitches and skip 2 stitches. Make a single crochet stitch into each of the following 6 stitches. This makes a diagonal stretch of your chevron pattern. Then, skip 2 stitches to make the valley or lowest point of the chevron.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-11.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Crochet a Chevron Blanket Step 11.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/52/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-11.jpg/aid11821791-v4-728px-Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-11.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Make a single crochet stitch into the next 6 stitches. Work single crochet stitches for the next 6 stitches to make another diagonal stretch. Keep in mind that this row runs parallel to your first row.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-12.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Crochet a Chevron Blanket Step 12.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/39/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-12.jpg/aid11821791-v4-728px-Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-12.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Work 3 single crochet stitches into the next stitch. Now that you're at the top of a diagonal stretch, make 3 single crochet stitches into the top stitch. This makes the work curve around so you can begin crocheting down at an angle.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-13.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Crochet a Chevron Blanket Step 13.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/08/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-13.jpg/aid11821791-v4-728px-Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-13.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Repeat the chevron pattern until you reach the last stitch for row 2. Keep making the chevron pattern across the rest of the row and stop when you reach the last stitch. Then, make 2 single crochet stitches into the last stitch of the row. To follow the chevron pattern, work:<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-14.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Crochet a Chevron Blanket Step 14.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/06/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-14.jpg/aid11821791-v4-728px-Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-14.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>SC into 6, skip 2, SC into 6, 3 SC into next stitch</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Working the Chevron Blanket\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Working-the-Chevron-Blanket\">Working the Chevron Blanket</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Alternate the yarn colors after 4 rows if you're using more than 1 color. To make a chevron blanket with different colors, work 4 rows in the pattern using your main color. Then, switch to a contrasting color before you work another 4 rows.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-15.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Crochet a Chevron Blanket Step 15.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a9/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-15.jpg/aid11821791-v4-728px-Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-15.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Remember to switch colors every 4 rows so your blanket has even chevron rows.</li> \n    <li>If you're only using 1 color for the whole blanket, don't worry about switching colors.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Repeat the row 2 pattern until your blanket is long. Turn your work once you reach the end of the row and just keep crocheting the pattern that you made for row 2. When you think you're blanket is almost done, lay it flat and use a measuring tape to see if it's long.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-16.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Crochet a Chevron Blanket Step 16.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1b/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-16.jpg/aid11821791-v4-728px-Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-16.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you're alternating colors, try to end the blanket so it completes 1 of the colors.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Cut the yarn tail and weave in the ends. Use scissors to cut the working yarn so there's at least a tail. Then, thread it onto a tapestry needle and weave it into the blanket.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-17.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Crochet a Chevron Blanket Step 17.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/88/Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-17.jpg/aid11821791-v4-728px-Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket-Step-17.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Don't forget to weave in the tail from the opposite end of the blanket.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>If you'd like to check your gauge, crochet 8 rows of 7 single crochet stitches. It should equal .</li> \n  <li>This pattern makes a blanket that's in size.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Things You'll Need\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Things-You'll-Need\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Things-You.27ll-Need\">Things You'll Need</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>3 skeins of super bulky yarn</li> \n  <li>US size L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook</li> \n  <li>Tapestry needle</li> \n  <li>Scissors</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Crochet-a-Chevron-Blanket&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section:
